entry.title: 【简历与面试】03 Mastering the Phone Interview-掌握电话面试
entry.content:
Mastering the Phone Interview掌握电话面试

By Peter Vogt
Monster Contributing Writer

You just got word that you landed a job interview with a company that really interests you – only there’s a slight catch.

You won’t be meeting with your interviewer(s) face to face. Instead, you’ll be taking part in a phone interview, the results of which will determine whether you’re invited to meet with company representatives in person.

Many companies use phone interviews as an initial employment screening technique for a variety of reasons. Because they’re generally brief, phone interviews save companies time. They also serve as a more realistic screening alternative for cases in which companies are considering out-of-town (or out-of-province and foreign) candidates.

So the chances are pretty good that, at some point in your job hunt, you’ll be asked to participate in a 20- to 30-minute phone interview with either one person or several people on the other end of the line. In many ways, the way you prepare for a phone interview isn’t all that different from the way you’d get ready for a face-to-face interview – save for a few slight additions to and modifications of your list of preparation tasks.

Here’s what to do:

1. Treat the phone interview seriously, just as you would a face-to-face interview.

A phone interview seems so informal on the surface that it can be easy to fall into the trap of “phoning it in” – i.e., not preparing for it as well as you would for an in-person interview. Don’t get caught with your guard down. Be sure to research the company, study the job description, and practice your responses to anticipated questions, just as you would for any other interview.

2. Have your resume and cover letter in front of you.

You’ll almost certainly be asked about some of the information that appears on these documents. You might also want to have in front of you any supporting materials that relate to information in your resume and cover letter, like documents you’ve designed or written, a portfolio of your various projects, or the written position description from your past positions.

3. Make a cheat sheet.

Jot down a few notes about the most critical points you want to make with your interviewer(s). Are there certain skills and experiences you want to emphasize? Do you have certain interests or passions you want your interviewer(s) to know about and understand? Be sure these pieces of information appear on your crib sheet. Then touch on them during the interview, even if your only chance to do so is at the end of the session when the interviewer asks you if you have any questions or anything to add.

4. Get a high-quality phone.

This isn’t the time to use a cell phone that cuts in and out, or a cheaply made phone that makes it difficult for you and your interviewer(s) to hear and understand each other.

5. Shower, groom and dress up (at least a little).

Odd advice? Perhaps. But focusing on your appearance, just as you would for a normal interview, will put you in the right frame of mind from a psychological standpoint. You won’t do as well in your phone interview if you’re lying in bed, for example, or if you’re draped over your couch in your pajamas.

6. Stand up, or at least sit up straight at a table or desk.

Again, there’s a psychological, frame of mind aspect to consider here. But on a more tangible level, research has shown that you project yourself better when you’re standing up, and you’ll feel more knowledgeable and confident.

Phone interviews can be tricky, especially since you aren’t able to read your interviewers’ nonverbal cues like facial expressions and body language during the session – a big difference from the typical interview. But if you prepare well for your phone interview, you won’t need to read anyone’s nonverbals to gauge your performance. You’ll know for sure how you’ve done because you’ll be invited to a face-to-face interview, where you’ll have yet another opportunity to prove you’re the best person for the job.

entry.content:
Software Engineer Resume Sample & Template-软件工程师简历样本

Software engineers contribute to information systems by designing and creating software solutions. They approach situations by determining the specifications of systems in question, analyzing workflows, and proposing software solutions to address wants and needs. They often work closely with vendors to obtain software licenses, test products, and approve solutions. Depending on the level of their position, software engineers may also work closely with managers or executives in order to establish or meet company goals.
软件工程师通过设计和创建软件解决方案为信息系统做出贡献。他们通过确定相关系统的规格、分析工作流程并提出软件解决方案来满足需求来处理情况。他们经常与供应商密切合作以获得软件许可证、测试产品和批准解决方案。根据职位级别，软件工程师还可能与经理或高管密切合作，以建立或实现公司目标。

A great software engineer resume should include a few essential components. First, list your responsibilities and accomplishments for each previous position while keeping in mind the job that you’re applying for. Discuss projects that you’ve completed while providing specifics about goals you’ve met. Mention languages and programs you’re familiar with to convey the skills you’ve acquired on the job. Since this position typically requires advanced problem-solving skills, be sure to communicate how you approach and address problems.
一份优秀的软件工程师简历应该包括一些重要的组成部分。首先，列出您之前每个职位的职责和成就，同时牢记您正在申请的工作。讨论您已完成的项目，同时提供有关您已实现的目标的具体信息。提及您熟悉的语言和程序，以传达您在工作中获得的技能。由于该职位通常需要高级的解决问题的技能，因此请务必传达您如何处理和解决问题。

Common Mistakes for Software Engineer Resumes
软件工程师简历的常见错误

When you’re compiling your software engineer resume, keep an eye out for some of the most common mistakes. One of the biggest errors that software engineers make is listing general accomplishments without providing specific numbers. Simply mentioning that you’ve created code and designed programs for a company isn’t enough to convey your true accomplishments. Instead, mention what you’ve accomplished, how you’ve done it, and what kind of impact the final product had.
当您编写软件工程师简历时，请留意一些最常见的错误。软件工程师犯的最大错误之一是列出一般成就而不提供具体数字。仅仅提及您为一家公司创建了代码并设计了程序并不足以传达您的真实成就。相反，提及你所取得的成就、你是如何做到的以及最终产品产生了什么样的影响。

Another common resume mistake that software engineers make is failing to specify their skill level. Most candidates already know how important it is to list programming language they know and relevant skills they’ve acquired, but software engineers at all skill levels neglect to indicate where they rank in terms of each area of expertise. Make it easy for potential employers to know where you stand by using terms like “beginner,” “intermediate” or “expert” when you mention languages and skills.
软件工程师在简历中犯的另一个常见错误是没有具体说明他们的技能水平。大多数候选人已经知道列出他们所知道的编程语言和他们所获得的相关技能是多么重要，但所有技能水平的软件工程师都忽略了他们在每个专业领域的排名。当您提到语言和技能时，使用“初学者”、“中级”或“专家”等术语，让潜在雇主更容易了解您的立场。

entry.title: 【简历与面试】01 Software Engineer 和 Software Developer 的区别
entry.content:
Software Engineer 和 Software Developer 的区别

The roles of a Software Engineer and a Software Developer can overlap significantly, but there are some distinctions in their responsibilities and definitions within the industry. Here are some common understandings and differences between these two positions:
软件工程师（Software Engineer）和软件开发人员（Software Developer）这两个职位在职责和定义上有一定的重叠，但在行业中也存在一些区别。以下是对这两个职位的一些常见理解和区别：

Software Engineer（软件工程师）

  1. Responsibilities (职责):

    • System Design and Architecture (系统设计与架构): Responsible for the overall system design and architecture, including the division of modules and definition of interfaces.
      负责系统的整体设计和架构，包括模块的划分、接口的定义等。
    • Engineering Methodologies (工程方法论): Apply engineering principles and methodologies (such as the software development lifecycle, Agile development, DevOps, etc.) to ensure high quality and maintainability of software projects.
      应用工程学原理和方法论（如软件开发生命周期、敏捷开发、DevOps等）来确保软件项目的高质量和可维护性。
    • Problem Solving (问题解决): Handle complex technical issues, design solutions, and perform performance optimizations and system tuning.
      处理复杂的技术问题，设计解决方案，并进行性能优化和系统调优。
    • Cross-team Collaboration (跨团队协作): Work closely with product managers, designers, and other engineering teams to ensure project success.
      与产品经理、设计师、其他工程师团队紧密合作，确保项目的顺利进行。

  2. Skills and Requirements (技能与要求):

    • Typically requires a strong background in mathematics and engineering.
      通常需要较强的数学和工程背景。
    • Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals such as algorithms, data structures, operating systems, and networking.
      深入理解计算机科学基础，如算法、数据结构、操作系统、网络等。
    • Proficiency in multiple programming languages and technology stacks, with the ability to quickly learn new technologies.
      擅长使用多种编程语言和技术栈，并能够快速学习新技术。

Software Developer（软件开发人员）

  1. Responsibilities (职责):

    • Coding and Implementation (编程与实现): Write code to implement specific features and requirements, developing applications or system software.
      编写代码实现特定的功能和需求，开发应用程序或系统软件。
    • Testing and Debugging (测试与调试): Conduct software testing and debugging to ensure code correctness and stability.
      进行软件测试和调试，确保代码的正确性和稳定性。
    • Documentation (文档编写): Write technical documentation and user manuals to help other developers and users understand and use the software.
      编写技术文档和用户手册，帮助其他开发者和用户理解和使用软件。
    • Code Maintenance (代码维护): Maintain and update existing codebases, fix bugs, and add new features.
      维护和更新现有代码库，修复缺陷，添加新功能。

  2. Skills and Requirements (技能与要求):

    • Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Java, Python, C++, etc.
      精通一门或几门编程语言，如 Java、Python、C++ 等。
    • Familiarity with common development tools and frameworks like Git, Docker, Spring, React, etc.
      了解常见的开发工具和框架，如 Git、Docker、Spring、React 等。
    • Strong problem-solving skills and adherence to coding standards.
      有良好的问题解决能力和代码编写规范。

Summary (总结)

Although the roles of Software Engineer and Software Developer have overlaps, generally speaking:
虽然软件工程师和软件开发人员的职责有重叠，但总体上来说：

  • Software Engineers (软件工程师) emphasize system design, architecture, and engineering practices, often dealing with broader and more complex systems.
    更强调系统的设计、架构和工程实践，通常涉及更广泛和复杂的系统。
  • Software Developers (软件开发人员) focus more on writing code and implementing features, with an emphasis on the practical aspects of software development and code quality.
    更专注于编写代码和实现功能，注重软件开发的具体实现和代码质量。

In some companies and teams, the definitions of these positions might be more blurred or used interchangeably. However, understanding these subtle differences helps in better comprehending and meeting job requirements.
在一些公司和团队中，这两个职位的定义可能会更加模糊，甚至互换使用。然而，理解这些细微差别有助于更好地理解和满足工作要求。

课程介绍

英文：He’s always as straight as an arrow, never compromises on justice.
中文：他总是正直如箭，从不在正义上妥协。

中文：他扭转了对恶棍的局势，并总是让他们面对后果。

英文：Yeah, but he’s a bit of a maverick, don’t you think?
中文：是的，但他有点特立独行，你不觉得吗？

英文：True, but that’s what makes him a diamond in the rough.
中文：没错，但这正是他与众不同的地方。

英文：Captain Solar is a real goody-goody, though.
中文：不过，太阳队长真是个好好先生。

英文：He never steps out of line.
中文：他从不越规。

英文：It’s all about finding a hero that resonates with you.
中文：关键是找到一个与你产生共鸣的英雄。

“Resonate” 是一个英语单词，常见的意思包括“共鸣”、“共振”和“产生共鸣”。以下是对该单词的详细解释和用法：

解释

  1. 共鸣/共振 (Physical Resonance)

    • 物理意义：指声波、振动等在物体之间传递，使得物体振动起来。例如，音叉的振动会使附近的另一个音叉产生共振。

  2. 产生共鸣 (Emotional/Ideological Resonance)

    • 情感或思想上的共鸣：指某个想法、观点、感觉等能引起他人的共鸣，使他人产生相似的情感或认同。例如，一首歌的歌词可能与某人的经历非常相似，从而引起共鸣。

用法

  1. 物理意义的用法：

    • The sound of the bell resonated through the hall.
    • 这声音在大厅里回荡。

  2. 情感或思想上的用法：

    • His speech resonated with the audience.

    • 他的演讲引起了观众的共鸣。

    • The movie resonated with me on a personal level.

    • 这部电影在个人层面上引起了我的共鸣。

中文对应词

  • 共鸣：在情感或思想上的理解和认同。
  • 共振：在物理上的振动传递。

例句解析

  • It’s all about finding a hero that resonates with you.
    • 翻译：关键是找到一个与你产生共鸣的英雄。
    • 解析：这里的 “resonate” 表示在情感或思想上引起共鸣，意思是找到一个你能认同或感同身受的英雄。

中文：一个真正的人，而不仅仅是穿着华丽斗篷的人。

entry.title: 【磨耳朵英语】04 英文听力训练-面试篇中级
entry.content:
【磨耳朵英语】04 英文听力训练-面试篇中级

        
        
English
  1. Can you tell me a bit about yourself.
  2. I have recently graduated with a degree in Business Administration.
  3. What are your career goals.
  4. I aim to become a project manager in a well-established company.
  5. Why did you leave your last job.
  6. I left to pursue new challenges and further my career.
  7. Can you describe a situation where you demonstrated leadership.
  8. Yes in my previous job I led a team to complete a major project.
  9. How do you handle pressure or stressful situations.
  10. I prioritize my tasks and take short breaks to maintain Focus.
  11. Tell me about a challenge you’ve faced at work and how you dealt with it.
  12. I had a situation with a tight deadline but I managed to complete the work by prioritizing tasks.
  13. Can you tell me about a time you failed.
  14. Once I didn’t meet a project deadline since then I have improved my time management skills.
  15. What kind of work environment do you prefer.
  16. I prefer a collaborative and friendly environment.
  17. Describe a time when you disagreed with your boss.
  18. We disagreed over project Direction but after a constructive conversation we found common ground.
  19. How would your friends describe you.
  20. They would say I am reliable and hardworking.
  21. What motivates you.
  22. Reaching set goals and contributing to team success motivates me.
  23. How do you handle criticism.
  24. I view criticism as a chance to improve my skills and performance.
  25. Why should we hire you.
  26. I believe my skills and enthusiasm make me a good fit for your team.
  27. What are your salary expectations.
  28. I am hoping for a salary that is commensurate with my experience and the industry standard.
  29. Do you have any questions for us.
  30. Yes what is the typical career path for someone in this position.
  31. Where do you see yourself in five years.
  32. I see myself managing a team and working on major projects in this company.
  33. How do you deal with difficult customers.
  34. I remain calm and try to understand their concerns so I can address them properly.
  35. How do you prioritize your work.
  36. I focus on the importance and urgency of tasks and set clear deadlines.
  37. Can you describe your ideal boss.
  38. My ideal boss is supportive and clear in their expectations.
  39. Are you a team player.
  40. Yes I believe collaboration is key to achieving project goals.
  41. Why do you think you are right for this job.
  42. I have the necessary skills and experience that match the job description.
  43. How do you evaluate success.
  44. I evaluate success based on meeting set goals and receiving positive feedback.
  45. Can you explain this Gap in your employment history.
  46. I took time off to further my education and improve my career prospects.
  47. How quickly do you adapt to new technology.
  48. I am a quick learner and enjoyed the challenges of adapting to new technology.
  49. Affiliations do you have any professional.
  50. Yes I am a member of the project management Institute.
  51. Can you tell me a bit about yourself.
  52. I have been working in sales for the past five years and I am looking for a new challenge.
  53. Why do you want to work for our company.
  54. I admire your company’s commitment to Innovation and I think I can contribute to your team.
  55. What are your strengths and weaknesses.
  56. I am very organized and motivated but I can sometimes be too detail-oriented.
  57. Can you describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation at work.
  58. Once I had to mediate a conflict between two team members and it was quite challenging.
  59. Are you willing to travel for work.
  60. Yes I am comfortable with occasional travel for work.
  61. How do you take initiative.
  62. I proactively look for ways to improve processes and take the lead on projects when appropriate.
  63. Have you ever had a conflict with a co-worker how did you handle it.
  64. Yes we had a disagreement about a project we had an open conversation and found a solution that worked for everyone.
  65. Can you discuss a time when you made a mistake at work.
  66. I once miscalculated a budget forecast but quickly recognized the error and fixed it.
  67. How do you keep yourself organized.
  68. I use a digital planner to keep track of tasks and deadlines.
  69. Can you tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision.
  70. I had to let a team member go because of performance issues it was tough but necessary for the team’s success.
  71. How would you describe your work Style.
  72. I would say I’m very detail-oriented and thrive in a structured environment.
  73. What has been your most significant accomplishment to date.
  74. My most significant accomplishment has been leading a project that resulted in a 15 increase in sales.
  75. Do you prefer to work alone or as part of a team.
  76. I can work in both situations but I find collaborating with a team can often yield the best results.
  77. Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult client.
  78. A client was unhappy with our service I listened to their concerns apologized and offered a solution.
  79. How do you handle tight deadlines.
  80. I break the project into manageable tasks and set a schedule to ensure I meet the deadline.
English-Chinese
Part One
  1. Can you tell me a bit about yourself.
    你能告诉我一些关于你自己的事情吗？
  2. I have recently graduated with a degree in Business Administration.
    我最近毕业了，获得了工商管理学位。
  3. What are your career goals.
    你的职业目标是什么？
  4. I aim to become a project manager in a well-established company.
    我的目标是成为一家知名公司的项目经理。
  5. Why did you leave your last job.
    你为什么离开上一份工作。
  6. I left to pursue new challenges and further my career.
    我离开是为了追求新的挑战并进一步发展我的职业生涯。
  7. Can you describe a situation where you demonstrated leadership.
    您能描述一下您展示领导力的情况吗？
  8. Yes in my previous job I led a team to complete a major project.
    是的，在我以前的工作中，我带领一个团队完成了一个重大项目。
  9. How do you handle pressure or stressful situations.
    你如何处理压力或压力情况。
  10. I prioritize my tasks and take short breaks to maintain Focus.
    我优先考虑我的任务，并短暂休息以保持专注。
  11. Tell me about a challenge you’ve faced at work and how you dealt with it.
    告诉我你在工作中遇到的一个挑战，以及你是如何应对的。
  12. I had a situation with a tight deadline but I managed to complete the work by prioritizing tasks.
    我遇到了最后期限很紧的情况，但我设法通过确定任务的优先级来完成工作。
  13. Can you tell me about a time you failed.
    你能告诉我你失败的经历吗？
  14. Once I didn’t meet a project deadline since then I have improved my time management skills.
    从那时起，一旦我没有在项目截止日期前完成，我就提高了我的时间管理技能。
  15. What kind of work environment do you prefer.
    你喜欢什么样的工作环境。
  16. I prefer a collaborative and friendly environment.
    我更喜欢协作和友好的环境。
  17. Describe a time when you disagreed with your boss.
    描述你与老板意见相左的经历。
  18. We disagreed over project Direction but after a constructive conversation we found common ground.
    我们在项目方向上存在分歧，但经过建设性的对话，我们找到了共同点。
  19. How would your friends describe you.
    你的朋友会如何形容你。
  20. They would say I am reliable and hardworking.
    他们会说我可靠和勤奋。
Part Two
  1. What motivates you.
    是什么激励着你。
  2. Reaching set goals and contributing to team success motivates me.
    实现既定目标并为团队成功做出贡献激励着我。
  3. How do you handle criticism.
    你如何处理批评。
  4. I view criticism as a chance to improve my skills and performance.
    我把批评看作是提高我的技能和表现的机会。
  5. Why should we hire you.
    我们为什么要雇用你。
  6. I believe my skills and enthusiasm make me a good fit for your team.
    我相信我的技能和热情使我非常适合您的团队。
  7. What are your salary expectations.
    你的薪水期望是多少。
  8. I am hoping for a salary that is commensurate with my experience and the industry standard.
    我希望薪水与我的经验和行业标准相称。
  9. Do you have any questions for us.
    你有什么问题要问我们吗？
  10. Yes what is the typical career path for someone in this position.
    是的，担任这个职位的人的典型职业道路是什么。
  11. Where do you see yourself in five years.
    五年后你在哪里看到自己。
  12. I see myself managing a team and working on major projects in this company.
    我看到自己在管理一个团队，并在这家公司从事重大项目。
  13. How do you deal with difficult customers.
    你如何与难缠的客户打交道。
  14. I remain calm and try to understand their concerns so I can address them properly.
    我保持冷静，并试图理解他们的担忧，以便我能够正确地解决他们。
  15. How do you prioritize your work.
    你如何确定工作的优先级。
  16. I focus on the importance and urgency of tasks and set clear deadlines.
    我专注于任务的重要性和紧迫性，并设定明确的截止日期。
  17. Can you describe your ideal boss.
    你能描述一下你理想中的老板吗？
  18. My ideal boss is supportive and clear in their expectations.
    我理想中的老板是支持他们的，并且对他们的期望很明确。
  19. Are you a team player.
    你是一个有团队精神的人吗？
  20. Yes I believe collaboration is key to achieving project goals.
    是的，我相信协作是实现项目目标的关键。
Part Three
  1. Why do you think you are right for this job.
    为什么你认为你适合这份工作。
  2. I have the necessary skills and experience that match the job description.
    我拥有与职位描述相匹配的必要技能和经验。
  3. How do you evaluate success.
    你如何评估成功。
  4. I evaluate success based on meeting set goals and receiving positive feedback.
    我根据达到既定目标和收到积极反馈来评估成功。
  5. Can you explain this Gap in your employment history.
    您能解释一下您的工作经历中的这种差距吗？
  6. I took time off to further my education and improve my career prospects.
    我抽出时间继续深造并改善我的职业前景。
  7. How quickly do you adapt to new technology.
    您适应新技术的速度有多快。
  8. I am a quick learner and enjoyed the challenges of adapting to new technology.
    我是一个快速学习的人，喜欢适应新技术的挑战。
  9. Affiliations do you have any professional.
    隶属关系 你有什么专业人士吗？
  10. Yes I am a member of the project management Institute.
    是的，我是项目管理协会的成员。
  11. Can you tell me a bit about yourself.
    你能告诉我一些关于你自己的事情吗？
  12. I have been working in sales for the past five years and I am looking for a new challenge.
    在过去的五年里，我一直在从事销售工作，我正在寻找新的挑战。
  13. Why do you want to work for our company.
    你为什么想在我们公司工作。
  14. I admire your company’s commitment to Innovation and I think I can contribute to your team.
    我钦佩贵公司对创新的承诺，我认为我可以为贵公司做出贡献。
  15. What are your strengths and weaknesses.
    你的长处和短处是什么。
  16. I am very organized and motivated but I can sometimes be too detail-oriented.
    我非常有条理和积极性，但有时我可能过于注重细节。
  17. Can you describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation at work.
    你能描述一下你不得不处理工作困难的情况吗？
  18. Once I had to mediate a conflict between two team members and it was quite challenging.
    有一次，我不得不调解两个团队成员之间的冲突，这非常具有挑战性。
  19. Are you willing to travel for work.
    你愿意出差吗？
  20. Yes I am comfortable with occasional travel for work.
    是的，我对偶尔出差感到满意。
Part Four
  1. How do you take initiative.
    你如何采取主动。
  2. I proactively look for ways to improve processes and take the lead on projects when appropriate.
    我积极寻找改进流程的方法，并在适当的时候领导项目。
  3. Have you ever had a conflict with a co-worker how did you handle it.
    你有没有和同事发生过冲突，你是如何处理的。
  4. Yes we had a disagreement about a project we had an open conversation and found a solution that worked for everyone.
    是的，我们对一个项目存在分歧，我们进行了公开对话，并找到了适合所有人的解决方案。
  5. Can you discuss a time when you made a mistake at work.
    你能谈谈你在工作中犯错的时候吗？
  6. I once miscalculated a budget forecast but quickly recognized the error and fixed it.
    我曾经错误地计算了预算预测，但很快就意识到了错误并进行了修复。
  7. How do you keep yourself organized.
    你如何让自己井井有条。
  8. I use a digital planner to keep track of tasks and deadlines.
    我使用数字规划器来跟踪任务和截止日期。
  9. Can you tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult decision.
    你能告诉我你不得不做出艰难决定的经历吗？
  10. I had to let a team member go because of performance issues it was tough but necessary for the team’s success.
    由于绩效问题，我不得不让一名团队成员离开，这很艰难，但对于团队的成功来说是必要的。
  11. How would you describe your work Style.
    你会如何描述你的工作风格。
  12. I would say I’m very detail-oriented and thrive in a structured environment.
    我会说我非常注重细节，并且在结构化的环境中茁壮成长。
  13. What has been your most significant accomplishment to date.
    迄今为止，您最重要的成就是什么？
  14. My most significant accomplishment has been leading a project that resulted in a 15 increase in sales.
    我最重要的成就是领导了一个项目，该项目的销售额增长了 15%。
  15. Do you prefer to work alone or as part of a team.
    您更喜欢独自工作还是作为团队的一员。
  16. I can work in both situations but I find collaborating with a team can often yield the best results.
    我可以在这两种情况下工作，但我发现与团队合作通常可以产生最好的结果。
  17. Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult client.
    告诉我你不得不与一个难缠的客户打交道的经历。
  18. A client was unhappy with our service I listened to their concerns apologized and offered a solution.
    一位客户对我们的服务不满意，我听取了他们的担忧，道歉并提供了解决方案。
  19. How do you handle tight deadlines.
    你如何处理紧迫的最后期限。
  20. I break the project into manageable tasks and set a schedule to ensure I meet the deadline.
    我将项目分解为可管理的任务，并设定一个时间表，以确保我在最后期限前完成。

entry.title: 【磨耳朵英语】03 英语练习-60英文长句-助你“听懂搞不定的长句”
entry.content:
【磨耳朵英语】03 英语练习-60英文长句-助你“听懂搞不定的长句”

        
        
English
  1. It doesn’t matter how well qualified you are, if your face doesn’t fit, you don’t stand a chance.
  2. In all our restaurants, smoking and non-smoking areas are segregated from each other.
  3. I’m really sorry I’m late, Andrew. I forgot to set my alarm and I overslept.
  4. We welcome you to join us on a special tour which explores this unique Australian attraction.
  5. When we take many short vacation breaks, it gives us the opportunity to reboot our mental and emotional system.
  6. I just came back from a quick getaway and it was such a worthwhile experience.
  7. I came back from this trip totally satisfied, refreshed and ready for normal life again.
  8. I stayed at a very reasonably priced hotel in Montreal and my credit card got me a very nice discount.
  9. The chain of hotel I stayed at provides free breakfasts in the morning, which helped me save on my meals.
  10. On this trip, I got to catch up with my New York friends whom I see maybe only once per year.
  11. There should be plenty of time to go shopping before we leave Sydney.
  12. I went to New York last year, and I also spent some time in Washington.
  13. I would like to discuss this project with you. if you are free sometime this week, let’s meet for lunch.
  14. Our company has its base in Vancouver, and branch offices all over the world.
  15. I locked myself out of our apartment and had to break in. I’m sorry. how careless of me.
  16. It’s no trouble at all; on the contrary, it will be a great pleasure to help you.
  17. What do you mean you can’t do it? It’ll be like shooting fish in a barrel.
  18. This won’t do any good; on the contrary, it will make things even worse.
  19. It is not an idea around which the community can unite. on the contrary, I see it as one that will divide us.
  20. Mobile phones are inherently insecure, as anyone can listen to and record conversations.
  21. Could we take a walk? I feel like a little exercise. it’s a relief to get out of the office once in a while.
  22. Cooking up a quick dish doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice flavor. nor does fast food have to be junk food.
  23. Don’t worry. you’ll get used to it soon. all artists have their own unique characteristics.
  24. All the artists have their own preferences and styles. without preference, there would be no art.
  25. I dumped my boyfriend for another guy and I want him back. is it possible.
  26. My boyfriend left me for someone else after five years together and I took him back.
  27. What do you need your own computer for? You are welcome to use ours.
  28. Don’t take it personally. you can’t stop people from saying what they think.
  29. Go away. don’t distract me. if I don’t get this finished in time, I’ll be in trouble.
  30. I don’t get lonely now because I make the effort to see people. why don’t you try talking to people.
  31. That is all I know about them. I don’t really get a lot of information, and if I do I get it off mark.
  32. It’s not a pleasant feeling to discover you’ve been cheated by someone you trusted.
  33. Well, never mind, John, it’s not a matter of life and death. so let it go. there’s nothing you can do about it.
  34. An unsuitable bed is likely cause of back trouble. if the bed is soft, it will allow your body to sink into the bed.
  35. If the mattress is too firm, it will push on your pressure points and cause back trouble.
  36. Obviously, any child who receives dedicated teaching over an extended period is likely to improve.
  37. Why don’t you settle your differences and be friends again? Tell me what happened between you and matt.
  38. It wasn’t easy at first, but now I have established a good working relationship with my boss.
  39. From my point of view you are right。 I can’t agree with you more. you should be more confident in yourself.
  40. I suppose your presence here today is not entirely coincidental. what do you want exactly.
  41. Save your time and energy to persuade me to change my mind. now get out of my face.
  42. There are two ways of payment. credit card or bank transfer. how would you like to pay.
  43. Everybody has different music tastes, but I think we can all agree that we love Christmas music.
  44. Now, you can watch your favorite hallmark channel Christmas movies and all new premieres 24 hours seven days a week.
  45. Now that it is December, we’re counting down the days until Christmas. I can’t wait for that day to come.
  46. Christmas it’s our favorite time of the year, even though it involves spending all of our money on gifts and presents.
  47. Would you care for some tea, or even a light meal, to fortify yourself before your adventure.
  48. The woman who called yesterday wants to buy our house. what do you think.
  49. Don’t give up hope. the situation may improve but if the worst comes to the worst I’ll have to sell the house.
  50. If the worst comes to the worst and you lose your job, at least I will still be working.
  51. I mean don’t get me wrong. Jenny is my best friend, but she can be kind of a pain sometimes.
  52. One of my favorite things to do during every holiday. I get to decorate my dorm any way I want.
  53. I don’t know about you, but I love baking, especially during the holidays. baking is so much fun.
  54. You’ve made remarkable progress, considering you only started last week.
  55. He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
  56. We’ll have to be careful with money but that doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy ourselves.
  57. This is a cheap and simple process however there are dangers we have to be careful not to cause any trouble.
  58. The most likely outcome may be to subcontract much of the work to an outsider.
  59. We arrived home early and surprised a burglar trying to break in.
  60. It may take years to be completely accepted by the local community.
English-Chinese
Part One
  1. It doesn’t matter how well qualified you are, if your face doesn’t fit, you don’t stand a chance.
    不管你有多合格，如果你的脸不合适，你就没有机会。
  2. In all our restaurants, smoking and non-smoking areas are segregated from each other.
    在我们所有的餐厅中，吸烟区和非吸烟区都是分开的。
  3. I’m really sorry I’m late, Andrew. I forgot to set my alarm and I overslept.
    对不起，我来晚了，安德鲁。 我忘了设置闹钟，睡过头了。
  4. We welcome you to join us on a special tour which explores this unique Australian attraction.
    我们欢迎您加入我们的特别之旅，探索这个独特的澳大利亚景点。
  5. When we take many short vacation breaks, it gives us the opportunity to reboot our mental and emotional system.
    当我们有许多短暂的假期休息时，它给了我们重新启动心理和情绪系统的机会。
  6. I just came back from a quick getaway and it was such a worthwhile experience.
    我刚从快速度假回来，这是一次非常值得的经历。
  7. I came back from this trip totally satisfied, refreshed and ready for normal life again.
    我从这次旅行回来时完全满意，精神焕发，准备再次过正常生活。
  8. I stayed at a very reasonably priced hotel in Montreal and my credit card got me a very nice discount.
    我住在蒙特利尔一家价格非常合理的酒店，我的信用卡给了我一个非常好的折扣。
  9. The chain of hotel I stayed at provides free breakfasts in the morning, which helped me save on my meals.
    我住的连锁酒店早上提供免费早餐，这帮助我节省了餐费。
  10. On this trip, I got to catch up with my New York friends whom I see maybe only once per year.
    在这次旅行中，我赶上了我的纽约朋友，我可能每年只见到他们一次。
  11. There should be plenty of time to go shopping before we leave Sydney.
    在我们离开悉尼之前，应该有足够的时间去购物。
  12. I went to New York last year, and I also spent some time in Washington.
    我去年去了纽约，在华盛顿也呆了一段时间。
  13. I would like to discuss this project with you. if you are free sometime this week, let’s meet for lunch.
    我想和你讨论这个项目。如果你本周有空，让我们一起吃午饭。
  14. Our company has its base in Vancouver, and branch offices all over the world.
    我们公司在温哥华设有总部，并在世界各地设有分支机构。
  15. I locked myself out of our apartment and had to break in. I’m sorry. how careless of me.
    我把自己锁在公寓外面，不得不闯进去。 对不起。我多么粗心。
  16. It’s no trouble at all; on the contrary, it will be a great pleasure to help you.
    一点也不麻烦;相反，很高兴能为您提供帮助。
  17. What do you mean you can’t do it? It’ll be like shooting fish in a barrel.
    你什么意思你做不到？ 这就像在桶里射鱼一样。
  18. This won’t do any good; on the contrary, it will make things even worse.
    这不会有任何好处;相反，它会让事情变得更糟。
  19. It is not an idea around which the community can unite. on the contrary, I see it as one that will divide us.
    这不是一个社区可以团结起来的想法。相反，我认为它会分裂我们。
  20. Mobile phones are inherently insecure, as anyone can listen to and record conversations.
    手机本质上是不安全的，因为任何人都可以收听和记录对话。
Part Two
  1. Could we take a walk? I feel like a little exercise. it’s a relief to get out of the office once in a while.
    我们可以散散步吗？ 我感觉像是锻炼了一下。偶尔走出办公室是一种解脱。
  2. Cooking up a quick dish doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice flavor. nor does fast food have to be junk food.
    做一道快餐并不意味着你必须牺牲味道。快餐也不一定是垃圾食品。
  3. Don’t worry. you’ll get used to it soon. all artists have their own unique characteristics.
    不用担心。你很快就会习惯的。所有艺术家都有自己独特的特点。
  4. All the artists have their own preferences and styles. without preference, there would be no art.
    所有的艺术家都有自己的喜好和风格。没有偏好，就没有艺术。
  5. I dumped my boyfriend for another guy and I want him back. is it possible.
    我把我的男朋友甩给了另一个男人，我希望他回来。有可能吗？
  6. My boyfriend left me for someone else after five years together and I took him back.
    我的男朋友在一起五年后离开了我，我把他带回来了。
  7. What do you need your own computer for? You are welcome to use ours.
    你需要自己的电脑做什么？ 欢迎您使用我们的。
  8. Don’t take it personally. you can’t stop people from saying what they think.
    不要把它当成个人。你无法阻止人们说出他们的想法。
  9. Go away. don’t distract me. if I don’t get this finished in time, I’ll be in trouble.
    走开。不要分散我的注意力。如果我不及时完成这项工作，我会有麻烦的。
  10. I don’t get lonely now because I make the effort to see people. why don’t you try talking to people.
    我现在不寂寞了，因为我努力去见人。你为什么不试着与人交谈。
  11. That is all I know about them. I don’t really get a lot of information, and if I do I get it off mark.
    这就是我对他们的全部了解。 我真的没有得到很多信息，如果我得到，我就会得到它。
  12. It’s not a pleasant feeling to discover you’ve been cheated by someone you trusted.
    发现自己被你信任的人欺骗了，这不是一种愉快的感觉。
  13. Well, never mind, John, it’s not a matter of life and death. so let it go. there’s nothing you can do about it.
    好吧，没关系，约翰，这不是生死攸关的问题。所以放手吧。你对此无能为力。
  14. An unsuitable bed is likely cause of back trouble. if the bed is soft, it will allow your body to sink into the bed.
    不合适的床可能是背部问题的原因。如果床是软的，它会让你的身体沉入床上。
  15. If the mattress is too firm, it will push on your pressure points and cause back trouble.
    如果床垫太硬，它会压到您的压力点并导致背部问题。
  16. Obviously, any child who receives dedicated teaching over an extended period is likely to improve.
    显然，任何长期接受专门教学的孩子都有可能进步。
  17. Why don’t you settle your differences and be friends again? Tell me what happened between you and matt.
    你为什么不解决分歧，重新成为朋友呢？ 告诉我你和马特之间发生了什么。
  18. It wasn’t easy at first, but now I have established a good working relationship with my boss.
    一开始并不容易，但现在我已经和老板建立了良好的工作关系。
  19. From my point of view you are right。 I can’t agree with you more. you should be more confident in yourself.
    在我看来，你是对的。 我完全同意你的看法。你应该对自己更有信心。
  20. I suppose your presence here today is not entirely coincidental. what do you want exactly.
    我想你今天来到这里并不完全是巧合。你到底想要什么。
Part Three
  1. Save your time and energy to persuade me to change my mind. now get out of my face.
    节省你的时间和精力来说服我改变主意。现在离开我的脸。
  2. There are two ways of payment. credit card or bank transfer. how would you like to pay.
    有两种付款方式。信用卡或银行转账。您希望如何付款。
  3. Everybody has different music tastes, but I think we can all agree that we love Christmas music.
    每个人都有不同的音乐品味，但我想我们都同意我们喜欢圣诞音乐。
  4. Now, you can watch your favorite hallmark channel Christmas movies and all new premieres 24 hours seven days a week.
    现在，您可以每周 7 天 24 小时观看您最喜爱的标志性频道圣诞电影和所有新的首映式。
  5. Now that it is December, we’re counting down the days until Christmas. I can’t wait for that day to come.
    现在是 12 月，我们正在倒计时圣诞节的日子。 我迫不及待地想看到那一天的到来。
  6. Christmas it’s our favorite time of the year, even though it involves spending all of our money on gifts and presents.
    圣诞节是我们一年中最喜欢的时间，尽管它涉及将我们所有的钱都花在礼物和礼物上。
  7. Would you care for some tea, or even a light meal, to fortify yourself before your adventure.
    你会在冒险前喝点茶，甚至是一顿便餐来强化自己吗？
  8. The woman who called yesterday wants to buy our house. what do you think.
    昨天打电话的女人想买我们的房子。你觉得怎么样。
  9. Don’t give up hope. the situation may improve but if the worst comes to the worst I’ll have to sell the house.
    不要放弃希望。情况可能会有所改善，但如果最坏的情况发生，我将不得不卖掉房子。
  10. If the worst comes to the worst and you lose your job, at least I will still be working.
    如果最坏的情况来了，你失去了工作，至少我还会工作。
  11. I mean don’t get me wrong. Jenny is my best friend, but she can be kind of a pain sometimes.
    我的意思是不要误会我的意思。 珍妮是我最好的朋友，但她有时会有点痛苦。
  12. One of my favorite things to do during every holiday. I get to decorate my dorm any way I want.
    每个假期我最喜欢做的事情之一。 我可以随心所欲地装饰我的宿舍。
  13. I don’t know about you, but I love baking, especially during the holidays. baking is so much fun.
    我不了解你，但我喜欢烘焙，尤其是在假期。烘焙真是太有趣了。
  14. You’ve made remarkable progress, considering you only started last week.
    考虑到你上周才开始，你已经取得了显着的进步。
  15. He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
    他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人欺骗了。
  16. We’ll have to be careful with money but that doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy ourselves.
    我们必须小心金钱，但这并不意味着我们不能享受自己。
  17. This is a cheap and simple process however there are dangers we have to be careful not to cause any trouble.
    这是一个便宜而简单的过程，但是存在危险，我们必须小心不要造成任何麻烦。
  18. The most likely outcome may be to subcontract much of the work to an outsider.
    最有可能的结果可能是将大部分工作分包给外部人员。
  19. We arrived home early and surprised a burglar trying to break in.
    我们很早就到家了，一个试图闯入的窃贼感到惊讶。
  20. It may take years to be completely accepted by the local community.
    可能需要数年时间才能被当地社区完全接受。

entry.title: 【磨耳朵英语】02 英文听力-中级篇-英国人正常语速
entry.content:
【磨耳朵英语】02 英文听力-中级篇-英国人正常语速

        
        
English
  1. Turn left at the intersection and Starbucks will be on your right.
  2. May I please have a black coffee with a splash of milk.
  3. A cold front warning was just issued a few minutes ago.
  4. You should make exercise part of your daily routine.
  5. Is there anything in particular you would like to tell me.
  6. We have been having heavy showers on an off all day.
  7. She is a talkative person so she can make friends everywhere.
  8. You will be in hot water if you continue to be late for work.
  9. I’ve lost my appetite because of my aching tooth.
  10. You keep making the same mistakes time after time.
  11. A great way to eat fruit and vegetables together is in a salad.
  12. The dessert will spoil if you don’t keep it in the fridge.
  13. These eggs had gone stale because they were bought two weeks ago.
  14. The departure gate for your flight has been changed to c25.
  15. Please cover your mouth with a tissue when you sneeze all right.
  16. There are five members in my family and I am the youngest one.
  17. We put Emma on a dating app and we’re seeing what’s out there.
  18. Have you seen the remote control for the tv anywhere.
  19. We’ve spoken on the phone but never face to face.
  20. The medicine left a bitter taste in the back of my throat.
  21. Would you mind buying me a bottle of soy sauce on the way home.
  22. We also need a carton of eggs and a pack of toilet paper rolls.
  23. These waffles are crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside.
  24. Can we stop fighting and deal with this issue peacefully.
  25. An escape room is a great thing to try with a bunch of friends.
  26. Salt water is a good home remedy for a sore throat.
  27. She looked weak because she went on a diet for half a month.
  28. My dad warned me not to hang out with friends in the evening.
  29. It’s cheaper to travel during the off peak season.
  30. Take some hand warmers in case the weather is extremely cold.
  31. There is an earthquake preparation practice next Sunday.
  32. Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.
  33. The doctor said my leg should be better in a couple of days.
  34. If you speed up your work we can finish before it is dark.
  35. She always tried to dress down on her first date with a man.
  36. You shouldn’t just assume things without getting all the facts.
  37. I have an appointment with my dentist for a teeth cleaning tomorrow.
  38. He just cannot tolerate any back talk from his children.
  39. She looked absolutely fabulous in her dress.
  40. Sorry I’d like to cancel my reservation for Wednesday evening.
  41. Encourage your child to read all kinds of books for fun.
  42. There are big sales going on all week in this Supermarket.
  43. The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.
  44. You have slight diara avoid eating foods that are too oily or fried.
  45. She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends.
  46. Do not drink cold drinks or eat hot food after a tooth extraction.
  47. There is a 20 kilo luggage allowance on most flights.
  48. Do you know of any good restaurants around our hotel.
  49. My boss is generous and treats us to dinner every month.
  50. I can’t believe it’s our 10th wedding anniversary next week.
  51. I always have a splitting headache when I have a high fever.
  52. Those scrumptious chocolates are so hard to resist.
  53. These pills and capsules didn’t take effect immediately.
  54. I like to try different kinds of street food when I travel to another country.
  55. She gives her child a warm hug before he goes to bed every night.
  56. You should rinse your mouth every morning for oral hygiene.
  57. The deposit I made does not match my receipt what should I do.
  58. Please have your boarding passes ready for inspection.
  59. You should make a shopping list so that you don’t buy anything impulsively.
  60. We’ve still got a sporting chance of winning.
  61. Clicking on this link will open a new browser window.
  62. Some passengers were suffering from severe seasickness.
  63. I hear you have been busy renovating your house.
  64. The police refused to accept her version of the story.
  65. You will need permission from your parents to go on the trip.
  66. We often quarrel but we always make it up soon after.
  67. We had the whole house decorated while we were away.
  68. You should learn to live with your feet on the ground.
  69. I have my umbrella with me whether it rains or not.
  70. You’d better tidy up the living room before Mom comes back.
  71. Most jobs are only advertised online nowadays.
  72. I prefer surfing the internet at home to watching the sunrise.
  73. This medicine must be taken on an empty stomach.
  74. Teenagers have a different sense of value than the older generation.
  75. Before the film I bought some popcorn and a drink at the snack bar.
  76. You can buy a variety of food and household items in the supermarket.
  77. You’ll make yourself horse if you keep shouting like that.
  78. It seems that your heartbeat is much quicker than it should be.
  79. I’d like to buy everyone a round of drinks to celebrate my promotion.
  80. Remember not to throw the cigarette butts into the dust bin directly.
  81. The first day we met I noticed that you were too nervous to talk to me.
  82. Jennifer is such a cute girl with a sunny personality.
  83. They spend much of their Leisure Time with their grandchildren.
  84. There’s only a fortnite left to get your applications in.
  85. There will be an extra charge for any additional passengers.
  86. I’ll mention the problem at the upcoming staff meeting.
  87. The bakery has some mouthwatering Savory snacks.
  88. Getting everyone to use the new technology will be tricky.
  89. She was complaining about her nosy parents.
  90. We’re going out to choose some new wallpaper for the bedroom.
  91. Amanda can be rude sometimes but she doesn’t always mean to be.
  92. What’s the best way to get to the amusement park from here.
  93. The little girl spent a whole day preparing the present for her mother.
  94. The boss promised me that he will give serious thought to this matter.
  95. You have to enter a post code when ordering online.
  96. The value of the ring is much greater than its price.
  97. It took us only 4 minutes to get through the customs.
  98. My dad nearly burst a blood vessel when he saw my tattoo.
  99. The waterfall is so loud that you can’t think about anything else.
  100. She always washes her her hands first as soon as she gets home.
  101. I’d like to exchange US dollars for euros what’s the exchange rate.
  102. Dad made us delectable fried eggs and bacon for breakfast.
  103. Would you quit your job if you inherited lots of money.
  104. It’s hard not to be affected by her enthusiasm and cheerfulness.
  105. Durian has a creamy texture with a sweet and savory flavor.
  106. I have some crafty ideas for getting around the regulations.
  107. His success came from good interpersonal skills.
  108. Due to global warming the weather is getting warmer and warmer in winter.
  109. I want to have a dog but I can’t have it because I live in an apartment.
  110. The egg tart had a flaky pastry crust with a creamy filling.
  111. I was gobsmacked when the teacher told me that there was an exam this morning.
  112. He was gutted when his girlfriend broke up with him.
English-Chinese
Part One
  1. Turn left at the intersection and Starbucks will be on your right.
    在十字路口左转，星巴克就在您的右边。
  2. May I please have a black coffee with a splash of milk.
    请允许我喝一杯黑咖啡和一点牛奶。
  3. A cold front warning was just issued a few minutes ago.
    几分钟前刚刚发布了冷锋警告。
  4. You should make exercise part of your daily routine.
    您应该将锻炼作为日常生活的一部分。
  5. Is there anything in particular you would like to tell me.
    你有什么特别想告诉我的吗？
  6. We have been having heavy showers on an off all day.
    我们一整天都在下大雨。
  7. She is a talkative person so she can make friends everywhere.
    她是一个健谈的人，所以她可以在任何地方结交朋友。
  8. You will be in hot water if you continue to be late for work.
    如果你继续上班迟到，你会陷入困境。
  9. I’ve lost my appetite because of my aching tooth.
    由于牙齿疼痛，我失去了食欲。
  10. You keep making the same mistakes time after time.
    你一次又一次地犯同样的错误。
  11. A great way to eat fruit and vegetables together is in a salad.
    一起吃水果和蔬菜的一个好方法是沙拉。
  12. The dessert will spoil if you don’t keep it in the fridge.
    如果你不把它放在冰箱里，甜点会变质。
  13. These eggs had gone stale because they were bought two weeks ago.
    这些鸡蛋已经变质了，因为它们是两周前买的。
  14. The departure gate for your flight has been changed to c25.
    您航班的登机口已更改为 c25。
  15. Please cover your mouth with a tissue when you sneeze all right.
    打喷嚏时请用纸巾捂住嘴巴。
  16. There are five members in my family and I am the youngest one.
    我家有五个成员，我是最小的一个。
  17. We put Emma on a dating app and we’re seeing what’s out there.
    我们把艾玛放在一个约会应用程序上，我们看到那里有什么。
  18. Have you seen the remote control for the tv anywhere.
    你有没有在任何地方看到电视的遥控器。
  19. We’ve spoken on the phone but never face to face.
    我们通过电话交谈，但从未面对面。
  20. The medicine left a bitter taste in the back of my throat.
    药在我的喉咙后部留下了苦涩的味道。
Part Two
  1. Would you mind buying me a bottle of soy sauce on the way home.
    你介意在回家的路上给我买一瓶酱油吗？
  2. We also need a carton of eggs and a pack of toilet paper rolls.
    我们还需要一盒鸡蛋和一包卫生纸卷。
  3. These waffles are crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside.
     这些华夫饼外面酥脆，但里面又软又蓬松。
  4. Can we stop fighting and deal with this issue peacefully.
    我们能否停止战斗，和平处理这个问题。
  5. An escape room is a great thing to try with a bunch of friends.
    密室逃脱是与一群朋友一起尝试的一件好事。
  6. Salt water is a good home remedy for a sore throat.
     盐水是治疗喉咙痛的良好家庭疗法。
  7. She looked weak because she went on a diet for half a month.
    她看起来很虚弱，因为她节食了半个月。
  8. My dad warned me not to hang out with friends in the evening.
    我爸爸警告我晚上不要和朋友出去玩。
  9. It’s cheaper to travel during the off peak season.
     在淡季旅行更便宜。
  10. Take some hand warmers in case the weather is extremely cold.
    带上一些暖手器，以防天气非常寒冷。
  11. There is an earthquake preparation practice next Sunday.
    下周日有地震准备练习。
  12. Tomorrow will be cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle.
      明天多云，有阵雨和毛毛雨。
  13. The doctor said my leg should be better in a couple of days.
    医生说我的腿应该过几天就好了。
  14. If you speed up your work we can finish before it is dark.
    如果您加快工作速度，我们可以在天黑之前完成。
  15. She always tried to dress down on her first date with a man.
      她总是试图在与男人的第一次约会时打扮得体。
  16. You shouldn’t just assume things without getting all the facts.
    你不应该在没有了解所有事实的情况下就假设事情。
  17. I have an appointment with my dentist for a teeth cleaning tomorrow.
    我和牙医预约明天进行牙齿清洁。
  18. He just cannot tolerate any back talk from his children.
      他只是不能容忍孩子们的任何背地里话。
  19. She looked absolutely fabulous in her dress.
    她穿着裙子看起来非常棒。
  20. Sorry I’d like to cancel my reservation for Wednesday evening.
    对不起，我想取消周三晚上的预订。
Part Three
  1. Encourage your child to read all kinds of books for fun.
    鼓励您的孩子阅读各种书籍以获得乐趣。
  2. There are big sales going on all week in this Supermarket.
    这家超市整周都在进行大促销活动。
  3. The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.
     房间里的气氛太闷了，我几乎无法呼吸。
  4. You have slight diara avoid eating foods that are too oily or fried.
    你有轻微的腹泻，避免吃太油腻或油炸的食物。
  5. She spends hours on the phone chatting to her friends.
    她花了几个小时在电话上和她的朋友聊天。
  6. Do not drink cold drinks or eat hot food after a tooth extraction.
     拔牙后不要喝冷饮或吃热食。
  7. There is a 20 kilo luggage allowance on most flights.
    大多数航班的行李限额为 20 公斤。
  8. Do you know of any good restaurants around our hotel.
    您知道我们酒店周围有什么好餐厅吗？
  9. My boss is generous and treats us to dinner every month.
     我的老板很慷慨，每个月都会请我们吃饭。
  10. I can’t believe it’s our 10th wedding anniversary next week.
    我简直不敢相信下周就是我们结婚10周年纪念日了。
  11. I always have a splitting headache when I have a high fever.
    发高烧时，我总是头痛欲裂。
  12. Those scrumptious chocolates are so hard to resist.
      那些美味的巧克力是如此难以抗拒。
  13. These pills and capsules didn’t take effect immediately.
    这些药丸和胶囊并没有立即生效。
  14. I like to try different kinds of street food when I travel to another country.
    当我去另一个国家旅行时，我喜欢尝试不同种类的街头食品。
  15. She gives her child a warm hug before he goes to bed every night.
      每天晚上睡觉前，她都会给孩子一个温暖的拥抱。
  16. You should rinse your mouth every morning for oral hygiene.
    您应该每天早上漱口以保持口腔卫生。
  17. The deposit I made does not match my receipt what should I do.
    我存入的存款与我的收据不符，我该怎么办。
  18. Please have your boarding passes ready for inspection.
      请准备好您的登机牌以供检查。
  19. You should make a shopping list so that you don’t buy anything impulsively.
    你应该列出一个购物清单，这样你就不会冲动地买任何东西。
  20. We’ve still got a sporting chance of winning.
    我们仍然有获胜的机会。
Part Four
  1. Clicking on this link will open a new browser window.
    单击此链接将打开一个新的浏览器窗口。
  2. Some passengers were suffering from severe seasickness.
    一些乘客患有严重的晕船症。
  3. I hear you have been busy renovating your house.
     我听说你一直在忙着装修你的房子。
  4. The police refused to accept her version of the story.
    警方拒绝接受她的说法。

entry.title: 【英语泛听】01 如何像本地人一样说英语？
entry.content:
【英语泛听】01 如何像本地人一样说英语？

        
        
English
My story starts in Moscow.I was 15 years old.
My best friend and I, we were part of a group of Westerners,visiting the Soviet Union.This was in 1987,a few years before the fall of the communist regime.
We were given an official tour guide who was assigned to us.
And the tour would start in the morning,and we were checked in to our hotel rooms for the night.
My friend said to me, ‘’Let’s go outside and look at the city.’’
I thought it was a great idea.
Dumb idea.
So we grabbed our coats, and we snuck out past security and into the street.
We found the entrance to the metro.
The Moscow underground transportation system is the deepest one in the world.
The ride down the escalator took a full minute.
Once we were down there, my friend headed right to an open train,and I pulled him back and said, ‘Wait!
Let’s write down the name of the station so we can find our way back.’So I had a notepad, and I took a notepad,and I wrote down the letters of the station,and we hopped down the train and went on train hopping.
And that was fun because -Well, actually, it was weird.
There were a lot of people, probably all coming home from work.
They were all dressed in brown and gray clothes,and it looked very, very different from what we were used to at home.
But the stations were lovely.
There were stations with statues, with paintings on the wall,and glass displays.
It was really like museums.
We would never have expected that.
And everything was perfectly clean.
Well,what was weird though is that the people - nobody seemed to speak,and everyone seemed to be looking at us and it kind of weirded us out.
So after about 20-30 minutes,we’d had enough and we wanted to go home.
I showed my note to someone and they directed me over there.
Then over there, I showed my note to another person,and they directed us to the other way.
And then a third person directed us sideways.
That was a little confusing.
Aw, then I saw it.
Over the stairs, the sign.
It turned out I had written down the Russian word for ‘Exit.’So we headed upstairs and we found a taxi.
That was great.
And we told the driver, you know, ‘Intourist Hotel,’and then he was willing to take us.
And I remember sitting next to the driver, handing him 50 rubles.
And he looked at me and he said,(Russian) No, dollar!
Fifty dollars?
That was like I don’t know 20 times that amount or something.
That was not an option for us.
So we had to get out of the taxi,and he drove away, leaving us standing there.
It was a cold night,and you know everything was strange for us,and we were teenagers,and we were pretty nervous, didn’t know what to do.
Well, we started walking.
We walked to the end of the block.
We turned the corner.
And 200 yards in front of us, the Intourist Hotel.Well, this experience affected me in two ways.
The first is that anytime after this trip that I would hear anyone speak Russian,I was just cringe.
And the second one is that it taught me the importanceof understanding the local language when you’re traveling.
And it actually led to me learning another four languages fluentlyover the following years.
Now, before I go on, I’d like to know in the audience -Can we have a little bit of light maybe in the audience?
I’d just like to know who’s -By a show of hands, who is not a native English speaker?
It must be 99%.
Anyone who doesn’t speak English, stand up!
Alright, so I can assumeall of you have, you know, gone through the process of learning a language.
Anybody who speaks three or more languages?
Wow, that’s maybe 70%.
Four or more languages, anyone?
That’s still quite a bit.
Anyone speak five or more languages?
Wow, come see me during the break.
To me, learning a language is…
For me, it’s like a deck of playing cards lying faced down on the table.
As you start learning and understanding, the cards start opening up for you.
Now there’s no standard way of classifying this.
But as you learn, you reach certain milestones.
And the first one would be when about 25% of the cards are turned up,you reach like a basic level.
At this level, you have a base vocabulary, some grammar,and you’re able to have maybe very simple conversationsand communicate a little bit.
And your study goes on until you reach this magical point of fluency,what we call being fluent in the language.
Now what does it mean, being fluent in a language?
It means that you’ve turned up more than 50% of the cards in the deck,and that is the point where you have -where the language becomes part of your subconsciousso that even if you don’t use it anymore for 10 years or longer,you will not forget it.
You can get back into it within a very, very short time.
So this is a level where you’re comfortable thinking in a language,and comfortable communicating in a language.
Now, some people go on and, you know, reach like a mastery level.
By that time, you know classic literature in the other languageand have maybe in-depth knowledge of specialized fields.
That’s often the point taken in academia.
For me, when I learned my first foreign language,I had a head startbecause I was born to a German-speaking mother and an American father.
Now, when I was a baby, I didn’t really understandthat what my parents were speaking to me were two separate languages.
But by the time I was two years old, I had figured it all out.
Women speak only German.Men only speak English.Imagine the fun my parents had when they introduced me to couples.
