entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】16 Question forms-提问的方式
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】16 Question forms-提问的方式

Do you know how to make questions? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何提问吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how questions are made.查看这些示例，了解如何提出问题。

Is he a teacher?他是一位教师吗？
Does she eat meat?她吃肉吗？
When did you get here?你什么时候到的？
How much does a train ticket cost?火车票多少钱？

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

Question forms: 1

Complete the questions.

  • Question

DoesyouWherediddoCanDidId

  1. (1) your friend a scientist? – No, he’s an artist.
  2. (2) Núria live in Valencia? – No, she lives in Barcelona.
  3. When (3) you get home? – I got home yesterday.
  4. What time (4) you get up? – I get up at 6.00.
  5. (5) the children go to the park? – Yes, they went there after school.
  6. Are (6) going to the office? – No, I’m going home.
  7. (7) you speak Korean? – Just a little.
  8. (8) did you grow up? – I grew up in Addis Ababa.
  • Answer
  1. (Is) your friend a scientist? – No, he’s an artist.
  2. (Does) Núria live in Valencia? – No, she lives in Barcelona.
  3. When (did) you get home? – I got home yesterday.
  4. What time (do) you get up? – I get up at 6.00.
  5. (Did) the children go to the park? – Yes, they went there after school.
  6. Are (you) going to the office? – No, I’m going home.
  7. (Can) you speak Korean? – Just a little.
  8. (Where) did you grow up? – I grew up in Addis Ababa.

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

To make questions, we often put the verb before the subject. This is called inversion.为了提出疑问，我们经常将动词放在主语之前。这称为反转。

Affirmative肯定Question问题
I am late.我迟到了。Am I late?我迟了吗？
I can help.我可以搭把手。Can I help?我是否能帮助？
She is sleeping.她在睡觉。Is she sleeping?她在睡觉吗？
We have met before.我们以前见过面。Have we met before?我们以前见过么？

If there is a question word (why, what, where, how, etc.), it goes before the verb.如果有疑问词（为什么、什么、哪里、如何等），则放在动词之前。

Question问题Question with question word带有疑问词的问题
Are you late?你迟到了吗？Why are you late?你为什么迟到？
Was she there?她在吗？When was she there?她什么时候在那儿的？
Can I help?我是否能帮助？How can I help?我能提供什么帮助吗？
Have we met before?我们以前见过么？Where have we met before?我们以前在哪里见过面？

This is true for sentences with be, sentences that have auxiliary verbs (e.g. They are waiting. She has finished.) and sentences with modal verbs (can, will, should, might, etc.).对于带有 be 的句子、带有助动词的句子（例如，他们正在等待。她已经完成了。）以及带有情态动词的句子（can、will、should、might 等）都是如此。

Questions in the present simple and past simple一般现在时和一般过去时的问题

For other verbs in the present simple, we use the auxiliary verb do/does in the question.对于一般现在时的其他动词，我们在问题中使用助动词 do/does。

Affirmative肯定Question问题Question with question word带有疑问词的问题
You work at home. 你在家工作。Do you work at home?你在家工作吗？Where do you work?你在哪里工作？
It costs £10. 售价 10 英镑。Does it cost £10?花费 10 英镑吗？How much does it cost?它要多少钱？

We use the auxiliary verb did in the past simple.我们使用助动词did的过去简单形式。

Affirmative肯定Question问题Question with question word带有疑问词的问题
She went home. 她回家了。Did she go home?她回家了吗？Where did she go?她去哪儿了？
They went to the cinema. 他们去了电影院。Did they go to the cinema?他们去看电影了吗？Where did they go?他们去哪儿了？

Subject questions主题问题

In some questions, who or what is the subject of the verb. There is no inversion of subject and verb in these questions.在某些问题中，谁或什么是动词的主语。这些问题中没有主语和动词的倒装。

Who broke the window? 谁打破了窗户？
Who is knocking on the door? 谁在敲门吗？

entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】15 Quantifiers - ‘few’, ‘a few’-量词

Do you know how to use a few, few, very little and a bit of? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用“a few”、“few”、“very little”和“a bit of”吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how these quantifiers are used with countable and uncountable nouns.查看这些示例，了解这些量词如何与可数和不可数名词一起使用。

I have a few friends, so I’m not lonely.我有几个朋友，所以我并不孤单。
She has few friends, so she’s quite lonely.她的朋友很少，所以她很孤独。
We’ve got a bit of time before our train. Shall we get a coffee?距离我们的火车还有一段时间。我们去喝杯咖啡吧？
We’ve got very little time before our train. Hurry up!距离火车出发，我们的时间已经不多了。赶快！

    very little

    ✔a few

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

A few and a bit of or a little mean some. Often we feel this amount is enough or more than we expected. We use a few with plural nouns and a bit of or a little with uncountable nouns. A few 和 a bit of 或a little 的意思是一些。我们常常觉得这个数额已经足够或超过我们的预期。我们将“a few”与复数名词一起使用，将“a bit of”或“a little”与不可数名词一起使用。

I have a few ideas.我有几个想法。
I’ve brought a few friends.我带了几个朋友来。
There’s a bit of milk left.还剩下一点牛奶。
It needs a little more work.它需要更多的工作。

We use few and very little to show that we are talking about a small amount. Often we feel this amount is not enough or less than we expected. Few is for countable nouns and very little is for uncountable nouns.我们使用few和very little来表明我们正在谈论少量。我们常常觉得这个数额不够或低于我们的预期。Few用于可数名词，very little 用于不可数名词。

Few people came to the meeting.参加会议的人很少。
There are few places where you can still see these birds.现在很少有地方还能看到这些鸟了。
We have very little time.我们的时间很少。
I have very little money.我的钱很少。

Note that you can use little without very, but it is less common and sounds quite formal. 请注意，您可以在不使用very 的情况下使用little，但它不太常见，而且听起来很正式。

She had little water.她的水很少。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We can use the present simple of the verb to be to talk about situations and states in the present. 我们可以使用动词的一般现在时来谈论现在的情况和状态。

Affirmative肯定Negative否定Question问题
I am我是I am not我不是Am I?我是吗？
You/we/they are你/我们/他们是You/we/they are not你/我们/他们不是Are you/we/they?你/我们/他们吗？
He/she/it is他她它是He/she/it is not他/她/它不是Is he/she/it?是他/她/它吗？

Contractions缩写

We can contract the verb, especially when we’re speaking.我们可以缩写动词，尤其是当我们说话的时候。

I am a shop assistant. = I’m a shop assistant. 我是一名店员。 = 我是一名店员。
You are a good friend! = You’re a good friend! 你是一个好朋友！ = 你是个好朋友！
He is my wife’s brother. = He’s my wife’s brother. 他是我妻子的兄弟。 = 他是我妻子的兄弟。
We are very busy at the moment. = We’re very busy at the moment. 我们目前很忙。 = 我们现在很忙。
They are on holiday in Italy. = They’re on holiday in Italy. 他们在意大利度假。 = 他们正在意大利度假。

Negatives否定句

For negatives, use not after the verb. We can contract the verb or not.对于否定形式，请在动词后使用 not。我们可以收缩动词，也可以不收缩动词。

I am not at work. = I’m not at work. Note: I amn’t is not possible. 我不在工作。 = 我没在工作。注意：我不是不可能的。
She is not a student. = She’s not a student. = She isn’t a student. 她不是学生。 = 她不是学生。 = 她不是学生。
Money is not important. = Money‘s not* important. = Money isn’t important.* 钱并不重要。 = 钱不重要。 = 钱不重要。
We are not hungry. = We‘re not* hungry. = We aren’t hungry.* 我们不饿。 = 我们不饿。 = 我们不饿。
They are not at home. = They’re not at home. = They aren’t at home. 他们不在家。 = 他们不在家。 = 他们不在家。

Questions疑问句

For questions, change the order of am, is or are and the person.对于疑问句，请更改 am、is 或 are 和人称的顺序。

Are you tired? 你累了吗？
Is she Mexican? 她是墨西哥人吗？
Is this your phone? 这是您的手机？
Are we late? 我们迟到了吗？
Are they your children? 他们是你的孩子们吗？

Short answers简短的答案

Yes, they are.是的，他们是。No, they are not.不，他们不是。No, they’re not.不，他们不是。No, they aren’t.不，他们不是。

Yes, it is.是的。No, it is not.不它不是。No, it’s not.不，这不对。No, it isn’t.不，不是。

Note that with short answers, we only use contractions with no answers*.*请注意，对于简短的答案，我们仅使用缩写而不使用答案。

Questions with question words用疑问词提问

We can also make questions by using a question word like where, when, who or what. We put the question word at the beginning.我们还可以使用疑问词来提出问题，例如哪里、何时、谁或什么。我们把疑问词放在开头。

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We use I/you/we/they + have got or he/she/it + has got to talk about things that we have.我们用“我/你/我们/他们+已经拥有”或“他/她/它+必须”来谈论我们拥有的事情。

In many situations, have and have got mean the same thing. Have got is a little less formal than have. We often use have got more in speaking and have more in writing.在许多情况下，have 和 have got 表示相同的意思。 Have got 比have 稍微不那么正式。我们经常在口语中使用have got ，在写作中更多使用have 。

They have got a big garden. = They have a big garden.他们有一个大花园。 等于他们有一个大花园。
She has got a good job. = She has a good job.她找到了一份好工作。 等于她有一份好工作。

We can use have/has got to talk about appearance, family and friends or possessions. We often contract the verb, especially when we’re speaking.我们可以使用 have/has had 来谈论外表、家人和朋友或财产。我们经常缩写动词，尤其是在说话时。

I have got brown hair. = I‘ve got* brown hair.我有一头棕色的头发。 = 我有一头棕色的头发。
My sister has got long hair. = My sister**’s got** long hair.我姐姐有长头发。 = 我姐姐的头发很长。
He has not got many friends. = He hasn’t got many friends.他没有很多朋友。 = 他没有很多朋友。
They have got a new car. = They**’ve got** a new car.他们有一辆新车。 = 他们有一辆新车。*

We can also use have/has got for timetabled events, illnesses or abstract things.我们还可以使用 has/has got 来表示已安排的事件、疾病或抽象事物。

They‘ve got* basketball practice this evening.他们今晚有篮球训练。
He**’s got** a terrible cold. 他得了重感冒。
I**’ve got** a good idea!我有个好主意！*

Affirmative肯定

Negative否定

For negatives, use not after have/has. We can contract negatives.对于否定词，不要在 has/has 之后使用 not 。我们可以收缩否定。

We have not got any pets. = We have*n’t got any pets.我们没有养宠物。 = 我们没有任何宠物。
She has not got a brother. = She hasn’t got a brother.她没有兄弟。 = 她没有兄弟。*

Questions疑问句

To make questions, use have/has + subject + got.要提出问题，请使用 has/has + 主语 + got。

Have you got a big house?你有大房子吗？
How many rooms has it got?它有多少个房间？

Subject pronoun主语代词yes/no question是/否问题Question with question word, e.g. what, who, how many, etc.带疑问词的问题，例如什么、谁、多少等等。

Short answers简短的答案

For yes/no questions, we can use short answers.对于是/否问题，我们可以使用简短的答案。

*Have you got a new job? **No, I haven’t.**你找到新工作了吗？不，我没有。
Has she got a meeting this morning? **Yes, she has.*她今天早上有会议吗？是的，她有。

Yes, I/you/we/they have.是的，我/你/我们/他们有。No, I/you/we/they haven’t.不，我/你/我们/他们没有。
Yes, he/she/it has.是的，他/她/它有。No, he/she/it hasn’t.不，他/她/它没有。

Have/has got is only used in the present tense. For the past, use had without got.Have/has got 仅用于现在时。对于过去，使用 had 而不使用 got。

I had got a red bike when I was young.我年轻时有一辆红色自行车。
I had a red bike when I was young.我年轻时有一辆红色自行车。

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】12 Present simple-一般现在时
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】12 Present simple-一般现在时

Do you know how to use the present simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用一般现在时吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how we use the present simple. 查看这些示例，了解我们如何使用一般现在时。

I eat a lot of fruit and vegetables.我吃很多水果和蔬菜。
My dad phones me every day.我爸爸每天给我打电话。
She doesn’t like her job.她不喜欢她的工作。
What time do you get up at weekends?周末你几点起床？

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

Present simple: 1

Complete the sentences with the present simple form of the verb in brackets.

  • Question
  1. She __ in a hospital. (WORK)
  2. I __ the guitar. (NOT PLAY)
  3. __ you __ tea? (DRINK)
  4. Where __ your friend __ ? (LIVE)
  5. They __ to the cinema very often. (NOT GO)
  6. What __ you __ for work? (WEAR)
  7. His English class __ at 8 o’clock. (FINISH)
  8. __ we __ time for a coffee? (HAVE)
  • Answer
  1. She works in a hospital. (WORK)
  2. I don’t play the guitar. (NOT PLAY)
  3. Do you drink tea? (DRINK)
  4. Where does your friend living ? (LIVE)
  5. They don’t go to the cinema very often. (NOT GO)
  6. What do you wear for work? (WEAR)
  7. His English class finishes at 8 o’clock. (FINISH)
  8. Do we have time for a coffee? (HAVE)

My answers with wrongs

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We can use the present simple to talk about things we do regularly.我们可以使用一般现在时来谈论我们经常做的事情。

I go to the gym three times a week. 我每周去健身房三次。
We drink coffee at work. 我们在工作时喝咖啡。

We can also use it for things which are generally true.我们也可以将它用于通常正确的事情。

She loves her job. 她热爱她的工作。
A lot of people work at home now. 现在很多人都在家工作。

Remember that we add s or es for he, she and it. Sometimes we also change y to i. 请记住，我们为 he、she 和 it 添加 s 或 es。有时我们也将y改为i。

My favourite TV show starts at 8 o’clock. 我最喜欢的电视节目八点开始。
She finishes work early on Fridays. 她周五很早就完成工作。
My brother studies at university. 我弟弟在读大学。

The he, she and it forms for have, do and go are irregular. 他、她和它构成的have、do和go都是不规则的。

He has a flat in the city centre. 他在市中心有一套公寓。
She does yoga on Tuesdays. 她每周二做瑜伽。
My dog goes for a walk every morning. 我的狗每天早上去散步。

For the negative, we use don’t or doesn’t.对于否定，我们使用 don’t 或 does not。

We don’t eat meat. 我们不吃肉。
She doesn’t have a lot of free time. 她没有很多空闲时间。

For questions, we use do or *does.*对于疑问句，我们使用 do 或 does。

Do you watch a lot of films? 你看了很多电影吗？
Does he speak English? 他会说英语？

+ Affirmative+ 肯定- Negative- 否定? Question？疑问
I like ice cream.
我喜欢冰淇淋。		I don’t like ice cream.
我不喜欢冰淇淋。		Do I like ice cream?
我喜欢冰淇淋吗？
You go to the gym.
你去健身房。		You don’t go to the gym.
你不去健身房。		Do you go to the gym?
你去健身房吗？
He/she/it eats meat.
他/她/它吃肉。		He/she/it doesn’t eat meat.
他/她/它不吃肉。		Does he/she/it eat meat?
他/她/它吃肉吗？
We watch a lot of films.
我们看了很多电影。		We don’t watch a lot of films.
我们看的电影不多。		Do we watch a lot of films?
我们看很多电影吗？
They work at home.
他们在家工作。		They don’t work at home.
他们不在家工作。		Do they work at home?
他们在家工作吗？

Short answers简短的答案

We can answer questions with Yes, I/you/we/they do, Yes, he/she/it does, or No, I/you/we/they don’t or No, he/she/it doesn’t.我们可以用“是，我/你/我们/他们这样做”、“是，他/她/它这样做”或“否，我/你/我们/他们不这样做”或“否，他/她/它不这样做”来回答问题。

Do you like cheese? 你喜欢芝士吗？
Yes, I do. 是的，我喜欢。

Does she play football on Saturdays? 她星期六踢足球吗？
No, she doesn’t. 不，她不踢。

Questions with question words用疑问词提问

We can also put question words like what, where, who or what time before do or does.我们还可以在 do 或 does 之前加上疑问词，例如什么、哪里、谁或什么时间。

Where do you work? 你在哪里工作？
What time does he have lunch? 他什么时候吃午饭了吗？

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2-语法测试2

Present simple: 2

Complete the sentences with the present simple form of the verb in brackets

  • Question
  1. What time __ he __ work? (START)
  2. We __ to the same place on holiday every year. (GO)
  3. My sister __ chocolate. (NOT LIKE)
  4. __ they __ a lot of sport? (DO)
  5. I __ meals very often. (NOT COOK)
  6. Why __ cats __ all the time? (SLEEP)
  7. He __ to different countries for work. (FLY)
  8. __ you __ this question? (UNDERSTAND)
  • Answer
  1. What time does he start work? (START)
  2. We go to the same place on holiday every year. (GO)
  3. My sister doesn’t like chocolate. (NOT LIKE)
  4. Do they do a lot of sport? (DO)
  5. I don’t cook meals very often. (NOT COOK)
  6. Why do cats sleep all the time? (SLEEP)
  7. He flies to different countries for work. (FLY)
  8. Do you understand this question? (UNDERSTAND)

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】11 Prepositions of time - 'at', 'in', 'on'时间介词：'at', 'in', 'on'
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】11 Prepositions of time ‘at’, ‘in’, ‘on’时间介词：’at’, ‘in’, ‘on’

Do you know how and when to use at, in and on to talk about time? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何以及何时使用 at、in 和 on 来谈论时间吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how we use at, in and on to talk about time.看这些例子，看看我们如何使用 at、in 和 on 来谈论时间。

At weekends, I love to go skiing. 周末，我喜欢去滑雪。
In spring, the weather is warmer. 春天，天气转暖。
On Mondays, I work from home. 周一，我在家工作。
In the afternoon, I do activities. 下午，我做活动。
On weekdays, I work until 12. 工作日，我工作到12点。
At 5 o’clock, I do two or three more hours of work. 5点钟，我又做了两三个小时的工作。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1 语法测试1

Prepositions of time – ‘at’, ‘in’ and ‘on’: 1

Complete the sentences. Use ‘at’, ‘in’ or ‘on’ in the gaps.

  • Question
  1. He saw a film with my sister (1) the weekend.
  2. (2) the last few months, it hasn’t rained much.
  3. My father was born (3) the 20th century.
  4. She has a doctor’s appointment (4) 10 o’clock (5) Monday.
  5. We prefer to exercise (6) the evening.
  6. Jacques is coming to visit us (7) 13 June.
  7. My favourite time to work in the garden is (8) spring.
  8. We all try to eat together at the table (9) dinner time.
  • Answer
  1. He saw a film with my sister (at|on) the weekend.
  2. (In) the last few months, it hasn’t rained much.
  3. My father was born (in) the 20th century.
  4. She has a doctor’s appointment (at) 10 o’clock (on) Monday.
  5. We prefer to exercise (in) the evening.
  6. Jacques is coming to visit us (on) 13 June.
  7. My favourite time to work in the garden is (in) spring.
  8. We all try to eat together at the table (at) dinner time.

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We use the prepositions in, on or at to say when something happens.我们使用介词 in、on 或 at 来表示某件事发生的时间。

at在

We usually use at with clock times and mealtimes.我们通常将 at 与时钟时间和进餐时间一起使用。

I get up at 6.30 a.m. and go for a run. 我早上 6.30 起床去跑步。
She doesn’t like to leave the office at unchtime. 在午餐时间她不喜欢离开办公室。

We also use at with some specific phrases such as at the weekend and at night.我们还会将 at 与一些特定短语一起使用，例如 at the Weekend 和 at night。

At the weekend, I can spend the days how I like. 周末，我可以随心所欲地度过日子。

We can also say on weekends or on the weekend. This is more common in American English. 我们也可以说 on weekends 或 on the weekend 。这在美式英语中更为常见。

We say at night when we mean all of the night. But we say in the night when we want to talk about a specific time during the night.我们所说的“晚上”是指整个晚上。但是当我们想谈论夜间的特定时间时，我们会说“在晚上”。

She’s a nurse and she works at night. 她是一名护士，晚上工作。
The baby often wakes up in the night. 在晚上宝宝经常醒。

We use at with Christmas and other holidays that last several days.我们在圣诞节和其他持续几天的假期中使用 at。

The weather is very cold here at Christmas. 圣诞节这里的天气很冷。
At Chinese New Year, many people go home to their families. 农历新年时，许多人回家与家人团聚。

clock times
时钟时间		at 6 o’clock在6点钟
at 9.30 在9点半
at 13.00 在13点
mealtimes and breaks
进餐时间和休息时间		at breakfast time早餐时间
at lunchtime在午餐时间
at dinner time晚餐时间
at break time休息时间
other time phrases
其他时间短语		at night晚上
at weekends在周末/the weekend/周末
at Christmas在圣诞节/Easter/复活节

in在

We usually use in with parts of the day and longer periods of time such as months, seasons and years.我们通常将 in 与一天中的部分时间和更长的时间段（例如月、季节和年）一起使用。

I usually relax in the evening. 我通常在晚上放松。
In summer it’s too hot to do anything. 在夏天太热了，什么事都做不了。
I’m always really busy in December. 在十二月我总是很忙。

parts of the day一天中的部分时间in the morning/afternoon/evening早上/下午/晚上
months月in January/February一月/二月
seasons季节in (the) spring/summer/autumn/winter在春/夏/秋/冬
years, centuries, decades年、世纪、几十年in 20162016年
in the 21st century在21世纪
in the 80s八十年代
other time phrases其他时间短语in the past在过去
in the future将来
in the last few years/months/weeks/days在过去几年/几个月/几周/几天

on在

We usually use on with days and dates.我们通常将 on 与日期和日期一起使用。

On Fridays, I have a long lunch. 每周五，我都会吃一顿丰盛的午餐。
It’s his birthday on 19 October. 10 月 19 日是他的生日。

days天on Monday/Tuesday etc*. 周一/周二等
on my birthday 在我生日的时候
on New Year’s Day* 元旦那天
dates日期on 30 July7月30日
on the second of August八月二日

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2语法测试2

Prepositions of time – ‘at’, ‘in’ and ‘on’: 2

Complete the sentences. Use ‘at’, ‘in’ or ‘on’ in the gaps.

  • Question
  1. My friend Peter and I speak (1) the third Thursday of every month.
  2. She goes to visit her parents every year (2) August.
  3. I often have to work (3) the weekends.
  4. If you want to exercise, do it first thing (4) the morning.
  5. They’re planning to go to Australia (5) Christmas.
  6. I want to eat Mexican food (6) my birthday.
  7. (7) the future, the weather will be more difficult to predict.
  8. Shall we meet (8) 9.00?
  • Answer
  1. My friend Peter and I speak (on) the third Thursday of every month.
  2. She goes to visit her parents every year (in) August.
  3. I often have to work (at) the weekends.
  4. If you want to exercise, do it first thing (in) the morning.
  5. They’re planning to go to Australia (at) Christmas.
  6. I want to eat Mexican food (on) my birthday.
  7. (In) the future, the weather will be more difficult to predict.
  8. Shall we meet (at) 9.00?

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】10 Prepositions of place – 'in', 'on', 'at'-地点介词 – 'in', 'on', 'at'
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】10 Prepositions of place – ‘in’, ‘on’, ‘at’-地点介词 – ‘in’, ‘on’, ‘at’

Do you know how to use in, on and at to talk about location? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何用 in、on 和 at 来谈论位置吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how we use these prepositions.查看这些示例，了解我们如何使用这些介词。

Please put the book on the shelf. 请把书放在书架上。
They live in Helsinki. 他们住在赫尔辛基。
You should keep milk in the fridge. 你应该把牛奶放在冰箱里。
Mette is studying at the library. 梅特正在图书馆学习。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

Prepositions of place – ‘in’, ‘on’, ‘at’: 1

Choose the correct preposition.

  • Question
  1. On Friday mornings, I’m usually _____ school.
    at
    in
  2. Please put the flowers _____ the table.
    in
    on
  3. I’ll meet you _____ the bus stop.
    at
    in
  4. They’re going to meet _____ the café.
    at
    on
  5. Her flat is _____ the sixth floor.
    at
    on
  6. Buckingham Palace is _____ London.
    at
    in
  7. Their house is _____ the James River.
    at
    on
  8. Karim isn’t home now. He’s _____ church.
    at
    on
  • Answer
  1. On Friday mornings, I’m usually _____ school.
    ✔at
    in
  2. Please put the flowers _____ the table.
    in
    ✔on
  3. I’ll meet you _____ the bus stop.
    ✔at
    in
  4. They’re going to meet _____ the café.
    ✔at
    on
  5. Her flat is _____ the sixth floor.
    at
    ✔on
  6. Buckingham Palace is _____ London.
    at
    ✔in
  7. Their house is _____ the James River.
    at
    ✔on
  8. Karim isn’t home now. He’s _____ church.
    ✔at
    on

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We can use the prepositions in, on and at to say where things are. They go before nouns. 我们可以使用介词 in、on 和 at 来表示事物所在的位置。它们位于名词之前。

I am in the kitchen. 我在厨房。
My dog likes sleeping on the sofa. 我的狗喜欢睡在沙发上。
The children eat lunch at school. 孩子们在学校吃午餐。

in在

We use in to talk about a place that is inside a bigger space, such as a box, a house, a city or a country. 我们用 in 来谈论更大空间内的地方，例如盒子、房子、城市或国家。

The clothes are in the wardrobe. 衣服在衣柜里。
The children are playing in the park. 孩子们正在公园里玩耍。
There’s a bookshop in the shopping centre. 购物中心有一家书店。
My grandmother was born in Sweden. 我的祖母出生在瑞典。

We also use in with other physical locations such as: 我们使用 in 与其他物理位置一起使用，例如：

in the world 在世界上
in water / the sea / a river / a lake / a pool 在水/海/河/湖/池
in the mountains / the countryside / a valley / the forest/ 在山脉/乡村/山谷/森林
in a car / a taxi 在汽车/出租车里

on在

We use on to talk about location on a surface. 我们用 on 来谈论表面上的位置。

The books are on the desk. 书在桌子上。
We live on the fifth floor. 我们住在五楼。
There are pictures on the wall. 墙上有照片。
She likes to sit on the floor. 她喜欢坐在地板上。

We also use on for some types of public transport.我们还使用 on 来乘坐某些类型的公共交通工具。

He’s on the bus now. 他现在在公共汽车上。
You can’t make phone calls on a plane. 飞机上不能打电话。
They go to school on the train. 他们坐火车去学校。

We also use on for lines (including rivers, borders, streets, etc.) and islands.我们还用 on 来表示线条（包括河流、边界、街道等）和岛屿。

London is on the River Thames. 伦敦位于泰晤士河畔。
The Pyrenees are on the border of Spain and France. 比利牛斯山脉位于西班牙和法国的边界。
There’s a market on James Street. 詹姆斯街有一个市场。
I’d love to live on the Isle of Wight. 我很想住在怀特岛。

at 在

We use at in many common phrases, especially when we are talking about a place for a specific activity.我们在许多常用短语中使用 at，尤其是当我们谈论进行特定活动的地点时。

I’m at work. 我在工作。
She’s working at home today. 她今天在家工作。
The children are at school. 孩子们正在上学。
See you at the train station! 火车站见！
They’re at the supermarket. 他们在超市。
I met him at a party. 我是在一次聚会上认识他的。

We also use at for addresses or exact positions.我们还使用 at 来表示地址或确切位置。

I live at 15 Craig Street. 我住在克雷格街 15 号。
She’s sitting at a desk. 她坐在办公桌前。
He’s waiting at the entrance. 他在入口处等着。
Please sit at the back of the room. 请坐在房间的后面。

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Prepositions of place – ‘in’, ‘on’, ‘at’: 2

Choose the correct preposition.

  • Question
  1. They have lots of pictures _____ their fridge.
    in
    on
  2. We put the old books _____ a box.
    at
    in
  3. I just called him _____ work, and he wasn’t there.
    at
    on
  4. I don’t like to study _____ home. It’s too noisy.
    at
    in
  5. Last summer we stayed in a cabin _____ a lake.
    in
    on
  6. My office is _____ the 20th floor, so I take the lift.
    in
    on
  7. I like to listen to music when I’m _____ the gym.
    at
    on
  8. There are important Roman ruins _____ Jordan.
    at
    in
  • Answer
  1. They have lots of pictures _____ their fridge.
    in
    ✔on
  2. We put the old books _____ a box.
    at
    ✔in
  3. I just called him _____ work, and he wasn’t there.
    ✔at
    on
  4. I don’t like to study _____ home. It’s too noisy.
    ✔at
    in
  5. Last summer we stayed in a cabin _____ a lake.
    in
    ✔on
  6. My office is _____ the 20th floor, so I take the lift.
    in
    ✔on
  7. I like to listen to music when I’m _____ the gym.
    ✔at
    on
  8. There are important Roman ruins _____ Jordan.
    at
    ✔in

  8. That’s Mathias (‘s|’) sister. Her name is Emilia.

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We can use possessive ‘s to talk about the relationship between people or to say who owns something. Possessive ‘s always comes after a noun or a name.我们可以使用所有格 ‘s 来谈论人与人之间的关系或者说谁拥有某物。所有格 ‘s 总是出现在名词或名字之后。

We often use possessive ‘s or s’ when we talk about family and friends.当我们谈论家人和朋友时，我们经常使用所有格 ‘s 或 s’。

Grandma and Grandpa are my mum‘s* parents.奶奶和爷爷是我妈妈的父母。
Maria**’s** best friend is Juanita.玛丽亚最好的朋友是胡安妮塔。
My cousins’ birthdays are both in January.我表兄弟的生日都是一月。*

We can also use it to say that something belongs to someone.我们也可以用它来表示某物属于某人。

That’s Roberto‘s* flat. He’s got a flat in the city centre.那是罗伯托的公寓。他在市中心有一套公寓。*
Kim‘s* hair is very long. She’s got long, black hair.金的头发很长。她有一头又长又黑的头发。*
My parent*s’ garden is beautiful. They grow a lot of flowers.我父母的花园很漂亮。他们种了很多花。*

When it is one person who owns something, we usually use ‘s.当某人拥有某物时，我们通常使用 ‘s。

Our friend‘s* car is red. She loves it.我们朋友的车是红色的。她喜欢它。*
Simon‘s* phone is new. He bought it yesterday.西蒙的手机是新的。他昨天买的。*
Can you see Amira‘s* keys? She can’t find them.你能看到阿米拉的钥匙吗？她找不到他们。*

It is possible to use more than one possessive in a phrase.一个短语中可以使用多个所有格。

We had lunch at my friend‘s* father’s house.我们在我朋友的父亲家里吃午饭。*

If a name or noun ends in s, we can add either ‘ or ‘s. The pronunciation can be /zɪz/ or /sɪz/.如果名称或名词以 s 结尾，我们可以添加 ‘ 或 ‘。发音可以是/zɪz/或/sɪz/。

Is that James‘* bag?那是詹姆斯的包吗？*
That’s my boss‘s* office.那是我老板的办公室。*

If the thing belongs to more than one person, we usually add ‘ after the s of the plural noun.如果该事物属于多个人，我们通常在复数名词的s后面添加’。

Our friend*s’ house is in the mountains. They moved there last year.我们朋友的房子在山里。他们去年搬到那里。*
My grandparent*s’ dog is called Bertie.我祖父母的狗叫伯蒂。*
The twin*s’ school is closed today.双胞胎的学校今天停课。*

If the plural noun is irregular and doesn’t end in s, we add ‘s.如果复数名词不规则且不以 s 结尾，则添加 ‘s。

This is our children‘s* school.这是我们孩子的学校。*
The women‘s* clothes are on the second floor.女装在二楼。*
A lot of people‘s* eyes are brown.很多人的眼睛都是棕色的。*

If something belongs to more than one person, and we give a list of names, the ‘s comes after the last name in the list.如果某物属于多个人，并且我们给出了一份姓名列表，则 ‘ 位于列表中最后一个姓名之后。

Liam is Anne and Gary‘s* son.利亚姆是安妮和加里的儿子。*

Remember that s at the end of a word without an apostrophe (‘) can make it plural, but this doesn’t show possession.请记住，单词末尾的 s 不带撇号 (‘) 可以使其成为复数，但这并不表示所有格。

I’ve got two brother*s.我有两个兄弟。*
Are those your key*s?这些是你的钥匙吗？*

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2-语法测试2

Possessive ‘s: 2

Type ‘s, s’ or s to fill the gaps.

  • Question
  1. Fatema is Ahmad (1) cousin.
  2. Our friend (2) flat is very big. They have five bedrooms!
  3. We’ve got two dog (3) . One is black and the other one is brown.
  4. Bruno (4) eyes are blue.
  5. That’s Julia and Miguel (5) house.
  6. My grandparent (6) car is really old. They bought it years ago!
  7. That’s Mrs Jones (7) classroom. She’s our English teacher.
  8. I really enjoy watching women (8) football.
  • Answer
  1. Fatema is Ahmad (‘s) cousin.
  2. Our friend (s’) flat is very big. They have five bedrooms!
  3. We’ve got two dog (s) . One is black and the other one is brown.
  4. Bruno (‘s) eyes are blue.
  5. That’s Julia and Miguel (‘s) house.
  6. My grandparent (s’) car is really old. They bought it years ago!
  7. That’s Mrs Jones (‘s|’) classroom. She’s our English teacher.
  8. I really enjoy watching women (‘s) football.

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】08 Past continuous and past simple-过去进行时和一般过去时
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】08 Past continuous and past simple-过去进行时和一般过去时

Do you know how to use the past continuous and past simple? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you. 你知道如何使用过去进行时和一般过去时吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how the past continuous and past simple are used.查看这些示例，了解如何使用过去进行时和一般过去时。

When I woke up this morning, it was snowing.今天早上我醒来时，下雪了。
I was sleeping when you called me.你打电话给我的时候我正在睡觉。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

Past continuous and past simple: 1

Choose the correct verb tense.

  • Question
  1. I _____ work at 9 a.m. this morning.
    started
    was starting
  2. This time last year I _____ at university.
    studied
    was studying
  3. Sarah hurt her ankle while she _____.
    ran
    was running
  4. I _____ your call because I was working.
    missed
    was missing
  5. While I was walking home, I _____ a new shop in the high street.
    noticed
    was noticing
  6. At 6 p.m. yesterday it _____ dark.
    already got
    was already getting
  7. I saw you driving down Green Street yesterday! Where _____?
    did you go
    were you going
  8. When we saw the crime, we _____ the police.
    called
    were calling
  • Answer
  1. I _____ work at 9 a.m. this morning.
    ✔started
    was starting
  2. This time last year I _____ at university.
    studied
    ✔was studying
  3. Sarah hurt her ankle while she _____.
    ran
    ✔was running
  4. I _____ your call because I was working.
    ✔missed
    was missing
  5. While I was walking home, I _____ a new shop in the high street.
    ✔noticed
    was noticing
  6. At 6 p.m. yesterday it _____ dark.
    already got
    ✔was already getting
  7. I saw you driving down Green Street yesterday! Where _____?
    did you go
    ✔were you going
  8. When we saw the crime, we _____ the police.
    ✔called
    were calling

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

The past continuous and the past simple help us to show how two past actions or situations are connected.过去进行时和一般过去时帮助我们展示两个过去的动作或情况是如何联系在一起的。

Past simple一般过去时

The past simple shows us that an action was in the past, not in the present. Regular past simple verbs have -ed at the end (e.g. called, played, arrived). Irregular verbs have a different form, usually with a different vowel sound (e.g. wake → woke, break → broke, feel → felt).一般过去时向我们表明某个动作是过去发生的，而不是现在发生的。常规一般过去动词末尾有 -ed（例如，叫、玩、到达）。不规则动词有不同的形式，通常具有不同的元音（例如wake→wake、break→broken、feel→feeled）。

My parents called me yesterday. 我的父母昨天给我打电话。
I woke up early this morning. 我今天早上很早就醒了。
Sam played basketball when he was at university. 萨姆在大学时打篮球。

We make the negative with didn’t and the infinitive verb.我们用 did not 和不定式动词构成否定形式。

My parents didn’t call me yesterday. 昨天我父母没有给我打电话。
I didn’t wake up early this morning. 今天早上我没有早起。

We make the question form with did and then the subject and infinitive verb.我们用 did 来构成疑问句，然后是主语和不定式动词。

Did you wake up early this morning? 今天早上你起得很早吗？
Did Sam play basketball when he was at university? 萨姆在大学时打篮球吗？

Past continuous过去进行时

The past continuous shows us that the action was already in progress at a certain time in the past.过去进行时向我们表明该动作在过去的某个时间已经在进行中。

What were you doing at 8 p.m. last night? 昨夜晚上八点你在做什么？
I was studying. 我那时正在学习。

This means that I started studying before 8 p.m. and I continued after 8 p.m.这意味着我晚上8点之前就开始学习了。晚上 8 点后我继续。

The past continuous can also show that an activity was in progress for some time, not just for a moment.过去进行时也可以表明一项活动已经进行了一段时间，而不仅仅是一会儿。

We were cleaning the house all morning. 我们整个早上都在打扫房子。

We make the past continuous with was or were and the -ing form of the verb.我们用 was 或 were 以及动词的 -ing 形式使过去进行时。

She couldn’t come to the party. She was working. 她不能来参加聚会。她正在工作。
Three years ago, we were living in my home town. 三年前，我们住在我的家乡。
I tried to give him some advice, but he wasn’t listening. 我试图给他一些建议，但他不听。
What were you doing this time last year? 去年这个时候你在做什么？

Past continuous and past simple过去进行时和一般过去时

When we use these two tenses together, it shows us that the past simple action happened in the middle of the past continuous action, while it was in progress.当我们同时使用这两个时态时，它表明过去的简单动作发生在过去的连续动作的中间，并且正在进行。

While I was studying, I suddenly felt sleepy. 正当我学习的时候，我突然感到困了。

We often use these tenses to show an action interrupting another action.我们经常使用这些时态来表示一个动作打断另一个动作。

I broke my leg when I was skiing. 我滑雪时摔断了腿。
As I was going to work, I saw an old friend. 当我去上班的时候，我见到了一位老朋友。
We were watching television when the power went off. 我们正在看电视，突然停电了。

Can you see a difference in the meaning of these two sentences?你能看出这两句话的意思有什么不同吗？

When the guests arrived, Jane was cooking dinner. 客人到来时，简正在做饭。
When the guests arrived, Jane cooked dinner. 客人到来后，简做饭了。

In the first one, Jane started cooking dinner before the guests arrived. We know that because it uses the past continuous. In the second sentence, the guests arrived first and then Jane started cooking.第一个场景中，简在客人到来之前开始做饭。我们知道这一点是因为它使用了过去进行时。第二句话，客人先到了，然后简然开始做饭。

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2-语法测试2

Past continuous and past simple: 2

Choose the correct verb tense.

  • Question
  1. I _____ my new job yesterday.
    started
    was starting
  2. What _____ at around 8 a.m. this morning?
    did you do
    were you doing
  3. While I was washing the dishes, I suddenly _____ a brilliant idea.
    had
    was having
  4. He didn’t hear the phone ring. He _____ to really loud music.
    listened
    was listening
  5. They _____ the shop when I got there, so I couldn’t go in and buy anything.
    already closed
    were already closing
  6. The teacher told us to stop what we _____.
    did
    were doing
  7. _____ what you were looking for in the library yesterday?
    Did you find
    Were you finding
  8. When I heard the phone ring, I _____ it straight away.
    answered
    was answering
  • Answer
  1. I _____ my new job yesterday.
    ✔started
    was starting
  2. What _____ at around 8 a.m. this morning?
    did you do
    ✔were you doing
  3. While I was washing the dishes, I suddenly _____ a brilliant idea.
    ✔had
    was having
  4. He didn’t hear the phone ring. He _____ to really loud music.
    listened
    ✔was listening
  5. They _____ the shop when I got there, so I couldn’t go in and buy anything.
    already closed
    ✔were already closing
  6. The teacher told us to stop what we _____.
    did
    ✔were doing
  7. _____ what you were looking for in the library yesterday?
    ✔Did you find
    Were you finding
  8. When I heard the phone ring, I _____ it straight away.
    ✔answered
    was answering

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】07 Nouns countable and uncountable-名词：可数和不可数
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】07 Nouns: countable and uncountable-名词：可数和不可数

Do you know how to use a, some, any, much and many? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用 a、some、any、much 和 Many 吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how to use countable and uncountable nouns in a sentence.查看这些示例，了解如何在句子中使用可数名词和不可数名词。

I’m making a cup of tea.我正在泡一杯茶。
There’s some money on the table.桌子上还有一些钱。
Have we got any bread?我们有面包吗？
How many chairs do we need?我们需要多少把椅子？
How much milk have we got?我们还有多少牛奶？

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1语法测试1

Countable and uncountable nouns 1: 1

Complete the sentences with one word.

  • Question
  1. How (1) people are coming?
  2. We’ve got (2) chicken but there isn’t (3) rice.
  3. How (4) water do you think we need?
  4. There’s (5) cat in the garden.
  5. I’ve bought (6) new shoes.
  6. Do you have (7) advice for me?
  7. We have a (8) of chairs but we don’t have (9) tables.
  8. There isn’t (10) toothpaste.
  • Answer
  1. How (many) people are coming?
  2. We’ve got (some) chicken but there isn’t (any|much) rice.
  3. How (much) water do you think we need?
  4. There’s (a) cat in the garden.
  5. I’ve bought (some) new shoes.
  6. Do you have (any|some) advice for me?
  7. We have a (lot) of chairs but we don’t have (any|many) tables.
  8. There isn’t (any|much) toothpaste.

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

Nouns can be countable or uncountable. Countable nouns can be counted, e.g. an apple, two apples, three apples, etc. Uncountable nouns cannot be counted, e.g. air, rice, water, etc. When you learn a new noun, you should check if it is countable or uncountable and note how it is used in a sentence.名词可以是可数或不可数。可数名词是可以计算的，例如一个苹果、两个苹果、三个苹果等。不可数名词不能计数，例如空气、大米、水等。当你学习一个新名词时，你应该检查它是可数还是不可数，并注意它在句子中的用法。

Countable nouns可数名词

For positive sentences we can use a/an for singular nouns or some for plurals.对于肯定句，我们可以使用 a/an 表示单数名词，或使用 some 表示复数名词。

There’s a man at the door.门口有一个男人。
I have some friends in New York.我在纽约有一些朋友。

For negatives we can use a/an for singular nouns or any for plurals.对于否定词，我们可以使用 a/an 表示单数名词，或使用 any 表示复数名词。

I don’t have a dog.我没有狗。
There aren’t any seats.没有座位了。

Uncountable nouns不可数的名词

Here are some examples of uncountable nouns:以下是不可数名词的一些示例：

bread面包rice米coffee咖啡information信息
money钱advice建议luggage行李furniture家具

We use some with uncountable nouns in positive sentences and any with negatives.我们在肯定句中将 some 与不可数名词一起使用，而 any 与否定句一起使用。

There’s some milk in the fridge.冰箱里还有一些牛奶。
There isn’t any coffee.没有咖啡。

Questions疑问句

In questions we use a/an, any or how many with countable nouns.在疑问句中，我们使用 a/an、any 或 how much 与可数名词一起使用。

*Is there an email address to write to?有可以写信的电子邮件地址吗？
Are there any chairs?这里有椅子吗？
How manychairs are there?这里有多少椅子？*

And we use any or how much with uncountable nouns.我们将any 或how much 与不可数名词一起使用。

*Is there any sugar?有糖吗？
How muchorange juice is there?这里有多少橙汁？*

But when we are offering something or asking for something, we normally use some.但是当我们提供某物或要求某物时，我们通常会使用一些。

Do you want some chocolate?你想要一些巧克力吗？
Can we have some more chairs, please?请给我们多一些椅子，好吗？

We also use some in a question when we think the answer will be ‘yes’.当我们认为答案是“是”时，我们也会在问题中使用 some。

Have you got some new glasses?你有新眼镜吗？

Other expressions of quantity其他数量表达方式

A lot of (or lots of) can be used with both countable and uncountable nouns.a lot of (or much of) 可以与可数名词和不可数名词一起使用。

There are lots of apples on the trees.树上有很多苹果。
There is a lot of snow on the road.路上有很多雪。

Notice that we don’t usually use many or much in positive sentences. We use a lot of instead.请注意，我们通常不会在肯定句中使用 much 或 much。我们用 a lot of 代替。

They have a lot of money.他们有很多钱。

However, in negative sentences we use not many with countable nouns and not much with uncountable nouns.然而，在否定句中，我们对可数名词使用 not many，对不可数名词使用 not much。

There are a lot of carrots but there are*n’t many potatoes.胡萝卜很多，但土豆不多。
There’s lots of juice but there isn’t much water.果汁很多，但水不多。*

Try this exercise to test your grammar again.尝试这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2语法测试2

Countable and uncountable nouns 1: 2

Complete the sentences with one word.

  • Question
  1. I’m still at (1) work but I’ll leave soon.
  2. I’m going to (2) prison to see my uncle.
  3. (3) University of Nottingham is in (4) United Kingdom.
  4. Every Friday my grandad goes to (5) prison to teach a maths class.
  5. She was born in Japan, but she went to (6) university in (7) Bahamas.
  6. My daughter does piano classes after (8) school.
  7. I’m going to (9) school for a parents’ meeting.
  8. The Danube flows from (10) Germany, through (11) Central Europe to (12) Black Sea.
  • Answer
  1. I’m still at (-) work but I’ll leave soon.
  2. I’m going to (the) prison to see my uncle.
  3. (The) University of Nottingham is in (the) United Kingdom.
  4. Every Friday my grandad goes to (the) prison to teach a maths class.
  5. She was born in Japan, but she went to (-) university in (the) Bahamas.
  6. My daughter does piano classes after (-) school.
  7. I’m going to (the) school for a parents’ meeting.
  8. The Danube flows from (-) Germany, through (-) Central Europe to (the) Black Sea.

【A1-A2-Grammar】05 Comparative adjectives-形容词比较级

Do you know how to use comparative adjectives like older, better and more interesting? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用“old”、“better”、“moreinteresting”等形容词的比较级吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

    ✔than

    crowdeder
    ✔more crowded

    more safer
    ✔safer
  4. He’s _____ at football than me.
    ✔better
    gooder

    ✔bigger
    more big
  6. She thinks her job is _____ because she works with difficult people.
    ✔more stressful
    more stressfuller
  7. This town is _____ than my hometown. There’s a lot of traffic.
    more noisier
    ✔noisier
  8. Her mark in the exam was _____ than mine.
    badder
    ✔worse

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

We use comparative adjectives to compare two things or show change. The comparative form depends on the number of syllables in the adjective.我们使用形容词比较级来比较两个事物或显示变化。比较级形式取决于形容词的音节数。

Adjectives with one syllable 单音节形容词

To make comparative forms with one-syllable adjectives, we usually add -er:用单音节形容词构成比较级时，我们通常加-er：

old → older老→老
clean → cleaner干净→清洁
slow → slower慢→慢

If an adjective ends in -e, we add -r:如果形容词以 -e 结尾，我们添加 -r：

safe → safer安全→更安全
nice → nicer不错 → 更好

If an adjective ends in a vowel and a consonant, we usually double the consonant:如果形容词以元音和辅音结尾，我们通常将辅音加倍：

big → bigger大→更大
hot → hotter热→更热

Adjectives with two or more syllables有两个或多个音节的形容词

If a two-syllable adjective ends in a consonant and -y, we change -y to -i and add -er:如果一个双音节形容词以辅音和-y结尾，我们将-y改为-i并添加-er：

noisy → noisier吵闹→更吵闹
happy → happier快乐→更快乐
easy → easier容易 → 更容易

We use more to make comparative forms for most other two-syllable adjectives and for all adjectives with three or more syllables:对于大多数其他双音节形容词以及所有具有三个或更多音节的形容词，我们使用 more 来制作比较级形式：

crowded → more crowded拥挤→更加拥挤
stressful → more stressful压力大→压力更大
dangerous → more dangerous危险→更危险

Exception: You can either add -er/-r or use more with some two-syllable adjectives, such as common, cruel, gentle, handsome, likely, narrow, pleasant, polite, simple and stupid.例外：您可以添加 -er/-r 或与一些双音节形容词一起使用 more，例如 common、cruel、gentle、enjoy、likely、narrow、please、police、simple 和 Stupid。

I think life in the countryside is simpler than in the city. 我认为农村的生活比城市简单。
It’s more simple to live in the city because everything you need is there. 在城市生活更简单，因为你需要的一切都在那里。

Irregular adjectives 不规则形容词

The adjectives good, bad and far have irregular comparative forms:形容词good、bad和far有不规则的比较级形式：

good → better好→更好
bad → worse坏 → 更糟
far → further/farther远 → 更远/更远

Than比

When we want to say which person or thing we are comparing with, we can use than:当我们想要表达我们正在与哪个人或事物进行比较时，我们可以使用than：

Their house is cleaner than ours. 他们的房子比我们的干净。
Traffic is slower in the city than in the countryside. 城市的交通比乡村慢。
After the race I was more tired than Anne. 比赛结束后我比安妮还累。

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】04 Articles 'the' or no article-冠词：“the”或无冠词
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】04 Articles: ‘the’ or no article-冠词：“the”或无冠词

Do you know when you need to use the in common phrases and place names? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.您知道什么时候需要使用常用短语和地名吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see when the is and isn’t used.查看这些示例以了解何时使用和不使用。

I’m going to bed.我去睡觉了。
I walk to work.我步行去上班。
My children are going to start school.我的孩子们要开始上学了。
I visited the school yesterday.我昨天参观了学校。
Mount Everest is in the Himalayas.珠穆朗玛峰位于喜马拉雅山脉。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1

Articles 1: 1

Complete the sentences with ‘a’, ‘an’ or ‘the’, or ‘-‘ if no article is needed.

  • Question
  1. What time do you finish (1)Incorrect work?
  2. He’s in (2) Correct India.
  3. When she finishes (3) Correct school, she wants to study medicine at (4) university.
  4. (5) Nile is the longest river in (6) Africa. It flows north from (7) Lake Victoria to the Mediterranean Sea.
  5. He’s at (8) hospital visiting his mum.
  6. I’m really tired. I’m going to go (9) home and go to (10) bed early.
  7. They’re in (11) Alps on a climbing holiday.
  8. They caught him and he was sent to (12) prison.
  • Answer
  1. What time do you finish (-) work?
  2. He’s in (-) India.
  3. When she finishes (-) school, she wants to study medicine at (-) university.
  4. (The) Nile is the longest river in (-) Africa. It flows north from (-) Lake Victoria to the Mediterranean Sea.
  5. He’s at (the) hospital visiting his mum.
  6. I’m really tired. I’m going to go (-) home and go to (-) bed early.
  7. They’re in (the) Alps on a climbing holiday.
  8. They caught him and he was sent to (-) prison.

Grammar explanation语法解释

Here are some ways we use articles in common phrases and place names.以下是我们在常用短语和地名中使用冠词的一些方法。

Common phrases常用短语

We don’t usually use an article in expressions with bed, work and home.我们通常不会在表示 bed、work 和 home 的表达中使用冠词。

go to bed / be in bed上床睡觉/上床睡觉
go to work / be at work / start work / finish work去上班/正在工作/开始工作/完成工作
go home / be at home / get home / stay at home回家/待在家里/回家/呆在家里

We also don’t normally use an article in expressions with school, university, prison and hospital.我们通常也不在学校、大学、监狱和医院的表达中使用冠词。

start school / go to school / be at school开始上学/去学校/在学校
go to university / be at university上大学/在大学
be sent to prison / go to prison / be in prison被送进监狱/入狱/入狱
go to hospital / be in hospital去医院/住院

But we usually use the if someone is just visiting the place, and not there as a student/prisoner/patient, etc.但如果有人只是访问该地方，而不是作为学生/囚犯/病人等，我们通常会使用这个词。

My son has started school now. I went to the school to meet his teacher.我儿子现在已经开始上学了。我去学校见他的老师。
I went to the prison a lot when I was a social worker.当我担任社会工作者时，我经常去监狱。
I’m at the hospital. My sister has just had a baby.我在医院。我姐姐刚刚生完孩子。

Place names地名

We don’t normally use an article for continents, most countries, cities, towns, lakes, mountains or universities. So, we say:我们通常不会用冠词来表示各大洲、大多数国家、城市、城镇、湖泊、山脉或大学。所以，我们说：

Africa, Asia, Europe非洲、亚洲、欧洲
India, Ghana, Peru, Denmark印度、加纳、秘鲁、丹麦
Addis Ababa, Hanoi, New York, Moscow亚的斯亚贝巴、河内、纽约、莫斯科
Lake Victoria, Lake Superior, Lake Tanganyika维多利亚湖、苏必利尔湖、坦噶尼喀湖
Mount Everest, Mount Kilimanjaro, Mount Elbrus珠穆朗玛峰、乞力马扎罗山、厄尔布鲁士山
Cardiff University, Harvard University, Manchester University卡迪夫大学、哈佛大学、曼彻斯特大学

Some countries are different. Country names with United have the. There are other countries which are exceptions too. So, we say:有些国家有所不同。国家名称中带有 United 的。还有其他国家也属于例外。所以，我们说：

the United Arab Emirates, the United Kingdom, the United States of America阿拉伯联合酋长国、英国、美利坚合众国
the Bahamas, the Gambia巴哈马、冈比亚

Seas and oceans, mountain ranges and rivers have the:海洋、山脉和河流有the：

the Atlantic, the Pacific, the Mediterranean大西洋、太平洋、地中海
the Andes, the Himalayas, the Alps安第斯山脉、喜马拉雅山脉、阿尔卑斯山
the Nile, the Amazon, the Yangtze尼罗河、亚马逊河、长江

Universities with of in the title also have the:标题中带有 的大学还有：

the University of Cape Town, the University of Delhi, the University of Tokyo开普敦大学、德里大学、东京大学

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

  • Question

  2. I’m going to (2) prison to see my uncle.
  3. (3) University of Nottingham is in (4) United Kingdom.
  4. Every Friday my grandad goes to (5) prison to teach a maths class.

  7. I’m going to (9) school for a parents’ meeting.

  • Answer
  1. I’m still at (-) work but I’ll leave soon.
  2. I’m going to (the) prison to see my uncle.
  3. (The) University of Nottingham is in (the) United Kingdom.
  4. Every Friday my grandad goes to (the) prison to teach a maths class.
  5. She was born in Japan, but she went to (-) university in (the) Bahamas.
  6. My daughter does piano classes after (-) school.
  7. I’m going to (the) school for a parents’ meeting.
  8. The Danube flows from (-) Germany, through (-) Central Europe to (the) Black Sea.

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】03 Articles 'a', 'an', 'the'-冠词
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】03 Articles: ‘a’, ‘an’, ‘the’-冠词

Do you know how to use a, an and the? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用 a、an 和 the 吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how articles are used.查看这些示例以了解如何使用冠词。

She’s a doctor.她是一名医生。
I need an umbrella.我需要一把雨伞。
Have you heard the news?你听说（这件新闻）了吗？
I don’t like spiders.我不喜欢蜘蛛。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1

Articles 1: 1

Complete the sentences with ‘a’, ‘an’ or ‘the’, or ‘-‘ if no article is needed.

  • Question
  1. I like listening to (1) music. It helps me relax.
  2. (2) money he gave me wasn’t enough.
  3. He doesn’t like (3) dogs. One bit him when he was a child.
  4. Could you please pass me (4) salt?
  5. Do you want (5) apple? I’ve got two in my bag.
  6. I can take (6) children to school today.
  7. This is my uncle Phil. He’s (7) teacher and he lives in London.
  8. Is there (8) university where you live?
  • Answer
  1. I like listening to (-) music. It helps me relax.
  2. (The) money he gave me wasn’t enough.
  3. He doesn’t like (-) dogs. One bit him when he was a child.
  4. Could you please pass me (the) salt?
  5. Do you want (an) apple? I’ve got two in my bag.
  6. I can take (the) children to school today.
  7. This is my uncle Phil. He’s (a) teacher and he lives in London.
  8. Is there (a) university where you live?

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

Here are some of the most important things to know about using articles.以下是有关使用文章需要了解的一些最重要的事项。

Jobs工作

When we say what people’s jobs are, we usually use a/an.当我们说人们的工作是什么时，我们通常使用 a/an。

He’s an architect.他是一名建筑师。
She’s a scientist.她是一位科学家。
My grandmother was a teacher.我的祖母是一名教师。

Singular nouns单数名词

Singular, countable nouns always have an article – a/an or the (or another determiner – my, your, this, that, etc.).单数、可数名词总是有冠词 – a/an 或 the（或另一个限定词 – my、your、this、that 等）。

We use a/an – the indefinite article – when we talk about something for the first time, or something that is part of a group or type.当我们第一次谈论某件事或某个群体或类型的一部分时，我们使用 a/an（不定冠词）。

I saw a good film yesterday.昨天我看了一部好电影。
Do you want a drink?你想喝一杯吗？

We use a when the word that follows it begins with a consonant sound. We use an when it’s followed by a vowel sound. This makes pronunciation easier.当后面的单词以辅音开头时，我们使用 a。当后面跟着元音时我们使用 an。这使得发音更容易。

She has a university degree.她拥有大学学位。
It took me an hour to get home.我花了一个小时才到家。

We use the – the definite article – when the listener already knows which thing we are talking about because it was mentioned before or because there’s only one of them.当听众已经知道我们在谈论哪件事时，我们使用定冠词，因为它之前已经提到过，或者因为只有其中一个。

I’m going to take the dog for a walk.我要带狗去散步。
Have you seen the car key?你看到车钥匙了吗？
They go to the school next to the bridge.他们去了桥旁边的学校。

Things in general一般事物

When we talk about things in general, we normally use a plural or uncountable noun with no article.当我们谈论一般事物时，我们通常使用复数或不可数名词，不带冠词。

Birds eat worms.鸟吃虫子。
Water freezes at 0°C.水在 0°C 时结冰。
Children need a lot of sleep.孩子们需要大量的睡眠。

Particular groups of things特定的事物组

When we talk about a particular group of things, we use the.当我们谈论一组特定的事物时，我们使用。

We went to the zoo and saw the kangaroos. (These are the particular kangaroos in that zoo – not kangaroos in general.)我们去了动物园，看到了袋鼠。 （这些是动物园里的特殊袋鼠，而不是一般的袋鼠。）

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2

Articles 1: 2

Complete the sentences with ‘a’, ‘an’ or ‘the’, or ‘-‘ if no article is needed.

  • Question
  1. Do you want (1) sandwich? I’ve got cheese and bread in the shopping bag.
  2. She wants to be (2) ambulance driver when she finishes school.
  3. Did you see (3) moon last night?
  4. I really hate (4) mosquitos. They always bite me.
  5. If you need to contact me over the weekend, please send me (5) email.
  6. I’m a fun-loving person. I love (6) parties and dancing!
  7. I’ll be there in (7) hour.
  8. (8) teachers at my son’s school are great.
  • Answer
  1. Do you want (a) sandwich? I’ve got cheese and bread in the shopping bag.
  2. She wants to be (an) ambulance driver when she finishes school.
  3. Did you see (the) moon last night?
  4. I really hate (-) mosquitos. They always bite me.
  5. If you need to contact me over the weekend, please send me (an) email.
  6. I’m a fun-loving person. I love (-) parties and dancing!
  7. I’ll be there in (an) hour.
  8. (The) teachers at my son’s school are great.

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】02 Adjectives ending in '-ed' and '-ing'-以“-ed”和“-ing”结尾的形容词
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】02 Adjectives ending in ‘-ed’ and ‘-ing’-以“-ed”和“-ing”结尾的形容词

Do you know the difference between bored and boring? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道无聊和无聊之间的区别吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how adjectives ending in -ed and -ing are used.查看这些示例，了解如何使用以 -ed 和 -ing 结尾的形容词。

I was really bored in that presentation.我对那个演讲真的很无聊。
That was a really boring presentation.那是一次非常无聊的演讲。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1-语法测试1

Using ‘have’ and ‘have got’: 2

Choose the correct words.

  • Question
  1. My grandfather ______ got a white beard.
  • Answer
  1. My grandfather ______ got a white beard.

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

Adjectives that end in -ed (e.g. bored, interested) and adjectives that end in -ing (e.g. boring, interesting) are often confused.以 -ed 结尾的形容词（例如无聊、感兴趣）和以 -ing 结尾的形容词（例如无聊、有趣）经常会混淆。

-ed adjectives-ed 形容词

Adjectives that end in -ed generally describe emotions – they tell us how people feel.以 -ed 结尾的形容词通常描述情感——它们告诉我们人们的感受。

I was so bored in that lesson, I almost fell asleep.那堂课我实在是太无聊了，差点就睡着了。
He was surprised to see Helen after all those years.这么多年后他再次见到海伦，他感到很惊讶。
She was really tired and went to bed early.她实在是太累了，早早就睡觉了。

-ing adjectives-ing 形容词

Adjectives that end in -ing generally describe the thing that causes the emotion – a boring lesson makes you feel bored.以-ing结尾的形容词通常描述引起情绪的事物——无聊的课程让你感到无聊。

Have you seen that film? It’s really frightening.你看过那部电影吗？实在是太可怕了。
I could listen to her for hours. She’s so interesting.我可以听她讲几个小时。她真有趣。
I can’t sleep! That noise is really annoying!我睡不着！这噪音实在是太烦人了！

Here are some adjectives that can have both an -ed and an -ing form.以下是一些可以同时具有 -ed 和 -ing 形式的形容词。

annoyed生气annoying恼人的
bored无聊的boring无聊的
confused使困惑confusing令人困惑的
disappointed失望的disappointing令人失望的
excited兴奋的exciting令人兴奋的
frightened受惊frightening令人恐惧的
interested感兴趣的interesting有趣的
surprised惊讶surprising奇怪
tired疲劳的tiring累
worried担心worrying令人担忧

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2-语法测试2

Choose the correct words.

  1. My grandfather ______ got a white beard.
  • Answer
  1. My grandfather ______ got a white beard.

entry.title: 【A1-A2-Grammar】01 Adjectives and prepositions-形容词和介词
entry.content:
【A1-A2-Grammar】01 Adjectives and prepositions-形容词和介词

Do you know how to use adjectives with prepositions like interested in or similar to? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.你知道如何使用带有介词的形容词，例如“感兴趣”或“相似”吗？通过互动练习测试您所掌握的知识，并阅读说明来帮助您。

Look at these examples to see how adjectives are used with prepositions.查看这些示例，了解形容词如何与介词一起使用。

I’m interested in the idea.我对这个想法很感兴趣。
My jacket is similar to yours.我的夹克和你的很相似。
She’s brilliant at maths.她的数学非常出色。
My neighbour is angry about the party.我的邻居对这个聚会很生气。

Try this exercise to test your grammar.尝试这个练习来测试你的语法。

Grammar test 1语法测试1

Adjectives and prepositions: 1

Choose the correct word.

  • Question
  1. I’m really proud ___ you!
    of
    to
    with
  2. She’s responsible ___ health and safety.
    for
    in
    of
  3. He’s allergic ___ seafood.
    of
    to
    with
  4. They’re interested ___ our project.
    about
    in
    on
  5. I’m addicted ___ that new series on Channel 4.
    of
    to
    with
  6. Sugar is bad ___ your teeth.
    at
    for
    of
  7. I’m really excited ___ the new house.
    about
    of
    to
  8. My boss is terrible ___ communicating.
    at
    in
    to
  • Answer
  1. I’m really proud ___ you!
    ✔of
    to
    with
  2. She’s responsible ___ health and safety.
    ✔for
    in
    of
  3. He’s allergic ___ seafood.
    of
    ✔to
    with
  4. They’re interested ___ our project.
    about
    ✔in
    on
  5. I’m addicted ___ that new series on Channel 4.
    of
    ✔to
    with
  6. Sugar is bad ___ your teeth.
    at
    ✔for
    of
  7. I’m really excited ___ the new house.
    ✔about
    of
    to
  8. My boss is terrible ___ communicating.
    ✔at
    in
    to

Read the explanation to learn more.阅读说明以了解更多信息。

Grammar explanation语法解释

Some adjectives go with certain prepositions. There are no grammatical rules for which preposition is used with which adjective, so it’s a good idea to try to learn them together. To help you do this, write new vocabulary in your notebook in a sentence or phrase.有些形容词与某些介词搭配。介词与形容词的使用没有语法规则，因此最好尝试一起学习它们。为了帮助您做到这一点，请在笔记本上用句子或短语写下新词汇。

However, there are some patterns that can help you. Let’s look at them first. Remember that a preposition is followed by a noun or a gerund (-ing form).但是，有一些模式可以帮助您。我们先来看看它们。请记住，介词后跟名词或动名词（-ing 形式）。

With at 使用at

We use at with adjectives like good/bad/amazing/brilliant/terrible, etc. to talk about skills and abilities.我们将 at 与好/坏/惊人/辉煌/可怕等形容词一起使用来谈论技能和能力。

He’s really good at English.他英语真的很好。
She’s amazing at the piano.她的钢琴弹得很棒。
They’re terrible at organising anything.他们不擅长组织任何事情。
I’m not very good at drawing.我不太擅长画画。

With about 使用about

We often use about with adjectives of feelings like angry/excited/happy/nervous/sad/stressed/worried, etc. to explain what is causing that feeling.我们经常将 about 与表示感觉的形容词一起使用，例如愤怒/兴奋/快乐/紧张/悲伤/压力/担心等来解释是什么导致了这种感觉。

I’m angry about the decision.我对这个决定感到愤怒。
He’s nervous about the presentation.他对演讲感到紧张。
She’s excited about the new job.她对新工作感到很兴奋。
They were worried about the exam.他们很担心考试。

With of 使用of

However, sometimes we use of with feelings.然而，有时我们会用of来表达感情。

She was afraid of telling her mum.她不敢告诉妈妈。
I’m frightened of having an accident.我害怕发生意外。
He’s scared of flying.他害怕飞行。
You should be proud of your progress.你应该为自己的进步感到自豪。

With to使用to

We can use to to show the connection between people or things.我们可以用 to 来表示人或事物之间的联系。

He’s married to the director.他和导演结婚了。
I’m addicted to my phone.我对手机上瘾了。
I’m allergic to nuts.我对坚果过敏。
It’s similar to the old one.这和旧的很相似。

We can also use to to talk about someone’s behaviour towards someone else.我们还可以使用 to 来谈论某人对其他人的行为。

They were really friendly to me.他们对我真的很友好。
Was he nice to you?他对你好吗？
He is always polite to everyone.他对每个人总是很有礼貌。
She was very rude to the waitress.她对女服务员非常粗鲁。

Here are some other useful adjectives with prepositions.这里有一些其他有用的带有介词的形容词。

With for使用for

Exercise is good for you.锻炼对你有好处。
Stress is bad for you.压力对你有害。
The town is famous for its cheese.该镇以其奶酪而闻名。
I’m responsible for the financial side of the business.我负责公司的财务方面。

With in使用in

She’s interested in the project.她对这个项目很感兴趣。
They want someone who’s experienced in design.他们想要有设计经验的人。
I didn’t want to get involved in the argument.我不想卷入争论。

Do this exercise to test your grammar again.做这个练习来再次测试你的语法。

Grammar test 2语法测试2

Countable and uncountable nouns 1: 2

    about
    in

    about

  7. Eating a lot of red meat is not good ___ you.
    at
    for
    on
  8. I’m afraid ___ flying.
    of
    to

  1. She’s interested ___ buying the flat.
    about

    on
  2. I’m a bit nervous ___ going somewhere so different.

  3. The activities will be similar ___ what we did last year.

monument

  • 简明

英/ˈmɒnjumənt/美/ˈmɑːnjumənt/
n.纪念碑，纪念馆，纪念物；遗址，名胜古迹；典范；塑像，墓碑；有永久价值的作品

v.为……树碑

高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL
复数monuments

  • 柯林斯

monument/ˈmɒnjʊmənt/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-COUNT A monument is a large structure, usually made of stone, which is built to remind people of an event in history or of a famous person. 纪念碑

    • …a newly restored monument commemorating a 119-year-old tragedy.
    …为纪念一起有着119年历史的惨剧而新修复的一座纪念碑。

  2. N-COUNT A monument is something such as a castle or bridge that was built a very long time ago and is regarded as an important part of a country’s history. 历史遗迹

    • …the ancient monuments of Mexico and Peru.
    …墨西哥和秘鲁的历史古迹。

  3. N-COUNT If you describe something as a monument to someone’s qualities, you mean that it is a very good example of the results or effects of those qualities. 典范

    • By his international achievements he leaves a fitting monument to his beliefs.
    他在国际上的成就恰好成为他信仰的一个例证。

moderation

  • Chatgpt

“Moderation” 是一个名词，意思是适度、节制或中庸。它指的是在行为、态度或反应中保持适中的状态，不过分也不不及，常常强调平衡和控制。

定义

Moderation：适度，节制，中庸。指在数量、强度或程度上保持适中的状态，不极端。

用法和例句

  1. 描述行为或态度

    • He eats sweets in moderation to maintain his health.
      • 他适量吃甜食以保持健康。

  2. 描述某种程度或量

    • Moderation in all things is the key to a balanced life.
      • 凡事适度是保持平衡生活的关键。

  3. 描述调节或控制

    • The moderator ensured that the debate was conducted in moderation.
      • 调解人确保辩论以适度进行。

相关词汇

  • Restraint：克制，指控制或抑制情绪、行为等。

    • She showed restraint by not reacting angrily.
    • 她表现出克制，没有愤怒地反应。

  • Balance：平衡，指均衡状态。

    • A balanced diet is important for good health.
    • 均衡的饮食对健康很重要。

  • Temperance：节制，通常指对饮食、酒精等的节制。

    • The movement promoted temperance as a way to improve society.
    • 这场运动提倡节制以改善社会。

语法

Moderation 是不可数名词，因此没有复数形式。

例句解析

  1. She believes in moderation when it comes to exercise, avoiding both excessive workouts and inactivity.

    • 她在锻炼方面相信适度，避免过度锻炼和不活动。
    • 这里的 “moderation” 表示在锻炼强度上保持适中。

  2. Drinking alcohol in moderation is generally considered safe.

    • 适量饮酒通常被认为是安全的。
    • 这里的 “in moderation” 表示适量饮酒。

  3. The principle of moderation can be applied to various aspects of life, from eating habits to spending.

    • 适度的原则可以应用于生活的各个方面，从饮食习惯到消费。
    • 这里的 “moderation” 指在多个方面保持适度。

背景信息

“Moderation” 是一个强调平衡和适度的概念，常常出现在健康、饮食、生活方式等方面的讨论中。适度意味着不过度地追求某一方面，而是在各方面保持一种平衡和控制。这种理念在许多文化和哲学中都被提倡，例如古希腊哲学中的“中庸之道”。

通过这些解释和例子，希望你对“moderation”这个单词有了更全面的理解。

日拱一卒

  • Chatgpt

“日拱一卒”是一种比喻，意思是每天努力做一点点，积累小进步，最终达到目标。它的英文表达可以是：

  1. “Progress one step at a time.”
  2. “Move forward one step at a time.”
  3. “Advance step by step each day.”
  4. “Make gradual progress every day.”

这些表达方式传达了每天不断努力，积累小进步的意思。可以根据具体语境选择最合适的表达方式。例如：

  • “Success comes from progressing one step at a time.”
  • “If you move forward one step at a time, you’ll eventually reach your goal.”
  • “Advance step by step each day to achieve your dreams.”
  • “By making gradual progress every day, you can accomplish great things.”

Eventually

  • Chatgpt

“Eventually” 是一个副词，用来表示某件事情最终会发生，尽管可能经过了一段时间或经历了一些过程。它相当于中文的“最终”，“终于”，或者“最后”。

用法和例句

  1. 表示经过时间后最终发生

    • He studied hard and eventually passed the exam.
      • 他努力学习，最终通过了考试。
    • They searched for hours and eventually found the missing keys.
      • 他们找了好几个小时，最后找到了丢失的钥匙。

  2. 强调结果或结论

    • After many trials, they eventually succeeded.
      • 经过许多尝试，他们终于成功了。
    • She kept working on her project and eventually finished it.
      • 她不断地在项目上努力，最终完成了它。

同义词

  • Finally

    • He finally finished his homework.
    • 他终于完成了作业。

  • Ultimately

    • Ultimately, the decision is yours.
    • 最终，决定权在你手里。

  • In the end

    • In the end, everything turned out well.
    • 最后，一切都变好了。

语法

  • 位置：通常放在句子的中间或末尾。

    • She worked hard for many years and eventually retired.
    • After several discussions, they eventually agreed on a plan.

  • 搭配：常与动词连用，表示经过一段时间或一些步骤后所达到的结果。

    • Eventually + 动词
      • Eventually realized, eventually decided, eventually became

例句解析

  1. The two countries eventually signed a peace treaty.

    • 这两个国家最终签署了和平条约。
    • “Eventually” 表示尽管可能经历了长时间的谈判和冲突，最终达成了和平。

  2. I kept looking for a job and eventually found one that I love.

    • 我不断地找工作，最终找到了一个我喜欢的。
    • “Eventually” 强调经过一段时间和努力后，达到了满意的结果。

通过这些例子和解释，希望你对 “eventually” 这个单词有了更深入的理解。

mentality

  • Chatgpt

“Mentality“ 是一个名词，指的是人的思维方式、心态、态度或心理特征。它来源于拉丁词根 “mens” 或 “mentis”，意思是“心智”或“精神”。

定义

Mentality：指一个人或一群人对待某事物的思维方式或心态。它描述了我们如何看待世界、处理问题以及应对挑战。

用法和例句

  1. 描述个体的思维方式或心态

    • She has a very positive mentality towards challenges.
      • 她对待挑战有一种非常积极的心态。

  2. 描述群体的共同心态或思维方式

    • The team’s winning mentality led them to victory.
      • 团队的取胜心态带领他们走向了胜利。

  3. 与特定领域或情况相关的心态

    • An entrepreneurial mentality is crucial for starting a business.
      • 创业心态对于创业来说是至关重要的。

  4. 可以是积极的也可以是消极的

    • A growth mentality encourages continuous learning and improvement.
      • 成长心态鼓励持续学习和改进。
    • A defeatist mentality can hinder success.
      • 失败主义心态可能会阻碍成功。

相关词汇

  • Mindset：心态、思维模式

    • They adopted a new mindset to tackle the problem.
    • 他们采用了一种新的思维模式来解决问题。

  • Attitude：态度

    • Her positive attitude makes her a great leader.
    • 她的积极态度使她成为一位出色的领导者。

  • Outlook：看法、展望

    • His optimistic outlook on life is inspiring.
    • 他对生活的乐观看法令人鼓舞。

语法

Mentality 是不可数名词，因此通常不与冠词 “a” 或 “an” 连用，也不会有复数形式。

例句解析

  1. The competitive mentality of the athletes was evident in their performance.

    • 运动员们的竞争心态在他们的表现中显而易见。
    • 这里 “mentality” 描述了运动员们为了胜利所持有的坚定和进取的态度。

  2. Changing the corporate mentality can be challenging but rewarding.

    • 改变公司的心态可能会很有挑战性，但也很有回报。
    • 这里 “mentality” 指的是公司内部对待工作、创新和合作的整体思维方式。

  3. Developing a mentality of gratitude can improve overall happiness.

    • 培养感恩的心态可以提高整体幸福感。
    • 这里 “mentality” 描述了一种思维方式或态度，即对生活中的事物心存感激。

通过这些例子和解释，希望你对 “mentality” 这个单词有了更深入的理解。

ostrich

  • Chatgpt

“Ostrich“ 是一个名词，指的是鸵鸟，这是一种大型、不飞的鸟类，主要生活在非洲。鸵鸟以其快速奔跑和独特的行为习惯而闻名。

定义

Ostrich：鸵鸟，一种不能飞的大鸟，具有长脖子、长腿和大眼睛。它们是世界上现存体型最大的鸟类。

用法和例句

  1. 描述实际的动物

    • The ostrich is the largest living bird in the world.
      • 鸵鸟是世界上现存体型最大的鸟。

  2. 比喻用法

    • To bury one’s head in the sand like an ostrich：指逃避现实或拒绝面对问题的行为。这个比喻源自一种错误的观念，即鸵鸟在受到威胁时会把头埋在沙子里，实际上鸵鸟只是低头贴近地面来观察周围的危险。
    • He’s like an ostrich with his head in the sand, refusing to acknowledge the problems in his company.
      • 他就像把头埋在沙子里的鸵鸟，拒绝承认公司里的问题。

相关词汇

  • Emu：鸸鹋，澳大利亚的一种大型不飞的鸟，类似于鸵鸟。

    • The emu, like the ostrich, is a flightless bird.
    • 鸸鹋和鸵鸟一样，是一种不能飞的鸟。

  • Flightless：不能飞的，指的是像鸵鸟这样的鸟类。

    • Penguins and ostriches are examples of flightless birds.
    • 企鹅和鸵鸟是不能飞的鸟类的例子。

语法

Ostrich 是一个可数名词。单数形式为 “ostrich”，复数形式为 “ostriches”。

例句解析

  1. Ostriches can run at speeds of up to 70 kilometers per hour.

    • 鸵鸟可以以每小时高达70公里的速度奔跑。
    • 这里 “ostriches” 是鸵鸟的复数形式，强调了鸵鸟快速奔跑的特点。

  2. The ostrich egg is the largest of any bird species.

    • 鸵鸟蛋是所有鸟类中最大的。
    • 这里 “ostrich” 修饰 “egg”，强调鸵鸟蛋的巨大体积。

  3. Stop being an ostrich and face the reality of the situation.

    • 不要再逃避现实，面对情况的现实吧。
    • 这里 “ostrich” 用作比喻，指代逃避问题的人。

文化和历史背景

鸵鸟在文化和历史上有多种象征意义。在某些文化中，鸵鸟象征着快速和力量，因为它们是跑得最快的鸟类之一。此外，由于鸵鸟大部分时间在地面上觅食，有时被错误地认为它们在受到威胁时会把头埋在沙子里，实际上它们是将头低到地面以更好地观察周围环境。

通过这些例子和解释，希望你对 “ostrich” 这个单词有了更全面的理解。

Ostrich Pillow

  • Chatgpt

“Ostrich Pillow” 是一个名词短语，指的是一种专为在旅途中或在办公室等环境中小憩而设计的枕头。这种枕头的形状和设计非常独特，模仿鸵鸟的外观，因此得名“鸵鸟枕”。

定义

Ostrich Pillow：一种创新的、舒适的枕头，设计用于提供一个私密、舒适的空间，让用户可以随时随地小憩。它的形状通常会包裹头部和手臂，提供支撑和遮光效果。

特点

  • 便携性：设计紧凑，便于携带，适合在旅途中使用。
  • 舒适性：采用柔软的材料，提供良好的支撑和舒适感。
  • 遮光效果：包裹式设计可以遮挡光线，帮助用户更容易入睡。
  • 多功能：不仅可以在旅行中使用，还适合在办公室、图书馆等地方小憩。

用法和例句

  1. 描述产品

    • I bought an Ostrich Pillow for my long flights.
      • 我买了一个鸵鸟枕，用于长途飞行。

  2. 说明用途

    • The Ostrich Pillow is perfect for napping at your desk.
      • 鸵鸟枕非常适合在办公桌上小憩。

  3. 强调舒适性和便携性

    • With the Ostrich Pillow, you can sleep comfortably anywhere.
      • 有了鸵鸟枕，你可以在任何地方舒适地睡觉。

相关词汇

  • Travel pillow：旅行枕，一般指U型枕，用于在旅行中提供颈部支撑。

    • I always take my travel pillow when I fly.
    • 我乘飞机时总是带着我的旅行枕。

  • Nap：小睡，打盹。

    • I took a nap using my Ostrich Pillow during the lunch break.
    • 我午休时用鸵鸟枕打了个盹。

  • Ergonomic：符合人体工程学的，指设计上考虑到了使用者的舒适和健康。

    • The Ostrich Pillow has an ergonomic design to support your head and neck.
    • 鸵鸟枕的设计符合人体工程学，可以支撑你的头部和颈部。

例句解析

  1. The Ostrich Pillow has a unique design that covers your head and hands for a cozy nap.

    • 鸵鸟枕有一个独特的设计，可以包裹你的头和手，让你舒适地小憩。
    • 这里强调了鸵鸟枕的独特设计和舒适性。

  2. I love using my Ostrich Pillow on long train rides to catch up on sleep.

    • 我喜欢在长途火车上使用我的鸵鸟枕来补觉。
    • 这里突出了鸵鸟枕在长途旅行中的实用性。

  3. With the Ostrich Pillow, you can create a personal napping space wherever you are.

    • 有了鸵鸟枕，你可以在任何地方创建一个个人的小憩空间。
    • 这里强调了鸵鸟枕的便携性和多功能性。

背景信息

Ostrich Pillow 是由设计公司 Studio Banana 和 Kawamura-Ganjavian 联合设计的产品。它的目的是为忙碌的现代人提供一个方便的方式，在工作或旅行时快速恢复精力。自从推出以来，Ostrich Pillow 因其创新和独特的设计受到了广泛关注。

通过这些解释和例子，希望你对 “Ostrich Pillow” 这个词组有了更全面的理解。

recruitment

  • Chatgpt

“Recruitment” 是一个名词，指的是招聘或招募人员的过程，即公司或组织寻找、吸引、面试和雇用新员工的过程。这个词源自拉丁语“recruitare”，意为“补充”。

定义

Recruitment：招聘，指公司或组织为填补职位空缺而进行的寻找、吸引和选择合适人选的过程。

用法和例句

  1. 描述招聘过程

    • The recruitment process involves several stages including application, interview, and selection.
      • 招聘过程包括多个阶段，包括申请、面试和选择。

  2. 公司或组织的招聘活动

    • Our company is focusing on recruitment to fill key positions.
      • 我们公司正在集中精力招聘，以填补关键职位。

  3. 招聘策略和方法

    • Effective recruitment strategies are essential for attracting top talent.
      • 有效的招聘策略对于吸引顶尖人才至关重要。

相关词汇

  • Hiring：雇用，指的是雇佣员工的行为。

    • The company is hiring new staff for the marketing department.
    • 公司正在为营销部门雇用新员工。

  • Job posting：职位发布，指的是在招聘网站或公告栏上发布职位空缺的信息。

    • The job posting attracted many qualified candidates.
    • 这则职位发布吸引了许多合格的候选人。

  • Interview：面试，指的是评估候选人是否适合某职位的对话或会面。

    • She prepared thoroughly for the job interview.
    • 她为这次工作面试做了充分的准备。

  • Onboarding：入职培训，指的是新员工加入公司后的培训和适应过程。

    • Effective onboarding helps new hires adjust to the company culture.
    • 有效的入职培训有助于新员工适应公司的文化。

语法

Recruitment 是不可数名词，所以它没有复数形式。它通常与冠词 “the” 连用，尤其是在谈论具体的招聘过程时。

例句解析

  1. The recruitment team is reviewing all applications this week.

    • 招聘团队本周正在审查所有申请。
    • 这里的 “recruitment team” 指负责招聘的团队。

  2. We need to improve our recruitment methods to attract more qualified candidates.

    • 我们需要改进我们的招聘方法，以吸引更多合格的候选人。
    • 这里的 “recruitment methods” 指的是招聘的方法和策略。

  3. Online recruitment has become increasingly popular in recent years.

    • 在线招聘近年来变得越来越受欢迎。
    • 这里的 “online recruitment” 指通过互联网进行的招聘活动。

背景信息

招聘是企业和组织管理中至关重要的一部分。随着技术的发展，招聘方式也在不断演变。从传统的报纸广告和招聘会，到现代的在线招聘平台和社交媒体，招聘的渠道和方法变得更加多样化和高效。

通过这些解释和例子，希望你对“recruitment”这个单词有了更全面的理解。

战略上藐视，战术上重视

  • Chatgpt

“战略上藐视，战术上重视” 的英语表达可以是：

“Strategically, show disdain; tactically, show respect.”

或者可以稍微调整一下结构，使其更流畅：

“Show disdain strategically, but show respect tactically.”

这两种表达方式都传达了在整体战略上轻视对手，但在具体战术上认真对待对手的意思。

解释

  • Strategically, show disdain 或 Show disdain strategically:

    • 这部分指在整体战略上不要把对手看得太重要，保持自信和强势。

  • Tactically, show respect 或 Show respect tactically:

    • 这部分指在具体的战术执行上，要认真对待每一个细节，不低估对手的任何行动。

例句

  • “In business, it’s important to show disdain strategically, but show respect tactically to ensure you don’t underestimate your competition.”

    • 在商业中，重要的是在战略上藐视对手，但在战术上重视对手，以确保你不会低估竞争对手。

  • “Our military strategy follows the principle of showing disdain strategically while showing respect tactically, ensuring we remain confident yet vigilant.”

    • 我们的军事战略遵循战略上藐视、战术上重视的原则，确保我们保持自信但又警惕。

希望这些表达和解释能帮助你更好地理解和使用这句话的英文版本。

contemn

  • Chatgpt

“Contemn” 是一个动词，意思是轻视、蔑视或鄙视某人或某事。它的用法相对较为正式和文学化，不如 “disdain” 或 “scorn” 那么常用。

定义

Contemn：轻视，蔑视，指对某人或某事表现出极度的不尊重或轻视。

词源

“Contemn” 源自拉丁语 “contemnere”，由 “con-”（表示完全）和 “temnere”（表示轻视）组成。

用法和例句

  1. 描述一种态度或行为

    • He was a proud man who contemned those he considered beneath him.
      • 他是一个骄傲的人，轻视那些他认为比他低的人。

  2. 在正式或文学作品中使用

    • The philosopher contemned material wealth in favor of spiritual enlightenment.
      • 这位哲学家轻视物质财富，追求精神上的启迪。

  3. 表示极度的轻视

    • She contemned the idea of lowering her standards for anyone.
      • 她鄙视为任何人降低标准的想法。

相关词汇

  • Disdain：轻视，鄙视。

    • She looked at the messy room with disdain.
    • 她轻蔑地看着乱糟糟的房间。

  • Scorn：蔑视，轻蔑。

    • He spoke with scorn about the politicians.
    • 他轻蔑地谈论那些政治家。

  • Despise：鄙视，极其不喜欢。

    • She despises liars and cheats.
    • 她鄙视说谎者和骗子。

语法

“Contemn” 是一个及物动词，因此需要一个直接宾语来表示被轻视的对象。例如：

  • To contemn someone/something：轻视某人/某事。

例句解析

  1. He contemned the very idea of compromise.

    • 他轻视妥协的想法。
    • 这里的 “contemn” 表示对妥协这一概念的极度轻视。

  2. In her arrogance, she contemned all advice from others.

    • 她傲慢地轻视他人的所有建议。
    • 这里的 “contemn” 表示她对他人建议的极度不尊重。

  3. The poet contemned the shallow values of society.

    • 诗人轻视社会的浅薄价值观。
    • 这里的 “contemn” 表示诗人对社会价值观的蔑视。

用法注意

“Contemn” 比较正式和文学化，不常用于日常口语中。更常用的同义词是 “disdain” 和 “scorn”，它们在表达轻视和蔑视时更为普遍。

通过这些解释和例子，希望你对“contemn”这个单词有了更全面的理解。

tactically

  • Chatgpt

“Tactically” 是一个副词，源自形容词 “tactical”。它表示与策略或战术相关的方式，即在操作或行动层面上如何实现目标或应对情况。

定义

Tactically：从战术上，以策略方式。指的是在具体操作层面上采取的行动和措施，通常为了实现更大的战略目标。

用法和例句

  1. 军事和战术应用

    • The soldiers moved tactically to avoid enemy detection.
      • 士兵们战术性地移动，以避免被敌人发现。

  2. 商业和管理应用

    • The company tactically reduced prices to gain a competitive edge.
      • 公司战术性地降低价格，以获得竞争优势。

  3. 运动和游戏

    • The coach adjusted the team’s formation tactically during the match.
      • 教练在比赛中战术性地调整了球队的阵型。

相关词汇

  • Strategically：从战略上，指的是总体规划或长远目标的层面。

    • The company is strategically planning to expand into new markets.
    • 公司正在从战略上规划扩展到新市场。

  • Operationally：从操作上，指的是实际操作和执行层面。

    • Operationally, the new system has improved efficiency.
    • 从操作上看，新系统提高了效率。

  • Methodically：有条理地，指的是有序和系统地进行某事。

    • She methodically reviewed all the documents before the meeting.
    • 她在会议前有条不紊地审查了所有文件。

语法

Tactically 是一个副词，用来修饰动词、形容词或其他副词，表示行动或措施是从战术或策略的角度出发的。

例句解析

  1. The team acted tactically to outmaneuver their opponents.

    • 这支队伍战术性地行动，以超越他们的对手。
    • 这里的 “tactically” 表示团队采取的行动是经过策略考虑的。

  2. By tactically placing their resources, they maximized their efficiency.

    • 通过战术性地配置资源，他们最大化了效率。
    • 这里的 “tactically” 表示资源配置是基于策略的考虑。

  3. Tactically, it was a smart move to delay the launch until the market conditions improved.

    • 从战术上看，推迟发布直到市场条件改善是一个明智的举动。
    • 这里的 “tactically” 表示推迟发布的决定是基于策略的考虑。

背景信息

“Tactically” 通常用于描述具体的、短期的行动和决策，这些行动和决策是为了支持更大的战略目标。在军事、商业、体育等领域，这个词常常用于强调在具体情境中如何采取最佳行动。

通过这些解释和例子，希望你对“tactically”这个单词有了更全面的理解。
