    ✔False

Task 3-任务三

New Year’s resolutions – 3

Complete the sentences.

  • Question

often by every daya once twice

  1. I’m going to cook for my friends __ (one time) a month.
  2. I want to be able to run 10 kilometres __ the end of the year.
  3. I’m planning to go running three times __ week.
  4. I’m going to watch a film in English __ (two times) a week.
  5. I’m aiming to revise my English notes for ten minutes __ .
  6. I want to cook food at home more __ .
  • Answer
  1. I’m going to cook for my friends once (one time) a month.
  2. I want to be able to run 10 kilometres by the end of the year.
  3. I’m planning to go running three times a week.
  4. I’m going to watch a film in English twice (two times) a week.
  5. I’m aiming to revise my English notes for ten minutes every day .
  6. I want to cook food at home more often .

Discussion-讨论

How much annual leave do people normally get in your country? In your workplace, what is the general attitude to taking time off work?
在你们国家人们通常有多少年假？在你的工作场所，人们对请假的普遍态度是什么？

Vocabulary

resolutions

  • 简易

英/ˌrezəˈluːʃ(ə)n/美/ˌrezəˈluːʃ(ə)n/
n.决议，正式决定；（冲突、问题等的）解决，解决办法；决心，决定；坚决，果断；（电视、照相机、显微镜等的）清晰度，分辨率；（故事中主要矛盾的）冲突解开；（乐）解决（指和声中不协和音向协和音的进行）；（医）（炎症或其他症状的）消散，消退；（化）分解；（物理）（力或其他矢量的）分解

初中 | 高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | GRE
复数resolutions

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

resolution/ˌrɛzəˈluːʃən/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-COUNT A resolution is a formal decision made at a meeting by means of a vote. 决议

    • He replied that the UN had passed two major resolutions calling for a complete withdrawal.
    他回复说联合国已经通过要求完全撤军的两项重大决议。

  2. N-COUNT If you make a resolution, you decide to try very hard to do something. 决心

    • They made a resolution to lose all the weight gained during the Christmas holidays.
    他们下了一个决心要减掉圣诞节期间增加的全部体重。

  3. N-UNCOUNT Resolution is determination to do something or not do something. 决心

    • “I think I’ll try a hypnotist,” I said with sudden resolution.
    “我想我要找个催眠师试试，”我突然坚决地说。

  4. N-SING The resolution of a problem or difficulty is the final solving of it. 最终解决

    • …the successful resolution of a dispute involving UN inspectors in Baghdad.
    …对涉及联合国驻巴格达调查员的一项争议的成功解决。

revise

  • 简易

英/rɪˈvaɪz/美/rɪˈvaɪz/
v.改变，修正；修改，修订（书刊、估算等）；<英>温习，复习

n.修订，校订；（印刷）改样

【名】 （Revise）（法）勒维斯（人名）

高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL | GRE | GMAT | 商务英语
复数revises第三人称单数revises现在分词revising过去式revised过去分词revised

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

revise/rɪˈvaɪz/|CET4 TEM4
revisingrevisedrevises

  1. V-T If you revise the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to make them better or more suited to how things are. 修正 (对某事的想法)

    • With time he came to revise his opinion of the profession.
    随着时间的推移，他开始修正自己对这一职业的看法。

  2. V-T If you revise a price, amount, or estimate, you change it to make it more fair, realistic, or accurate. 调整 (使更合理、实际、准确)

    • They realized that some of their prices were higher than their competitors’ and revised prices accordingly.
    他们意识到他们的部分价格比竞争对手的高，就相应地调整了价格。

  3. V-T When you revise an article, a book, a law, or a piece of music, you change it in order to improve it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose. 修改; 修订 (使改进、更时尚、更适于某目的)

    • Three editors handled the work of revising the articles for publication.
    3名编辑负责对要出版的文章进行修订的工作。

  4. V-I When you revise for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination. (为考试) 复习

    • Revising for exams gives you a chance to bring together all the individual parts of the course.
    考前复习给你一个把课程各独立部分融会贯通的机会。

    • Review all the notes you need to cover for each course.
    复习所有你需要涵盖的每门课的笔记。

entry.title: 【B1-Writing】13 Important Time Management Skills For Workplace Success职场成功的重要时间管理技能
entry.content:
【B1-Writing】13 Important Time Management Skills For Workplace Success-职场成功的重要时间管理技能

What are time management skills, and why are they important in the workplace? Employees who manage their time well are more productive, more efficient, and more likely to meet deadlines. They focus on the most important and time-sensitive tasks and limit the amount of time wasted on non-essential duties. 什么是时间管理技能，为什么它们在工作场所很重要？管理好时间的员工生产力更高、效率更高，并且更有可能按时完成工作。他们专注于最重要和时间敏感的任务，并限制浪费在非必要职责上的时间。

Time management skills, like other soft skills, such as organizational skills, are in high demand. Employers will be assessing your ability to manage your time, and the effectiveness of your team to reach department objectives.时间管理技能与其他软技能（例如组织技能）一样，需求量很大。雇主将评估您管理时间的能力以及您的团队实现部门目标的有效性。

Learn about time management skills, understand why they are valuable in the workplace, review the different types of time management skills, and see examples of how they are used on the job.了解时间管理技能，了解它们为何在工作场所有价值，回顾不同类型的时间管理技能，并查看如何在工作中使用它们的示例。

What Are Time Management Skills? 什么是时间管理技能？

Time management involves both managing your own time and the time of the others. Time management means working efficiently, and employers in every industry look for staff that can make optimal use of the time available to them on the job. Saving time saves the organization money and increases revenue.时间管理包括管理自己的时间和他人的时间。时间管理意味着高效工作，每个行业的雇主都在寻找能够充分利用工作时间的员工。节省时间可以为组织节省资金并增加收入。

Effective time management requires staff to analyze their workload, assign priorities, and maintain focus on productive endeavors. 有效的时间管理要求员工分析他们的工作量、分配优先级并保持对富有成效的努力的关注。

Note笔记

Employees who are excellent time managers can eliminate distractions and enlist support from colleagues to help accomplish their goals.优秀的时间管理者可以消除干扰并获得同事的支持来帮助实现他们的目标。

Types of Time Management Skills 时间管理技能的类型

Prioritizing 确定优先顺序

It might be impossible to do every single minute task expected of you. You also might want to do everything all at once. But you must prioritize so that you are able to complete the most important tasks in an order that makes sense. When assigning priority, consider such factors as when each task needs to be done, how long it might take, how important it might be to others in the organization, what could happen if a task is not done, and whether any task might be interrupted by bottlenecks in the process.完成您期望的每分钟任务可能是不可能的。您可能还想一次性完成所有事情。但您必须确定优先顺序，以便能够按合理的顺序完成最重要的任务。分配优先级时，请考虑以下因素：每项任务需要何时完成、可能需要多长时间、它对组织中其他人的重要性、如果任务未完成会发生什么以及是否有任何任务可能被中断过程中遇到瓶颈。

  • Allocation分配
  • Managing Expectations管理期望
  • Waste Prevention废物预防
  • Prioritizing requests and demands优先考虑请求和要求
  • High-Value Activities (HVAs)高价值活动 (HVA)
  • Performance Reviews绩效评估
  • Goal Setting目标设定

Scheduling 日程安排

Scheduling is important because some tasks have to be done at specific times. Scheduling affects your day, your week, your month, as well as other people’s workflow. Most have specific times of the day when they are more or less productive as a result of energy levels and demands of the day. Schedules can be a good way to avoid procrastination, too.日程安排很重要，因为有些任务必须在特定时间完成。日程安排会影响你的一天、一周、一个月以及其他人的工作流程。大多数人在一天中都有特定的时间，根据当天的精力水平和需求，他们的工作效率会有所不同。时间表也是避免拖延的好方法。

  • Scheduling Software调度软件
  • Intentionality意向性
  • Punctuality准时
  • Breaking broader goals into milestones将更广泛的目标分解为里程碑
  • Breaking up milestones into projects将里程碑分解为项目

Task Management 任务管理

To-do lists (properly prioritized and integrated with your schedule) are a great way to avoid forgetting something important. They are also a great way to avoid spending all day thinking about everything you have to do. Remembering tasks takes energy and thinking about everything you have to do all week can be exhausting and overwhelming. Split all the necessary tasks up into a list for each day, and you won’t have to worry about all of it all at once. Just take your tasks one day at a time.待办事项列表（正确排列优先顺序并与您的日程安排相结合）是避免忘记重要事情的好方法。它们也是避免花一整天时间思考你必须做的一切的好方法。记住任务需要精力，而思考整个星期必须做的所有事情可能会让人筋疲力尽、不知所措。将每天所有必要的任务分成一个列表，您就不必一次担心所有事情。一天一次地完成你的任务。

  • Proactive积极主动的
  • Batching配料
  • Creating daily, weekly, and monthly to do lists创建每日、每周和每月的待办事项列表
  • Multitasking多任务处理
  • Thoroughness彻底性
  • Organization组织
  • Email Management电子邮件管理

Workload Management 工作负载管理

Pacing your work, even though it may seem an odd thing to call a skill, is an important time management concept. Although working long hours or skipping breaks can sometimes improve productivity in the short term, your exhaustion later will ensure that your overall productivity actually drops. Except for rare emergencies, it is important to resist the temptation to over work. Include necessary breaks, and a sensible quitting time, in your schedule.尽管将工作节奏称为技能似乎有些奇怪，但它是一个重要的时间管理概念。尽管长时间工作或不休息有时可以在短期内提高生产力，但随后的疲惫将确保您的整体生产力实际上下降。除了罕见的紧急情况外，抵制过度工作的诱惑很重要。在你的日程安排中包括必要的休息和合理的休息时间。

Knowing and enforcing an optimum workload for yourself ensures consistency in your performance and avoids burnout. Employers want to be able to count on you for the long-term.了解并执行适合自己的最佳工作量可确保您的表现保持一致并避免倦怠。雇主希望能够长期信赖您。

  • Process Management流程管理
  • Assertiveness自信
  • Eliminating Waste消除浪费
  • Taking Breaks休息一下

Delegation 委派

Depending on what type of work you do, you may be able to delegate some tasks. Knowing what and when to delegate is an important skill. Some people resist delegating, either because they want to maintain control or because they want to save money by not hiring assistants. Both approaches ultimately hurt productivity and raise costs.根据您从事的工作类型，您也许可以委派一些任务。知道委派什么以及何时委派是一项重要技能。有些人拒绝授权，要么是因为他们想保持控制权，要么是因为他们想通过不雇用助理来省钱。这两种方法最终都会损害生产力并提高成本。

Remember, however, that if you practice time management diligently and still can’t get everything done, you may be trying to do too much. It is better to succeed at a few tasks than to attempt and fail at many.但请记住，如果您努力进行时间管理，但仍然无法完成所有事情，那么您可能尝试做的事情太多了。在一些任务上取得成功比在许多任务上尝试并失败要好。

  • Seeking Expert Assistance寻求专家帮助
  • Moderating Meetings主持会议
  • Presentation推介会
  • Teamwork团队合作
  • Leadership领导
  • Collaboration合作
  • Motivation动机

More Time Management Skills 更多时间管理技巧

Here are more time management for resumes, cover letters, job applications, and interviews. Required skills will vary based on the job for which you’re applying, so also review our list of skills listed by job and type of skill.这里有更多关于简历、求职信、工作申请和面试的时间管理。所需的技能会根据您申请的职位而有所不同，因此请另请参阅我们按职位和技能类型列出的技能列表。

  • Auditing审计
  • Self-care自理
  • Openness开放性
  • Productivity Software生产力软件
  • Communication沟通
  • Adaptability适应性
  • High Stress Tolerance高抗压能力
  • Dependability可靠性
  • Attention to Detail注重细节
  • Deductive Reasoning演绎推理
  • Inductive Reasoning归纳推理
  • Critical Thinking批判性思维
  • Evaluating评估
  • Ongoing Improvement持续改进
  • Risk Management风险管理
  • Troubleshooting故障排除
  • Quality Assurance质量保证
  • Project Management项目管理
  • Conflict Management冲突管理
  • Discernment洞察力
  • Compliance遵守
  • Articulating铰接式
  • Brainstorming头脑风暴
  • Efficiency效率
  • Diligence勤勉
  • Problem Sensitivity问题敏感性

Examples of Time Management in the Workplace 工作场所时间管理的例子

This list provides examples of effective time management at work.此列表提供了有效工作时间管理的示例。

A - E

  • Adapting plans to changing circumstances.根据不断变化的情况调整计划。
  • Allocating time for specific tasks.为特定任务分配时间。
  • Analyzing processes and selecting the simplest way to accomplish a task.分析流程并选择最简单的方法来完成任务。
  • Asking for help when overwhelmed with demands.当需求不堪重负时寻求帮助。
  • Assertiveness to say no to inappropriate demands that distract from central duties.坚决拒绝那些分散中心职责的不适当要求。
  • Attacking more complex tasks when you have the highest energy and sharpest concentrations.当您精力充沛、注意力集中时，可以处理更复杂的任务。
  • Auditing how time is spent.审核时间的使用情况。
  • Avoiding excessive small talk with co-workers.避免与同事过多闲聊。
  • Avoiding procrastination; acting instead of worrying.避免拖延；行动而不是担忧。
  • Breaking broader goals into smaller parts and focusing on one step at a time.将更广泛的目标分解为更小的部分，一次专注于一个步骤。
  • Breaking up projects into manageable parts.将项目分解为可管理的部分。
  • Creating daily, weekly and monthly “to do” lists.创建每日、每周和每月的“待办事项”列表。
  • Creating schedules.创建时间表。
  • Delegating more routine tasks to lower level staff.将更多日常任务委派给较低级别的员工。
  • Eating well to maintain energy.吃得好以保持能量。
  • Eliminating time wasters.消除时间浪费。
  • Exercising and participating in other stress-reducing activities during leisure time to maximize energy when at work.在闲暇时间锻炼身体并参加其他减压活动，以最大限度地提高工作时的能量。

F - Z

  • Facilitating efficient meetings; sticking with time frames for meetings.促进高效的会议；遵守会议的时间框架。
  • Grouping similar tasks together to limit transition time.将类似的任务分组在一起以限制过渡时间。
  • Maintaining an organized work area.保持有组织的工作区域。
  • Multitasking; shifting smoothly from one task to another.多任务处理；顺利地从一项任务转移到另一项任务。
  • Openness to more efficient ways of doing things.对更有效的做事方式持开放态度。
  • Organizing digital files for easy retrieval.组织数字文件以便于检索。
  • Planning your day the night before or first thing in the morning.前一天晚上或早上第一件事就是计划你的一天。
  • Prioritizing requests and demands.优先考虑请求和要求。
  • Prioritizing a list of projects and focusing on higher value tasks with more immediate deadlines.对项目列表进行优先排序，并专注于具有更紧迫期限的更高价值的任务。
  • Punctuality.准时。
  • Putting cell phones aside to eliminate the distraction of personal messages unless required for work.除非工作需要，否则请将手机放在一边，以消除个人信息的干扰。
  • Reviewing performance and eliminating deviations from priorities.审查绩效并消除与优先事项的偏差。
  • Setting daily, weekly and monthly goals.设定每日、每周和每月目标。
  • Setting realistic standards for quality and avoiding perfectionism.制定切合实际的质量标准并避免完美主义。
  • Setting specific times for responding to email.设置回复电子邮件的特定时间。
  • Taking short breaks to restore energy.短暂休息以恢复能量。
  • Touching each piece of paper or reading each email just once, whenever feasible.只要可行，就触摸每张纸或阅读每封电子邮件一次。

How to Make Your Skills Stand Out如何让你的技能脱颖而出

Add Relevant Skills to Your Resume: For executive assistants and managers, the time management skills listed above are important to include in your resume.在简历中添加相关技能：对于行政助理和经理来说，上面列出的时间管理技能对于添加到简历中非常重要。

Highlight Skills in Your Cover Letter: While reading the job description carefully, note in your letter similar projects where time management was key.在求职信中强调技能：在仔细阅读职位描述时，请在求职信中注明时间管理至关重要的类似项目。

Use Skill Words in Your Job Interview: Review these time management interview questions prior to your job interviews, so you’re prepared to respond with specific examples of how you effectively manage your workload.在工作面试中使用技能词汇：在工作面试之前查看这些时间管理面试问题，以便您准备好以如何有效管理工作量的具体示例进行回答。

entry.title: 【B1-Writing】12 Reflective writing-反思性写作
entry.content:
【B1-Writing】12 Reflective writing-反思性写作

Learn how to write a reflective text about a learning experience.
了解如何撰写有关学习经历的反思性文字。

Do the preparation task first. Then read the text and tips and do the exercises.
先做好准备工作。然后阅读课文和提示并做练习。

Preparation-准备

Reflective writing – preparation

Match the words with the definitions.

  • Question
VocabularyDefinition
1. an individuala. to work for an organisation without being paid
2. to volunteerb. to change something to make it suit different conditions
3. a challengec. a single person, not a group
4. focusd. something new and difficult to do
5. in generale. a point to think about or concentrate on
6. to adaptf. overall
  • Answer
  1. to work for an organisation without being paid – to volunteer
  2. to change something to make it suit different conditions – to adapt
  3. a single person, not a group – an individual
  4. something new and difficult to do – a challenge
  5. a point to think about or concentrate on – focus
  6. overall – in general

Reading text

English

In January I spent three weeks volunteering as an English teacher in my town. I’ve been thinking about becoming an English teacher for a while so it was a good opportunity to see what it’s like. The students had all just arrived to start a new life in the UK and they had a range of levels from beginner to intermediate. They came from a variety of countries and had very different backgrounds and experiences.

For me, the most important thing was the relationship with the students. I was nervous at first and did not feel confident about speaking in front of people. However, I found it easy to build good relationships with the students as a class and as individuals and I soon relaxed with them. It was a challenge to encourage the lower-level students to speak in English, but at least they understood a lot more at the end of the course.

At first, planning lessons took a really long time and I was not happy with the results. Classes seemed to be too difficult for some students and too easy for others, who finished quickly and got bored. I found it was better to teach without a course book, adapting materials I found online to suit their needs. I learned to take extra activities for students who finished early and that was much better.

I still need to continue improving my lesson planning. I would like more ideas for teaching mixed-ability groups and I want to plan the whole course better next time. That way students have a focus for each lesson and a sense of progress and of what they’ve covered. I’m also going to put more confident students with beginners when they work in pairs so conversation activities give everyone more chance to speak and students can help each other.

Overall, it was a really positive experience and I learned a lot. I’ve decided that I would like to become an English teacher in the future.

English-Chinese

In January I spent three weeks volunteering as an English teacher in my town. I’ve been thinking about becoming an English teacher for a while so it was a good opportunity to see what it’s like. The students had all just arrived to start a new life in the UK and they had a range of levels from beginner to intermediate. They came from a variety of countries and had very different backgrounds and experiences.
一月份，我在我的镇上做了三个星期的志愿英语老师。我想成为一名英语老师已经有一段时间了，所以这是一个很好的机会来看看它是什么样的。这些学生都刚刚抵达英国开始新生活，他们的水平从初级到中级不等。他们来自不同的国家，有着截然不同的背景和经历。

For me, the most important thing was the relationship with the students. I was nervous at first and did not feel confident about speaking in front of people. However, I found it easy to build good relationships with the students as a class and as individuals and I soon relaxed with them. It was a challenge to encourage the lower-level students to speak in English, but at least they understood a lot more at the end of the course.
对我来说，最重要的是和学生的关系。起初我很紧张，对在人们面前演讲没有信心。然而，我发现与学生作为班级和个人建立良好的关系很容易，我很快就与他们放松下来。鼓励水平较低的学生说英语是一个挑战，但至少他们在课程结束时理解了更多。

At first, planning lessons took a really long time and I was not happy with the results. Classes seemed to be too difficult for some students and too easy for others, who finished quickly and got bored. I found it was better to teach without a course book, adapting materials I found online to suit their needs. I learned to take extra activities for students who finished early and that was much better.
起初，计划课程花了很长时间，我对结果并不满意。课程对一些学生来说似乎太难了，而对另一些学生来说又太简单了，他们很快就学完了并感到无聊。我发现最好在没有教科书的情况下进行教学，调整我在网上找到的材料来满足他们的需求。我学会了为提前完成学业的学生参加额外的活动，这要好得多。

I still need to continue improving my lesson planning. I would like more ideas for teaching mixed-ability groups and I want to plan the whole course better next time. That way students have a focus for each lesson and a sense of progress and of what they’ve covered. I’m also going to put more confident students with beginners when they work in pairs so conversation activities give everyone more chance to speak and students can help each other.
我还需要继续改进我的备课。我想要更多关于教授混合能力小组的想法，并且我想下次更好地计划整个课程。这样，学生就能专注于每节课，并对自己所学内容有一种进步感。我还将让更有信心的学生与初学者结对工作，这样对话活动就可以让每个人都有更多的机会说话，学生也可以互相帮助。

Overall, it was a really positive experience and I learned a lot. I’ve decided that I would like to become an English teacher in the future.
总的来说，这是一次非常积极的经历，我学到了很多东西。我决定将来要成为一名英语老师。

Tips-小贴士

  1. Reflective writing is more personal than other types of academic writing. You can use the first person (I … , My … , etc.) and explain how you felt.反思性写作比其他类型的学术写作更加个人化。您可以使用第一人称（我…、我的…等）并解释您的感受。

  2. Think about the experience in detail. Explain what went well and what was challenging, and say what you learned in the process.详细思考一下经历。解释哪些进展顺利，哪些有挑战性，并说出您在这个过程中学到了什么。

  3. Use a structure:

    使用结构：

    • Short introduction to the situation情况简介
    • Evaluate the most important things about the experience, including solutions to problems评估体验中最重要的事情，包括问题的解决方案
    • Say what you would do differently next time说出下次你会采取什么不同的做法
    • Say what you learned overall.说说你总体上学到了什么。

  4. Keep the focus on your learning process and what you will do better in future.专注于你的学习过程以及你将来会做得更好的事情。

Task 1-任务一

Reflective writing – 1

Are the sentences true or false?

  • Question
  1. You should keep your writing impersonal.
    True
    False
  2. It is better not to say if something was difficult.
    True
    False
  3. You should say what went well and what could be improved.
    True
    False
  4. You do not have to describe the experience in detail – just the important bits.
    True
    False
  5. You should include solutions to problems you had.
    True
    False
  6. You should finish by describing exactly what you did.
    True
    False
  • Answer
  1. You should keep your writing impersonal.
    True
    ✔False
  2. It is better not to say if something was difficult.
    True
    ✔False
  3. You should say what went well and what could be improved.
    ✔True
    False
  4. You do not have to describe the experience in detail – just the important bits.
    ✔True
    False
  5. You should include solutions to problems you had.
    ✔True
    False
  6. You should finish by describing exactly what you did.
    True
    ✔False

Task 2-任务二

Reflective writing – 2

Put the sentences in the correct group.

  • Question

I learned to take extra activities for students who finished early.
I was nervous at first.
I soon relaxed with them.
I found it was better to teach without a course book.
I’m going to put more confident students with beginners so they can help each other.
I spent three weeks volunteering as an English teacher.
I did not feel confident about speaking in front of people.
It was a challenge to encourage the lower-level students to speak in English.
At first, planning lessons took a really long time.

ExperienceFeelingsSolutions/Learning

  • Answer

Experience
I spent three weeks volunteering as an English teacher.
It was a challenge to encourage the lower-level students to speak in English.
At first, planning lessons took a really long time.

Feelings
I was nervous at first.
I did not feel confident about speaking in front of people.
I soon relaxed with them.

Solutions/Learning

I learned to take extra activities for students who finished early.
I’m going to put more confident students with beginners so they can help each other.

Task 3-任务三

Reflective writing – 3

Write one word in each gap to complete the sentences.

  • Question
  1. I spent two months volunteering __ a medical assistant.
  2. I helped with a variety __ tasks.
  3. They had a range of patients __ young children to adults.
  4. It was a challenge __ finish all the work in one day.
  5. There were a lot of things I didn’t know, but __ least I could help the nurse, who was on her own most of the time.
  6. I would like more first-aid training __ I can help in a medical emergency.
  • Answer
  1. I spent two months volunteering as a medical assistant.
  2. I helped with a variety of tasks.
  3. They had a range of patients from young children to adults.
  4. It was a challenge to finish all the work in one day.
  5. There were a lot of things I didn’t know, but at least I could help the nurse, who was on her own most of the time.
  6. I would like more first-aid training so I can help in a medical emergency.

Discussion-讨论

What was your last challenging learning experience?
您最近一次具有挑战性的学习经历是什么？

Vocabulary

impersonal

  • 简易

英/ɪmˈpɜːsənl/美/ɪmˈpɜːrsən(ə)l/
adj.非个人的，不受个人感情影响的；缺乏人情味的，冷淡的；不够人性化的；不以人的形式存在的，不具人格的；（语法中）非人称的，无人称的

n.非人称动词或代词

IELTS | TOEFL | GRE

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

impersonal/ɪmˈpɜːsənəl/|TEM4

  1. ADJ If you describe a place, organization, or activity as impersonal, you mean that it is not very friendly and makes you feel unimportant because it involves or is used by a large number of people. 无人情味的

    • Before then many children were cared for in large impersonal orphanages.
    在那以前，许多孩子在无人情味的大孤儿院里被照料。

  2. ADJ If you describe someone’s behaviour as impersonal, you mean that they do not show any emotion about the person they are dealing with. 不受个人感情影响的

    • We must be as impersonal as a surgeon with his knife.
    我们必须像拿着手术刀的外科医生一样不受个人感情影响。

  3. ADJ An impersonal room or statistic does not give any information about the character of the person to whom it belongs or relates. 没有个人色彩的

    • The rest of the room was neat and impersonal.
    房间的其余部分整洁干净，没有个人色彩。

entry.title: 【B1-Writing】11 New Year's resolutions-新年决心
entry.content:
【B1-Writing】11 New Year’s resolutions-新年决心

Learn how to write about your New Year’s resolutions.
了解如何写下你的新年决心。

Do the preparation task first. Then read the text and tips and do the exercises.
先做好准备工作。然后阅读课文和提示并做练习。

Preparation-准备

New Year’s resolutions – preparation

Match the words with the definitions.

  • Question
VocabularyDefinition
1. to invest in somethinga. a promise to yourself to do something
2. savingsb. in a place where people can see it
3. to track somethingc. to record and pay attention to something
4. to aim to do somethingd. to plan to do something
5. a resolutione. to put money into something that will increase in value over time
6. in publicf. money you keep in the bank for the future
  • Answer
  1. a promise to yourself to do something – a resolution
  2. in a place where people can see it – in public
  3. to record and pay attention to something– to track something
  4. to plan to do something – to aim to do something
  5. to put money into something that will increase in value over time – to invest in something
  6. money you keep in the bank for the future – savings

Reading text

English

Write about your New Year’s resolutions for the coming year. Before you start, plan what you are going to include and think about who is going to read it.

My New Year’s resolutions

by Darren

I like to start every year with my New Year’s resolutions. Then I read them next 1 January and see how well I did!

Here are my resolutions this year.

1. Get fit!!

I say this every year but I hope writing it in public will make it more real. I’m aiming for three runs a week – I think I can do it! I think a fitness tracking app might help me achieve it. Or I could find a running partner. If anyone who’s reading this wants to be my partner, let me know!

2. Save 10 per cent of my salary a month

Having no savings is starting to worry me and 10 per cent is realistic. It’s not too much, but it’s not too little that I won’t see it add up. I’ll put the money into a special bank account that will make it grow … Actually, I don’t know much about that so maybe my next resolution should be to find out how to invest money!!

3. Cook more

I’d like to start inviting friends for dinner and cooking for them. I think once a month is a good plan. By the end of the year I want to have five dishes I can cook really well so people will say, ‘Have you ever had Darren’s delicious cooking?’ Who wants to be my first guest?

English-Chinese

Write about your New Year’s resolutions for the coming year. Before you start, plan what you are going to include and think about who is going to read it.写下你来年的新年决心。在开始之前，计划好要包含的内容并考虑谁将阅读它。

My New Year’s resolutions我的新年决心

by Darren通过达伦

I like to start every year with my New Year’s resolutions. Then I read them next 1 January and see how well I did!我喜欢每年以新年决心开始。然后我在明年 1 月 1 日读了它们，看看我做得有多好！

Here are my resolutions this year.这是我今年的决心。

1. Get fit!!1. 健身！！

I say this every year but I hope writing it in public will make it more real. I’m aiming for three runs a week – I think I can do it! I think a fitness tracking app might help me achieve it. Or I could find a running partner. If anyone who’s reading this wants to be my partner, let me know!我每年都会这么说，但我希望公开写出来会让它更加真实。我的目标是每周跑步三次——我想我能做到！我认为健身追踪应用程序可能会帮助我实现这一目标。或者我可以找到一个跑步伙伴。如果阅读本文的任何人想成为我的合作伙伴，请告诉我！

2. Save 10 per cent of my salary a month2. 每月存下工资的 10%

Having no savings is starting to worry me and 10 per cent is realistic. It’s not too much, but it’s not too little that I won’t see it add up. I’ll put the money into a special bank account that will make it grow … Actually, I don’t know much about that so maybe my next resolution should be to find out how to invest money!!没有积蓄让我开始担心，10% 是现实的。不算太多，但也不算太少，以至于我看不到它加起来。我会把钱存入一个特殊的银行账户，让它增值……实际上，我对此了解不多，所以也许我的下一个决心应该是找出如何投资钱！

3. Cook more3.多煮点

I’d like to start inviting friends for dinner and cooking for them. I think once a month is a good plan. By the end of the year I want to have five dishes I can cook really well so people will say, ‘Have you ever had Darren’s delicious cooking?’ Who wants to be my first guest?我想开始邀请朋友吃饭并为他们做饭。我认为每月一次是一个不错的计划。到今年年底，我希望能做出五道菜，我可以做得非常好，这样人们就会说，“你吃过达伦做的美味佳肴吗？”谁想成为我的第一位客人？

Tips-小贴士

  1. Before you start a writing task, make a plan. First, write down lots of ideas you could include. Then choose the best and most interesting ones.
    在开始写作任务之前，先制定一个计划。首先，写下许多你可以包含的想法。然后选择最好的和最有趣的。
  2. Don’t write all your ideas in one section. Make one section for each idea. Write a heading for each section to show the reader what it’s about.
    不要将所有想法写在一节中。为每个想法分成一个部分。为每个部分写一个标题，向读者展示它的内容。
  3. Think about who is going to read the text and choose the style accordingly. For your classmates, use an informal and clear style.
    考虑谁将阅读文本并相应地选择风格。对于你的同学，请使用非正式且清晰的风格。
  4. Keep your reader interested by talking directly to them, e.g. by asking a question.
    通过直接与读者交谈来保持他们的兴趣，例如通过提问。
  5. When you have finished your writing, read it and check it for mistakes.
    当你写完后，阅读并检查是否有错误。

    ✔True

    True

Task 3-任务三

New Year’s resolutions – 3

Complete the sentences.

  • Question

often by every daya once twice

  1. I’m going to cook for my friends __ (one time) a month.
  2. I want to be able to run 10 kilometres __ the end of the year.
  3. I’m planning to go running three times __ week.
  4. I’m going to watch a film in English __ (two times) a week.
  5. I’m aiming to revise my English notes for ten minutes __ .
  6. I want to cook food at home more __ .
  • Answer
  1. I’m going to cook for my friends once (one time) a month.
  2. I want to be able to run 10 kilometres by the end of the year.
  3. I’m planning to go running three times a week.
  4. I’m going to watch a film in English twice (two times) a week.
  5. I’m aiming to revise my English notes for ten minutes every day .
  6. I want to cook food at home more often .

Discussion-讨论

Do you make New Year’s resolutions? What will next year’s be?
你制定新年决心了吗？明年会怎样？

Vocabulary

resolutions

  • 简易

英/ˌrezəˈluːʃ(ə)n/美/ˌrezəˈluːʃ(ə)n/
n.决议，正式决定；（冲突、问题等的）解决，解决办法；决心，决定；坚决，果断；（电视、照相机、显微镜等的）清晰度，分辨率；（故事中主要矛盾的）冲突解开；（乐）解决（指和声中不协和音向协和音的进行）；（医）（炎症或其他症状的）消散，消退；（化）分解；（物理）（力或其他矢量的）分解

初中 | 高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | GRE
复数resolutions

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

resolution/ˌrɛzəˈluːʃən/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-COUNT A resolution is a formal decision made at a meeting by means of a vote. 决议

    • He replied that the UN had passed two major resolutions calling for a complete withdrawal.
    他回复说联合国已经通过要求完全撤军的两项重大决议。

  2. N-COUNT If you make a resolution, you decide to try very hard to do something. 决心

    • They made a resolution to lose all the weight gained during the Christmas holidays.
    他们下了一个决心要减掉圣诞节期间增加的全部体重。

  3. N-UNCOUNT Resolution is determination to do something or not do something. 决心

    • “I think I’ll try a hypnotist,” I said with sudden resolution.
    “我想我要找个催眠师试试，”我突然坚决地说。

  4. N-SING The resolution of a problem or difficulty is the final solving of it. 最终解决

    • …the successful resolution of a dispute involving UN inspectors in Baghdad.
    …对涉及联合国驻巴格达调查员的一项争议的成功解决。

revise

  • 简易

英/rɪˈvaɪz/美/rɪˈvaɪz/
v.改变，修正；修改，修订（书刊、估算等）；<英>温习，复习

n.修订，校订；（印刷）改样

【名】 （Revise）（法）勒维斯（人名）

高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL | GRE | GMAT | 商务英语
复数revises第三人称单数revises现在分词revising过去式revised过去分词revised

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

revise/rɪˈvaɪz/|CET4 TEM4
revisingrevisedrevises

  1. V-T If you revise the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to make them better or more suited to how things are. 修正 (对某事的想法)

    • With time he came to revise his opinion of the profession.
    随着时间的推移，他开始修正自己对这一职业的看法。

  2. V-T If you revise a price, amount, or estimate, you change it to make it more fair, realistic, or accurate. 调整 (使更合理、实际、准确)

    • They realized that some of their prices were higher than their competitors’ and revised prices accordingly.
    他们意识到他们的部分价格比竞争对手的高，就相应地调整了价格。

  3. V-T When you revise an article, a book, a law, or a piece of music, you change it in order to improve it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose. 修改; 修订 (使改进、更时尚、更适于某目的)

    • Three editors handled the work of revising the articles for publication.
    3名编辑负责对要出版的文章进行修订的工作。

【B1-Writing】10 Describing charts-描述图表

Learn how to write about charts.
了解如何撰写图表。

Do the preparation task first. Then read the text and tips and do the exercises.
先做好准备工作。然后阅读课文和提示并做练习。

Preparation-准备

Describing a bar chart – preparation

Reading text

English

The first chart illustrates the percentage of the population who owned a smartphone from 2011 to 2016, and the second breaks the percentages down by age for 2011 and 2016.

Overall, smartphone ownership increased during the six-year period. In general, the younger people were, the more likely they were to own a smartphone. However, the most significant increases in smartphone ownership between 2011 and 2016 came from people aged 45 to 54, from 46% to 84%; from those in the 55 to 64 category, from 9% to 59%; and from those aged 65 to 74, from 5% to 50%.

The percentage of people who owned a smartphone rose steadily, starting at around 35% in 2011 and reaching about 77% by 2016. People aged 16 to 24 represented the greatest percentage of smartphone ownership in both 2011 and 2016. 75% of people aged 25 to 34 and 72% of those aged 35 to 44 owned a smartphone in 2011, rising to 88% and 86% respectively by 2016.

Although almost nobody in the 75+ age category owned a smartphone in 2011, 15% of this group owned smartphones in 2016.

Please note: This page was designed for writing practice only. Information and statistics in the charts may not be accurate.

English-Chinese

The first chart illustrates the percentage of the population who owned a smartphone from 2011 to 2016, and the second breaks the percentages down by age for 2011 and 2016.
第一个图表显示了 2011 年至 2016 年拥有智能手机的人口百分比，第二个图表按年龄细分了 2011 年和 2016 年的百分比。

Overall, smartphone ownership increased during the six-year period. In general, the younger people were, the more likely they were to own a smartphone. However, the most significant increases in smartphone ownership between 2011 and 2016 came from people aged 45 to 54, from 46% to 84%; from those in the 55 to 64 category, from 9% to 59%; and from those aged 65 to 74, from 5% to 50%.
总体而言，六年期间智能手机拥有量有所增加。一般来说，越年轻的人越有可能拥有智能手机。然而，2011年至2016年间，智能手机拥有量增长最显着的是45岁至54岁的人群，从46%增至84%； 55岁至64岁年龄段的人，从9%增至59%； 65岁到74岁的人，从5%到50%。

The percentage of people who owned a smartphone rose steadily, starting at around 35% in 2011 and reaching about 77% by 2016. People aged 16 to 24 represented the greatest percentage of smartphone ownership in both 2011 and 2016. 75% of people aged 25 to 34 and 72% of those aged 35 to 44 owned a smartphone in 2011, rising to 88% and 86% respectively by 2016.
拥有智能手机的人的比例稳步上升，从 2011 年的 35% 左右开始，到 2016 年达到 77% 左右。2011 年和 2016 年，16 岁至 24 岁的人拥有智能手机的比例最高。25 岁的人中，这一比例为 75% 2011 年，35 岁至 44 岁人群中分别有 34% 和 72% 的人拥有智能手机，到 2016 年，这一比例分别上升至 88% 和 86%。

Although almost nobody in the 75+ age category owned a smartphone in 2011, 15% of this group owned smartphones in 2016.
尽管 2011 年 75 岁以上年龄段的人几乎没有人拥有智能手机，但 2016 年该群体中有 15% 的人拥有智能手机。

Please note: This page was designed for writing practice only. Information and statistics in the charts may not be accurate.
请注意：此页面仅供写作练习。图表中的信息和统计数据可能不准确。

Tips-小贴士

  1. If you are doing an exam task, read the instructions and make sure you write according to the word and time limits.
    如果您正在做考试任务，请阅读说明并确保按照字数和时间限制进行写作。
  2. Start by saying what the charts show. In an exam, change the words in the question to write the first sentence of your answer, e.g. These charts show = These charts illustrate.
    首先说说图表显示的内容。在考试中，更改问题中的单词以写出答案的第一句话，例如这些图表显示 = 这些图表说明。
  3. The second paragraph should provide an overview of the key features of the information.
    第二段应概述信息的主要特征。
  4. The other paragraphs should describe the patterns or trends in more detail. However, only select the most important ones to write about, and don’t write about your own ideas.
    其他段落应更详细地描述模式或趋势。但是，只选择最重要的来写，不要写自己的想法。
  5. Use linking words and a range of vocabulary to describe what you see in the charts. (You can write % or per cent, but be consistent.)
    使用连接词和一系列词汇来描述您在图表中看到的内容。 （你可以写%或%，但要保持一致。）
  6. Be careful to use the correct tenses to describe the time periods shown.
    请注意使用正确的时态来描述所示的时间段。

entry.content:
【B1-Writing】09 Describing a bar chart-描述条形图

Learn how to write about trends in a bar chart.
了解如何在条形图中书写趋势。

Do the preparation task first. Then read the text and tips and do the exercises.
先做好准备工作。然后阅读课文和提示并做练习。

Preparation-准备

Describing a bar chart – preparation

Put the verbs in the correct groups.

  • Question

to grow to fall to remain at (+ number)
to be steady to increase to jump up
to drop to be unchanged to decrease
to rise to decline to be constant

to go upto go downto stay the same

  • Answer
to go upto go downto stay the same
to growto fallto remain at (+ number)
to increaseto dropto be steady
to jump upto decreaseto be unchanged
to riseto declineto be constant

Reading text

English

The chart shows the sales revenue of a selection of home video entertainment formats in the USA in 2017. It also shows the percentage change from the previous year.

Online video streaming was the most popular format in 2017. US consumers spent $9.8 billion on services such as Netflix, which was a rise of 32 per cent from the previous year. For the average American, this accounted for nearly half of their spending on video entertainment at home.

At the same time, customers were moving away from the three physical formats in the chart. DVD and Blu-ray sales dropped by 14 per cent over the twelve-month period to $4.5 billion in 2017, and rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent to $0.5 billion. DVD rental shops saw the largest decline, as spending fell by 21 per cent to just $0.4 billion.

Overall, there was a clear downward trend in spending on physical video formats, as they all showed relatively low sales and they were all in decline. However, there was an upward trend in paying for streaming.

Please note: This page was designed for writing practice only. Information in the chart may not be accurate.

English-Chinese

The chart shows the sales revenue of a selection of home video entertainment formats in the USA in 2017. It also shows the percentage change from the previous year.
该图表显示了 2017 年美国部分家庭视频娱乐格式的销售收入。它还显示了与上一年相比的百分比变化。

Online video streaming was the most popular format in 2017. US consumers spent $9.8 billion on services such as Netflix, which was a rise of 32 per cent from the previous year. For the average American, this accounted for nearly half of their spending on video entertainment at home.
在线视频流是 2017 年最受欢迎的格式。美国消费者在 Netflix 等服务上花费了 98 亿美元，比上一年增长了 32%。对于普通美国人来说，这占了他们家庭视频娱乐支出的近一半。

At the same time, customers were moving away from the three physical formats in the chart. DVD and Blu-ray sales dropped by 14 per cent over the twelve-month period to $4.5 billion in 2017, and rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent to $0.5 billion. DVD rental shops saw the largest decline, as spending fell by 21 per cent to just $0.4 billion.
与此同时，客户正在逐渐放弃图表中的三种物理格式。 2017 年，DVD 和蓝光销售额在过去 12 个月内下降了 14%，至 45 亿美元，而按帖子出租的收入下降了 20%，至 5 亿美元。 DVD 租赁店的降幅最大，支出下降了 21%，仅为 4 亿美元。

Overall, there was a clear downward trend in spending on physical video formats, as they all showed relatively low sales and they were all in decline. However, there was an upward trend in paying for streaming.
总体而言，实体视频格式的支出呈明显下降趋势，因为它们的销售额都相对较低，而且都在下降。然而，流媒体付费呈上升趋势。

Please note: This page was designed for writing practice only. Information in the chart may not be accurate.
请注意：此页面仅供写作练习。图表中的信息可能不准确。

Tips-小贴士

  1. In the first paragraph, give basic details about the chart including what it shows, where it refers to and when.
    在第一段中，提供有关图表的基本详细信息，包括它显示的内容、它所指的位置和时间。
  2. When you describe chart data, be specific. Mention the category and figure, e.g. Online video streaming was the most popular format in 2017. US consumers spent $9.8 billion …
    描述图表数据时，要具体。提及类别和数字，例如在线视频流是 2017 年最受欢迎的格式。美国消费者花费了 98 亿美元……
  3. A trend is a change over time. To describe trends, focus on what is increasing or decreasing compared to some time in the past, e.g. … which was a rise of 32 per cent from the previous year.
    趋势是随时间的变化。要描述趋势，请重点关注与过去某个时间相比增加或减少的内容，例如…比上一年增长了 32%。
  4. If several categories show the same trend, talk about them together, e.g. customers were moving away from the three physical formats in the chart.
    如果几个类别表现出相同的趋势，请将它们放在一起讨论，例如客户正在逐渐放弃图表中的三种物理格式。
  5. State the units of measurement, e.g. US consumers spent $9.8 billion.
    注明测量单位，例如美国消费者花费了 98 亿美元。
  6. Many of the verbs for up and down trends can also be used as nouns, e.g. Spending fell by 21 per cent = There was a 21 per cent fall in spending. (You can write % or per cent, but be consistent.)
    许多表示上升和下降趋势的动词也可以用作名词，例如支出下降 21% = 支出下降 21%。 （你可以写%或%，但要保持一致。）
  7. Write a conclusion. Say what we learn from the data overall.
    写一个结论。说说我们从总体数据中学到了什么。

Task 1-任务一

Describing a bar chart – 1

Choose the correct answer.

  • Question

    d. DVD and Blu-ray rental shops

  5. What does the writer conclude from the data?
    a. Physical video formats will eventually disappear.

    c. Digital distribution is cost-effective.
    d. American consumers will spend more on home entertainment in the future.

  5.   What does the writer conclude from the data?  a. Physical video formats will eventually disappear.  b. Video streams were becoming more popular, while physical formats were becoming less so.  c. Digital distribution is cost-effective.  d. American consumers will spend more on home entertainment in the future.

Task 2-任务二

Describing a bar chart – 2

Choose the correct answer.

  • Question
  1. Which is the best first sentence?
    a. The bar chart shows spending on entertainment.
    b. In 2017, US consumers spent $9.8 billion subscribing to streaming services, which was 32 per cent higher than the previous year.
    c. The bar chart shows American consumer spending on various home video entertainment formats in 2017.
  2. Which of these sentences describes a trend?
    a. Spending at DVD rental shops fell by 21 per cent over the twelve-month period.
    b. Spending at DVD rental shops was $0.4 billion.
    c. Spending at DVD rental shops was the lowest of all the categories in the chart.
  3. Which is the correct way to write this amount of money?
    a. In 2017, US consumers spent 9.8 billion.
    b. In 2017, US consumers spent $9.8 billion.
    c. In 2017, US consumers spent 9.8 billion $.
  4. Which sentence gives a more complete description?
    a. Rent-by-post revenues were $0.5 billion.
    b. Rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent.
    c. Rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent to $0.5 billion.
  5. Which is the best conclusion?
    a. Spending on video entertainment in the home was growing overall, thanks to streaming.
    b. For DVD rental shops, spending fell by 21 per cent to just $0.4 billion.
    c. In total, spending on home video entertainment reached $19 billion.
  • Answer
  1. Which is the best first sentence?
    a. The bar chart shows spending on entertainment.
    b. In 2017, US consumers spent $9.8 billion subscribing to streaming services, which was 32 per cent higher than the previous year.
    c. The bar chart shows American consumer spending on various home video entertainment formats in 2017.
  2. Which of these sentences describes a trend?
    a. Spending at DVD rental shops fell by 21 per cent over the twelve-month period.

  3. Which is the correct way to write this amount of money?
    a. In 2017, US consumers spent 9.8 billion.
    b. In 2017, US consumers spent $9.8 billion.
    c. In 2017, US consumers spent 9.8 billion $.
  4. Which sentence gives a more complete description?
    a. Rent-by-post revenues were $0.5 billion.
    b. Rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent.
    c. Rent-by-post revenues went down by 20 per cent to $0.5 billion.
  5. Which is the best conclusion?
    a. Spending on video entertainment in the home was growing overall, thanks to streaming.
    b. For DVD rental shops, spending fell by 21 per cent to just $0.4 billion.
    c. In total, spending on home video entertainment reached $19 billion.

Task 3-任务三

Describing a bar chart – 3

Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. Write a noun or verb related to the verb or noun in the first sentence.完成第二句话，使其与第一句话具有相同的含义。写出与第一句中的动词或名词相关的名词或动词。

  • Question
  1. There was a 31 per cent rise in spending. Spending __ by 31 per cent.
  2. DVD sales dropped 14 per cent. There was a 14 per cent __ in DVD sales.

Do the preparation task first. Then read the text and tips and do the exercises.

Preparation-准备

Reflective writing – preparation

Match the words with the definitions.

  • Question
VocabularyDefinition

  1. 人们已经做了很多年的事情 – 一个传统
  2. 人们在外面生起大火 – 篝火
  3. 在爆炸中摧毁某物 – 去炸掉
  4. 着火时会爆炸的物质 – 炸药
  5. 与其他人制定秘密计划去做坏事或非法的事情 – 密谋
  6. 给某人造成巨大痛苦，通常是让他们分享信息、惩罚他们或残忍 – 折磨

Reading text

English

Add your comment below:

So cool to read about everyone’s home tradition they miss the most! I’m from England but I’ve been living in the States for five years and the thing I miss the most is Bonfire Night on November 5th.

The best thing about Bonfire Night is the fireworks, oh, and the bonfires! … and the history behind it. Basically, Guy Fawkes and his friends tried to blow up the Houses of Parliament and kill King James I. They nearly did it too – they hired a room under the House of Parliament and filled it with explosives. But someone told the royal palace. The authorities found Guy Fawkes in the room guarding the explosives, and he was sentenced to torture and death.

So it’s a tradition that celebrates the fact that the king survived. It also means people don’t forget what happens if you plot against your country. There’s a kind of poem about it that starts ‘Remember, remember the fifth of November, gunpowder, treason and plot.’ That’s why we build a ‘guy’ – a life-size model of Guy Fawkes – and burn it on the bonfire. Pretty dark and horrible when you think about it!

English-Chinese

Add your comment below:在下面添加您的评论：

So cool to read about everyone’s home tradition they miss the most! I’m from England but I’ve been living in the States for five years and the thing I miss the most is Bonfire Night on November 5th.读到每个人最怀念的家乡传统真是太酷了！我来自英国，但我在美国生活了五年，我最怀念的是11月5日的篝火之夜。

The best thing about Bonfire Night is the fireworks, oh, and the bonfires! … and the history behind it. Basically, Guy Fawkes and his friends tried to blow up the Houses of Parliament and kill King James I. They nearly did it too – they hired a room under the House of Parliament and filled it with explosives. But someone told the royal palace. The authorities found Guy Fawkes in the room guarding the explosives, and he was sentenced to torture and death.篝火之夜最棒的就是烟花，哦，还有篝火！ ……以及其背后的历史。基本上，盖伊·福克斯和他的朋友们试图炸毁议会大厦并杀死国王詹姆斯一世。他们也几乎做到了——他们在议会大厦下面租了一个房间，并在里面装满了炸药。但有人告诉了王宫。当局发现盖伊·福克斯在房间里看守炸药，他被判处酷刑和死刑。

So it’s a tradition that celebrates the fact that the king survived. It also means people don’t forget what happens if you plot against your country. There’s a kind of poem about it that starts ‘Remember, remember the fifth of November, gunpowder, treason and plot.’ That’s why we build a ‘guy’ – a life-size model of Guy Fawkes – and burn it on the bonfire. Pretty dark and horrible when you think about it!所以这是一个庆祝国王幸存的传统。这也意味着人们不会忘记如果你密谋反对你的国家会发生什么。有一首关于它的诗，开头是“记住，记住十一月五日，火药，叛国和阴谋。”这就是为什么我们建造一个“盖伊”——真人大小的盖伊·福克斯模型——并将其放在篝火上烧掉。当你想到它时，非常黑暗和可怕！

Tips-小贴士

  1. It’s nice to start by saying something that shows you have read other people’s posts.
    最好先说一些表明您已经阅读过其他人的帖子的内容。

  2. In a class forum you can be quite informal.
    在课堂论坛上，你可以非常随意。

  3. In informal writing you can sometimes miss out the beginning of a phrase:
    在非正式写作中，您有时可能会错过短语的开头：

    So cool to read about everyone’s home tradition …
    读到每个人的家庭传统真是太酷了……

  4. Remember, in a forum you are part of a long conversation with a lot of other people so they might ask you questions.
    请记住，在论坛中，您是与许多其他人进行长时间对话的一部分，因此他们可能会问您问题。

Task 1-任务一

A class forum – 1

Are the sentences true or false?

  • Question
  1. The writer is American.
    True
    False
  2. Bonfire Night is celebrated in autumn in the UK.
    True
    False
  3. Guy Fawkes wanted to blow up the royal palace.
    True
    False
  4. Guy Fawkes’s plan worked.
    True
    False
  5. Bonfire Night is a warning as well as a celebration.
    True
    False
  6. Guy Fawkes wanted people to remember him on 5 November.
    True
    False
  • Answer
  1. The writer is American.
    True
    ✔False
  2. Bonfire Night is celebrated in autumn in the UK.
    ✔True
    False
  3. Guy Fawkes wanted to blow up the royal palace.
    True
    ✔False
  4. Guy Fawkes’s plan worked.
    True
    ✔False
  5. Bonfire Night is a warning as well as a celebration.
    ✔True
    False
  6. Guy Fawkes wanted people to remember him on 5 November.
    True
    ✔False

Task 2-任务二

A class forum – 2

Choose the best answer.

  • Question
  1. What is the purpose of the first sentence in this post?
    a. To show the writer has read other posts.
    b. To say what the post is going to be about.
    c. For the writer to introduce themselves.
  2. Which word is missing from the first sentence?
    a. They’re
    b. I’m
    c. It’s
  3. What does the writer describe as dark and horrible?
    a. Trying to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
    b. Burning a model of Guy Fawkes.
    c. Having a party in Britain in November.
  4. Which thing does NOT show the writing is informal?
    a. The writer talks directly to the reader using you.
    b. The writer sometimes uses sentences that are not complete.
    c. The writer gives some information about the history.
  5. What does the word Basically mean at the beginning of a sentence?
    a. The writer is going to give a summary.
    b. The writer is going to give a lot of details.
    c. The writer doesn’t know all the details.
  6. It’s not OK for readers of the post to …
    a. be rude to the writer.
    b. ask questions about Bonfire Night.
    c. ask questions about July 4th.
  • Answer
  1. What is the purpose of the first sentence in this post?
    ✔a. To show the writer has read other posts.
    b. To say what the post is going to be about.
    c. For the writer to introduce themselves.
  2. Which word is missing from the first sentence?
    a. They’re
    b. I’m
    ✔c. It’s
  3. What does the writer describe as dark and horrible?
    a. Trying to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
    ✔b. Burning a model of Guy Fawkes.
    c. Having a party in Britain in November.
  4. Which thing does NOT show the writing is informal?
    a. The writer talks directly to the reader using you.
    b. The writer sometimes uses sentences that are not complete.
    ✔c. The writer gives some information about the history.
  5. What does the word Basically mean at the beginning of a sentence?
    ✔a. The writer is going to give a summary.
    b. The writer is going to give a lot of details.
    c. The writer doesn’t know all the details.
  6. It’s not OK for readers of the post to …
    ✔a. be rude to the writer.
    b. ask questions about Bonfire Night.
    c. ask questions about July 4th.

Task 3-任务三

A class forum – 3

Write one word to fill each gap.

  • Question
  1. I’m Australian but I’ve __ living in the UK for two years.
  2. Bonfire Night is celebrated __ 5 November.
  3. The most interesting thing __ Bonfire Night is the history behind it.
  4. Guy Fawkes tried to blow __ the Houses of Parliament.
  5. He __ caught guarding the explosives.
  6. Bonfire Night reminds people of __ happens if you plot against your own country.
  • Answer
  1. I’m Australian but I’ve been living in the UK for two years.
  2. Bonfire Night is celebrated on 5 November.
  3. The most interesting thing about Bonfire Night is the history behind it.
  4. Guy Fawkes tried to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
  5. He was|got caught guarding the explosives.
  6. Bonfire Night reminds people of what happens if you plot against your own country.

Discussion-讨论

What tradition do you like best from your country?
您最喜欢自己国家的什么传统？

Vocabulary

bonfire

  • 简易

英/ˈbɒnfaɪə(r)/美/ˈbɑːnfaɪər/
n.篝火；营火

复数bonfires

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

bonfire/ˈbɒnˌfaɪə/|TEM8
N-COUNT A bonfire is a fire that is made outdoors, usually to burn waste. Bonfires are also sometimes lit as part of a celebration. (燃烧废物的) 火堆; 篝火

• With bonfires outlawed in urban areas, gardeners must cart their refuse to a dump.
市区禁止户外焚烧垃圾，园林工人必须用推车把垃圾运到垃圾场。

explosion

  • 简易

英/ɪkˈspləʊʒ(ə)n/美/ɪkˈsploʊʒn/
n.爆破，爆炸（声）；激增；爆发，迸发；突发的巨响；某事证实是错误的，推翻

高中 | CET4 | CET6 |

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

explosion/ɪkˈspləʊʒən/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden, violent burst of energy, such as one caused by a bomb. 爆炸

    • After the second explosion, all of London’s main train and subway stations were shut down.
    第二次爆炸后，伦敦所有的主要火车站及地铁站都被关闭了。

  2. N-VAR Explosion is the act of deliberately causing a bomb or similar device to explode. 引爆

    • Bomb disposal experts blew up the bag in a controlled explosion.
    拆弹专家在一次控制爆破中炸掉了那个袋子。

  3. N-COUNT An explosion is a large rapid increase in the number or amount of something. 暴增; 暴涨

    • The study also forecast an explosion in the diet soft-drink market.
    这项研究还预测了低糖软饮料市场的暴增。

  4. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden violent expression of someone’s feelings, especially anger. (情感、尤指愤怒的) 暴发

    • Every time they met, Myra anticipated an explosion.
    每次他们相见，迈拉都预期会有一场怒火暴发。

  5. N-COUNT An explosion is a sudden and serious political protest or violence. (抗议、暴力行为的) 爆发

    • …the explosion of protest and violence sparked off by the killing of seven workers.

to blow up

简明
炸毁；爆炸；给轮胎等充气

  1. The terrorists are threatening to blow up the plane.

    你永远都不知道下一次会有什么东西要爆炸。

  3. He was jailed for 45 years for trying to blow up a plane.

substance

n.物质，材料；主旨，主要内容；重要性；真实性，可信性；毒品；财富，财产；实质，（实在的）东西；<哲> 实体；可靠，稳定；（哲）实体

高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL | GRE | GMAT
复数substances

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

substance/ˈsʌbstəns/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-COUNT A substance is a solid, powder, liquid, or gas with particular properties. 物质

    • There’s absolutely no regulation of cigarettes to make sure that they don’t include poisonous substances.
    绝对没有确保香烟不含有毒物质的规定。

  2. N-UNCOUNT Substance is the quality of being important or significant. 实质

    • It’s questionable whether anything of substance has been achieved.
    是否已取得任何实质性的进展值得质疑。

  3. N-SING The substance of what someone says or writes is the main thing that they are trying to say. 要旨

    • The substance of his discussions doesn’t really matter.
    他讨论的要旨实际并不重要。

  4. N-UNCOUNT If you say that something has no substance, you mean that it is not true. 正确性

explode

  • 简易

英/ɪkˈspləʊd/美/ɪkˈsploʊd/
v.（使）爆炸，（使）爆破；急剧扩大，激增；（情感）迸发，爆发；推翻，破除；爆响，发出巨响；迅速移动

高中 | CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL | GMAT | SAT
第三人称单数explodes现在分词exploding过去式exploded过去分词exploded

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

explode/ɪkˈspləʊd/|CET4 TEM4
explodingexplodedexplodes

  1. V-T/V-I If an object such as a bomb explodes or if someone or something explodes it, it bursts loudly and with great force, often causing damage or injury. 使爆炸; 爆炸

    • They were clearing up when the second bomb exploded.
    他们在清理时第二颗炸弹爆炸了。

  2. V-I If someone explodes, they express strong feelings suddenly and violently. (情感) 迸发

    • Do you fear that you’ll burst into tears or explode with anger in front of her?
    你害怕在她面前突然大哭或勃然大怒吗？

    • “What happened!” I exploded.
    “出什么事了！”我情绪爆发了。

  3. V-I If something explodes, it increases suddenly and rapidly in number or intensity. 暴涨

    • The population explodes to 40,000 during the tourist season.
    旅游季节人数暴涨至4万。

  4. V-T If someone explodes a theory or myth, they prove that it is wrong or impossible. 推翻 (理论等)

    • Electricity privatization has exploded the myth of cheap nuclear power.
    电力私有化打破了廉价核电力的神话。

explosive

  • 简易

英/ɪkˈspləʊsɪv/美/ɪkˈsploʊsɪv/
adj.易爆的，可能引起爆炸的；（局势）一触即发的，爆炸性的；暴躁的，易怒的；激增的；强有力的；（声音）轰响的；（浊音）爆发的，破裂的

n.炸药，爆炸物

CET4 | CET6 | 考研 | IELTS | TOEFL

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

explosive/ɪkˈspləʊsɪv/|CET4 TEM4

  1. N-VAR An explosive is a substance or device that can cause an explosion. 炸药; 爆炸物

    • …one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
    …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

  2. ADJ Something that is explosive is capable of causing an explosion. 能引起爆炸的

    • The explosive device was timed to go off at the rush hour.
    该爆炸装置定在交通高峰时间爆炸。

  3. ADJ An explosive growth is a sudden, rapid increase in the size or quantity of something. 暴涨的

  4. ADJ An explosive situation is likely to have difficult, serious, or dangerous effects. 爆炸性的 (局势)

    • He appeared to be treating the potentially explosive situation with some sensitivity.

  5. ADJ If you describe someone as explosive, you mean that they tend to express sudden violent anger. 脾气暴躁的

plot

  • 简易

英/plɒt/美/plɑːt/
n.阴谋，密谋；情节；（专用的）小块地；（表现两个变量关系的）图表；<美>图表，地图；<美>底层平面图

v.密谋，暗中策划；（在地图上）画出，标出；构思（情节）；绘制（曲线）；绘制（图表）；在图表上标记，布置；用图表说明；计划，制订

复数plots第三人称单数plots现在分词plotting过去式plotted过去分词plotted

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

plot/plɒt/|CET4 TEM4
plottingplottedplots

  1. N-COUNT A plot is a secret plan by a group of people to do something that is illegal or wrong, usually against a person or a government. 阴谋

    • Security forces have uncovered a plot to overthrow the government.
    安全部队已经揭穿了一个推翻政府的阴谋。

  2. V-T If people plot to do something or plot something that is illegal or wrong, they plan secretly to do it. 密谋

    • Prosecutors in the trial allege the defendants plotted to overthrow the government.
    审判的公诉人声称被告曾密谋推翻政府。

    • The military were plotting a coup.
    该军方当时正在密谋政变。

  3. V-T When people plot a strategy or a course of action, they carefully plan each step of it. 制订

    • Yesterday’s meeting was intended to plot a survival strategy for the party.
    昨天的会议旨在制订该党的生存策略。

  4. N-VAR The plot of a film, novel, or play is the connected series of events which make up the story. 情节

    • He began to tell me the plot of his new book.
    他开始向我讲述他新书的情节。

  5. N-COUNT A plot of land is a small piece of land, especially one that has been measured or marked out for a special purpose, such as building houses or growing vegetables. 小块圈地

    • I thought that I’d buy myself a small plot of land and build a house on it.
    我觉得我应该给自己买一小块地，在上面盖一所房子。

  6. V to arrange or divide (land) into plots 划分(土地); 把(土地)分成小块

  7. V-T When someone plots something on a graph, they mark certain points on it and then join the points up. (在曲线图上) 绘制

    • We plotted about eight points on the graph.
    我们在图表上绘出了大约有八个点的曲线。

  8. V-T When someone plots the position or course of a plane or ship, they mark it on a map using instruments to obtain accurate information. 标绘

    • We were trying to plot the course of the submarine.
    我们当时正试图标绘出那艘潜艇的航线。

  9. V-T If someone plots the progress or development of something, they make a diagram or a plan which shows how it has developed in order to give some indication of how it will develop in the future. 用图表展示 (发展趋势)

    • They used a computer to plot the movements of everyone in the police station on December 24, 1990.
    他们使用计算机绘制了图表，来显示1990年12月24日警察局中每个人的行动。

torture

  • 简易

英/ˈtɔːtʃə(r)/美/ˈtɔːrtʃər/
n.拷打，拷问，酷刑逼供；折磨，煎熬；变形

v.拷打，拷问，严刑逼供；造成精神上的巨大痛苦，使忧虑；扭曲

CET4 | CET6 | 考研
复数tortures第三人称单数tortures现在分词torturing过去式tortured过去分词tortured

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

torture/ˈtɔːtʃə/|CET4 TEM4
torturingtorturedtortures

  1. V-T If someone is tortured, another person deliberately causes them terrible pain over a period of time, in order to punish them or to make them reveal information. 拷打; 拷问

    • Despite being tortured she proclaimed her innocence.
    尽管受到拷打，她仍声称自己是清白的。

  2. N-VAR Torture is also a noun. 拷打; 拷问

    • …alleged cases of torture and murder by the security forces.
    …安全部队涉嫌严刑拷打与谋杀的案子。

  3. V-T To torture someone means to cause them to suffer mental pain or anxiety. (精神上) 折磨

cruel

  • 简易

英/ˈkruːəl/美/ˈkruːəl/
adj.残酷的，残忍的；引起痛苦的

v.<非正式>弄糟，使没有成功可能

初中 | 高中 | CET4 | CET6 | IELTS | 商务英语

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

cruel/ˈkruːəl/|CET4 TEM4
cruellercruellest

  1. ADJ Someone who is cruel deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals. 残忍的

    • Children can be so cruel.
    孩子也会这么残忍。

  2. ADV 残忍地

    • Douglas was often cruelly tormented by jealous siblings.
    道格拉斯过去常遭到嫉妒他的兄弟姐妹们的残忍折磨。

    …在一个他们不能承受的严酷世界中挣扎着求生。

  4. ADV 严酷地

    • His life has been cruelly shattered by an event not of his own making.
    他的生活由于一个非他自身因素造成的事件被无情地破坏了。

treason

  • 简易

英/ˈtriːz(ə)n/美/ˈtriːz(ə)n/
n.叛国罪，通敌罪；背叛，不忠，背信；（史）轻叛逆罪（杀害原被效忠者，如仆杀主、妻杀夫等的行为）

考研
复数treasons

  • 《柯林斯英汉双解大词典》

treason/ˈtriːzən/|CET6+ TEM4
N-UNCOUNT Treason is the crime of betraying your country, for example, by helping its enemies or by trying to remove its government using violence. 叛国罪
